loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a blacksmith machine

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel, who lives in Bethlehem, is the father of three daughters. Adel is a physical education teacher, but he has always wanted to have a sportswear store. He saved for a year and a half to fulfill his dream.

Adel's first loan from FATEN helped him to open his own business. Now that the store is prospering and has a good number of clients even outside of the busy summer season, Adel has come to FATEN for a second loan to purchase summer goods.

Adel has been a committed borrower because the store is providing a good income, which has helped him pay for his daughters' school fees.

Adel and one of his daughters appear in the picture above.

loans.use: Purchase summer goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Marly  Luz O. es una persona muy responsable y esto es porque desde que su papá murió siendo aún niña, con sus hermanas vio a su madre enfrentar con responsabilidad este reto de educarlas como personas de bien.  Ella desde que estaba en el bachillerato practicó el hábito del ahorro, pues con el poco dinero que su mama le daba para la merienda, lograba  juntarlo  para comprar productos que luego vendía  entre sus compañeras de clase y obtenía su utilidad, práctica que hoy también realiza  y que le permitió iniciar y sostener  el  negocio de vender mercancía variada;  ella comenta que  con lo que le da su esposo para cubrir los gastos del hogar  ella ahorra y esta es justamente la base de su capital de trabajo que ha fortalecido la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo , mediante créditos y ya tiene alrededor de 7 años de estar vinculada  a esta organización. El negocio de Mary Luz consiste en conseguirle a sus clientes las mercancías que ellos necesiten en la línea de jabones, cremas dentales, papel higiénico, adornos, accesorios, papelería  que exhibe en una pequeña vitrina y  que vende de contado y  de otras mercancías como cosméticos, ropa que suele  dársela a sus clientes para que le paguen a plazos de acuerdo al plan concertado. Mary Luz prefiere clientes que trabajen en empresas, para no tener dificultades con la recuperación de su dinero, porque dice  que “si una persona no trabaja no tiene de donde sacar para pagarle”. Desde que inició en la Fundación su capital de trabajo se ha incrementado y el beneficio de la utilidad de su negocio se refleja en que ha mejorado su vivienda, que  antes estaba en proceso de construcción y ahora ya luce muy adecuada, de igual manera ha comprado un computador para que sus niños estudien y está validando el bachillerato, mientras su esposo trabaja en un restaurante, para sacar entre los dos adelante a su familia. Mary Luz cuenta que tiene una hermana que la acompaña en todos las innovaciones que le  hace a su negocio, pues ella tiene una capacidad creativa maravillosa para envolver regalos, hacer arreglos acordes a cada situación  y la ha ayudado, como cuando Mary Luz se inventó vender a los niños pequeñas sorpresas que incluyeron premios y les dejò este negocio una  muy buena utilidad.  En la actualidad Mary solicita un crédito a la Fundación para comprar mercancía variada y prepararse para venderla el día del amor y de la amistad, porque quiere en su negocio exhibir pequeños detalles bien empacados, que llamen la atención : Cosméticos, cuadernillos, cintas, papel de regalo, adornos, ganchos y accesorios.
El sueño de Mary es hacer de su negocio un gran almacén, donde pueda atender más efectivamente a sus hijos de 3, 8, 10 y 11 años de edad,  desde su hogar y no salir tanto donde sus clientes;  y este es justamente su gran desafío, porque tiene muchos afanes generados por la forma de desarrollar su negocio, pero quiere seguir siendo independiente y construir junto a  su esposo una familia exitosa de la mano de Dios.
texts.en:
Marly Luz O. is a very responsible person. This is because her father died when she was still a girl; she and her sisters saw how her mother responsibly faced the goal of teaching them to be good people. Ever since she was in high school she has practiced the habit of saving. She got together the little bit of money her mother gave her for a snack and bought products that she later sold to her classmates. She got a profit, and she continues to do so now. This allowed her to start and sustain her business of selling varied merchandise. She comments that she saves from what her husband gives her to cover the household expenses. This is indeed the base of her working capital, which the Funcación Mario Santo Domingo has strengthened through loans. She has been involved with this organization for around seven years. Mary Luz’s business consists of getting her customers the merchandise they need like soap, toothpaste, toilet paper, decorations, accessories, and stationery that she displays in a small showcase. She sells these products for cash. The other merchandise like cosmetics and clothes she usually gives to her customers, and they make payments according to the agreed upon plan. Mary Luz prefers customers who work in companies so that she does not have difficulties recovering her money. She says, “If a person does not work, they do not have the means to pay her”. Since she started in the Fundación her working capital has increased, and the beneficial profit from her business is reflected in the improvements made to her house. The house was previously under construction, and now it looks good. In the same fashion she has bought a computer for her children to use in their education, and she is pursuing a high school degree. Her husband works in a restaurant so that between the two of them they can get their family ahead. Mary Luz says that she has a sister who joins her in all of the innovations she makes to her business. She has a marvelous creative capacity to wrap presents and make arrangements for each situation. She helps her. For instance, when Mary Luz came up with the idea of selling surprises that included prizes for small children, it made this business very profitable. Mary is currently requesting a loan from the Fundación to buy varied merchandise to sell for Valentine’s Day. She wants her business to display small items with good packaging, which will call attention to them. She will buy things like cosmetics, small notebooks, ribbons, wrapping paper, decorations, clips, and accessories. Mary’s dream is to make her business a great store. Then she would be able to take care of her children more effectively at home and not have to leave so much to see her customers. Her children are 3, 8, 10, and 11 years old. That is precisely her great challenge. She is very eager to develop her business. However, she wants to continue being independent. Together with her husband she also wants to build a successful family in Gods’ hands.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy varied merchandise like cosmetics, small notebooks, ribbons, wrapping paper, decorations, clips, and accessories in preparation for Valentine' Day sales

loans.name: Ameera

texts.en:
Ameera is a 45-year-old housewife. Her sons and daughters are now able to care for themselves. Her husband is a farmer who plants vegetables and fruit, and then sells his produce to shops in Jenin.

Because her children are grown, Ameera thought she might help her husband by renting a small shop to sell the vegetables and fruits he produces.
Ameera took a $1,000 loan to rent the shop and prepare it to exhibit vegetables and fruits. Ameera sells at a good price in order to have regular customers.

Ala, Ameera's son, appears in the photograph in the Faten office, because Ameera is not comfortable having her picture online.

loans.use: Open a fruit and vegetable shop

loans.name: Nihad

texts.en:
Nihad T. is a working mother from Rafah, a city in the Gaza Strip. She is the mother of Haitham, Maysam, Ala and Aala' who are five, four, two and one year old respectively. Nihad and her husband own a juice stall where they sell all kinds of fresh juice. Nihad works in the shop during the day while her husband, Muhammad, works as a mobile vendor, as shown in the picture above.

Nihad took a $800 loan from FATEN to purchase a professional juicer, which will save time and make juice faster. Nihad and her husband plan to have a juice shop by saving their income from their businesses and by using a second loan from FATEN when the current loan is repaid.

Nihad comes from a conservative background, so her husband, Muhammad, appears in the photograph.

loans.use: Purchase a professional juicer

loans.name: Naheel

texts.en:
Naheel is a 20-year-old married woman. Nihal and her husband, Nidal, own a poultry farm where they breed chicks. Nidal has been working in this field for three years, providing poultry farms with chicks.

Naheel suggested taking a loan from FATEN to purchase a poultry hatcher to speed up the work so they can have a better business. Naheel and her husband have a good number of clients, so they decided on an $800 loan.

Nidal appears in the small farm he owns because Naheel is a conservative woman who is not comfortable having her picture published.

loans.use: Purchase a poultry hatcher

loans.name: Banard

texts.en:
Banard is a 36-year-old married man with two children. To earn a living, he sells timber. He has engaged in this business for eight years. He was previously doing construction work to earn a living. From this earlier experience, he got the idea of opening a timber yard, since there was a need for timber in his local community.

Banard, a member of the Prosper group in Faulu Kenya, is requesting a loan in the amount of 40,000 KES ($500) to purchase an additional stock of timber for re-sale purposes. He hopes to open another business in the future to generate additional income. He describes himself as a hard-working man.

loans.use: To expand his business by purchasing additional timber

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah N. is a 51-year-old resident of Machakos town. She is a widow with three children, all of whom are younger than 18 years old. She has been farming for many years and later opened a retail shop. In her shop, she sells foods such as beans, maize, and peas to generate income for her family. Since she is the sole breadwinner in her family, she strives to educate her three children because she believes education is the key to a better future.

She joined the New Mwala group, whose members guarantee each others' loans from Faulu Kenya. She has previously borrowed two loans from Faulu Kenya, which she timely repaid and used to improve her business. For this reason, she is now seeking another loan, this time in the amount of 40,000 KES ($500). This loan would be used to add to her stock of beans, maize, and peas. She is determined to expand her business into a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., beans, maize, and peas)

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is a 30-year-old married woman with one child. She owns and operates a retail shop, where she sells sugar, bread, sweets, maize, flour, and wheat flour. She has ten years of experience in this line of business.

As a prudent businesswoman, she has been saving her money with Machakos Mwangaza group members in Faulu Kenya. The group members also guarantee each others' loan. She previously took out a loan in the amount of 30,000 KES through the group. She used that loan, which she promptly repaid, to improve and expand her business. By doing so, her group members now have faith in her. Hence, she has been allowed to seek another loan, this time in the amount of 50,000 KES ($625). With the loan proceeds, she would like to buy sugar, maize, flour, and sweets for re-sale purposes. Lillian hopes to expand her business to generate more income so that she can pay school fees for her child. She is ambitious and dreams of expanding her shop into a wholesale store.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., sugar, maize, flour, and sweets)

loans.name: Pura Vida Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Pura Vida inicia su ciclo 37 con 22 socias que realiza diferentes actividades.
Como es el caso D. la Señora Ana A. que es presidenta del Banco Comunal por primera vez y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo del ahorro, Ana es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales 3 hijos estudian, Ana viaja a las ferias D. las provincias D. Huanta y Cangallo en donD. venD. articulos D. ferreteria, con la ayuda eventual D. sus hermanos, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad D. Lima, actividad que realiza los días domingos y los demás días se dedica a la atención D. sus hijos. Sus sueños son apoyar a sus hijos para que culminen sus estudios y ampliar su negocio.
Ana solicita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. linternas, pilas, candados.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Pura Vida” (Pure Life) is its 37th loan cycle with 22 members who are involved in different business activities.

Such is the case with Sra. Ana A., who is serving as President of the Communal Bank for the first time. What she enjoys most is having the incentive to save. Ana is married and has four children, three of whom are students. She travels to the fairs in the provinces of Huanta and Cangallo to sell hardware products with the occasional help of her siblings. Ana acquires her merchandise in the city of Lima. She engages in her business on Sundays and spends the rest of the week taking care of her children. Her dreams incluD. helping her children finish their studies and expanding her business.

Ana is requesting a loan of 900 PEN to invest in the purchase of flashlights, batteries, and padlocks.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flashlights, batteries, and padlocks

loans.name: Resplandor Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Resplandor inicia su quinto ciclo con 19 socias.
Diana es presidenta del Banco Comunal y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitación en temas D. salud y el incentivo en el ahorro.
Diana es soltera y tiene 1 hijas D. 4 años, Diana es natural D. la provincia D. Victor Fajardo y vive en Ayacucho hace 8 años en una casa alquilada, Diana tiene un puesto en el mercado D. las Americas en donD. venD. mercería como ganchos, aretes, tambien artículos D. limpieza y escritorio, actividad que realiza todos los días, su negocio lo inicio hace 3 años. Sus sueños D. Diana son estudiar una carrera D. corte y confección, tener una tienda granD. y una casa propia donD. brinD. comodidades a su hija.
Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. peluches y ganchos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Resplandor” (Brightness) is in its fifth loan cycle with 19 members.

Diana is the Communal Bank President. What she likes most are the health seminars and having the incentive to save. She is single and has a four year old daughter. Diana is a native of Victor Fajardo Province and has lived in Ayacucho for eight years in a rented house. She has a vending post at the Market of the Americas where she sells sewing supplies such as hooks and studs as well as cleaning supplies and stationery. Diana started her business three years ago and works every day. Her dreams incluD. studying for a degree in fashion design, having a large stO., and owning a house so that her daughter can live comfortably. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of plush toys and sewing hooks.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plush toys & sewing hooks

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
H.  Nguyễn Thị (20211030051) is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. H.  owns and operates a manufacturing business, primarily manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members. H.  has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from it.

In 2009, H.  joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. H.  has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA, which was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. H.  is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Hanh from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in the rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H.  Nguyễn Thị (20211030051) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, H.  Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H.  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H.  kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, H.  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H.  đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H.  dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20211030050) is a 23 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 2 infant children.  To making a living, T. owns & operates a business making & selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. T. has been engaged in this business for over a years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. T. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by T. from SEDA. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Nguyễn Thị (20211030050) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi nhỏ.  Để kiếm sống, T. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán thức ăn nhanh & những loại thực phẩm cao cấp khác trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 1 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  T. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Phạm

texts.en:
T. Phạm Thị H. (20211030049) is a 33 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, T. owns & operates a business manufacturing & selling wood products to local businesses and community members. T. has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. T. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by T. from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Phạm Thị H. (20211030049) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, T. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  T. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Ngurn

texts.en: Mrs. Ngurn Ngurng is 51 years old and is a villager who lives in Romiet village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who works very hard to support her two children. She owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. With the farm, she still earns to little income to support her family's costs of living. So she decided to ask for a loan to buy five piglets and pig food for breeding. With the loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve the family's standard of living. Mrs. Ngurn Ngurng is a widow with two children who are construction workers.

loans.use: To buy five piglets and pig food.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian A. feels very happy because she has been able to repay on time the whole amount of the loan she received previously from Kiva through ASHI. Despite the challenge she faced with her previous business of rice retailing, wherein some of her capital was used to sustain her husband’s transportation business, still she feels she made the right decision. It was through the income earned by her husband that she has been able to pay back the amount loaned to her. With what had happen to her business previously, Vivian realized that earnings are greater in the transportation business than in rice retailing. In their community a lot of people are into rice retailing and therefore demand for the rice is low. Now that she has another opportunity to request a loan, Vivian wants to spend it on improving and maintaining her husband’s tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar). She plans to purchase tricycle spare parts and pay for reconditioning. Vivian also wants to venture into another two business which are selling frozen foods (processed foods) and hog raising. After four months of raising her hogs, they will be sold per kilo, either alive or slaughtered, direct to people in their village. Vivian thinks that the frozen foods will be salable because everyone in the community is looking for a convenient way of preparing food for their children before they go to school, just like she did for her children when they were still small. Just like other small children in their village, her apos (grandchildren) are always fond of eating processed food such as marinated pork and chicken and that is why she is inspired to include these in the items she will sell.

loans.use: To recondition her husband's tricycle and to purchase frozen foods to sell and a piglet to raise

loans.name: Phea

texts.en:
Mrs. Phea N. is 39 years old and is a villager in Ta Non village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Von Ngon, are silk weavers at home and aside from silk weaving, Mrs. Phea N. is also a grocery seller who owns a small store to support her business. With both businesses, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. 

In order to support the silk-weaving business and to increase their income to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. Phea N. decided to ask for a loan to buy 10 kilograms of silk to enlarge her business activities. This couple has a child who is attending the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy 10kg of silk

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en: D. Nguyễn Thị (20211030052) is a 41-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. D. is the group leader of this four-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Phù Lưu nhóm 09 (Nhóm 09). D. is married and has three adult children. She operates a family member's business making and selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. D. has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month. In 2009, D. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. D. is now requesting a new loan of 7,392,000 VND which will be used to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business. This loan will be her 2nd from SEDA. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. Trần Thị K. (0) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business. 2. Nguyễn Thị B. (0) is a 43-year-old female who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business. 3. Nguyễn Thị H. (0) is a 28-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất. loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Mrs. Pech S. is 39 years old and lives in Spueu village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1 hectare (2.5 acres) of land that she uses to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Saroeun Soa, is a construction worker who is able to earn a small salary to support his family living. Her husband is shown in the picture with her. They have two children: one is attending a local school while a youngest one is a year old.

This couple works very hard but they still earn less income than needed to support their family. In order to increase their income to improve the family living, Mrs. Pech S. decided to ask for a loan to buy four piglets, pig feed and to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy four piglets, pig feed and to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Khon

texts.en: Mrs. Khon Y. is 51 years old and is a villager who lives in Spueu village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.50-hectare of land to cultivate rice on. In order to support this farm, Mrs. Khon Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox to add to her old one and to buy fertilizer to use for cultivating rice. Her husband, Mr. Chea Hean, is a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family and he also helps his wife on the farm. This couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy an ox and fertilizer

loans.name: Mich

texts.en: Mrs. Mich L. is 52 years old and is a villager who lives in Spueu village, Takeo province.  She is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice on for a living and she works very hard to support her children. In order to support the farm, Mrs. Mich L. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox to add her old one to use for cultivating rice. Her husband, Mr. Phean Pann, is a construction worker where he can receive a small salary to support his family and he also helps his wife on the farm. This couple has five children; two are seamstresses in a garment factory and one is staying at home while the other two are students. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy an ox for rice cultivation

loans.name: Nguyễn

O. owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month. In 2009, O. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. O. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. The loan will be her 2nd from SEDA. loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
P. Nguyễn Thị (20211020026) is a 34 year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, P. owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling rice products in the local community.  P. has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4.500.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, P. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  P. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.256.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  P. is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  P. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding a food preparation business

loans.name: Nget's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members who are located in Roka village, Takeo province. Mrs. Nget B. is 44 years old and is the leader of the group, having been selected by its members. The members of this group will use their share of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Nget B. and her husband, Mr. Srorn Ros, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice, corn and potatoes on for a living. They do not have enough money to support their farm. Thus, Mrs. Nget B. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to pay farming laborers. This couple has four children; three are seamstresses in a garment factory while another one is attending a local school. Mrs. Sdoeung L. who is group guarantor is also present in the picture with the the group loan members.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay farming laborers

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en: Mrs. Nhem T. is 48-year-old married mother who currently lives in the territory of Kompong Tom Province, in Cambodia Country. She is a local chef. She is hired by neighbors to cook meals for their wedding parties and other ceremonies. Her husband works with her at the same business. This couple has two devoted children who are students at the local public school. The family is concerned that their current income is insufficient to meet their needs. Nhem T. wants to invest in the business of selling beds to provide another part of revenue for the family. Because of a lack of capital, Nhem T. is applying for a loan to buy wooden beds in bulk to resell for profit.

loans.use: To buy wooden beds in bulk to resell for profit.

loans.name: Noch

texts.en: Mrs. Noch D. is a 33-year-old married woman and is a villager who lives in Ta Toem village, Takeo province. She is a grocery seller in the local village who owns a small store as a business and with this business, she is able to earn a small income to help support her family. For this business, Mrs. Noch D. decided to ask for a loan to buy Khmer cheese and more groceries to resell. Her husband, Mr. Sokha Nun is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice on and also helps his wife's business. This couple has two children, who are students in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy Khmer cheese and more groceries to resell

loans.name: Emprendedoras Del Valle Triunfo Group

texts.es:
“Emprendedoras del Valle Triunfo”, es una alcancía comunal conformada por  11 socios entusiastas y emprendedores, quienes realizan diversas actividades como: producción,  comercio y servicio, ellos vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desD. hace 4 meses.
Raquel María asume el cargo D. presidenta, tiene 24 años, conviviente, y tiene 2 hijos D. 4, y 6 años.
DesD. hace 2 años se dedica a la venta D. comidas como la papa rellena, caldo D. gallina ceviche, mazamorras, repartiendo casa por casa, se inicio en este negocio porque principalmente le gusta y es una D. las personas que no le gusta estar en casa, siente que debe ser muy productiva y no depender, anteriormente trabajo como obrera en una fabrica D. cartón, actualmente esta construyendo su vivienda, ha logrado comprarse una cocina, su gran sueño es techar su vivienda, ya que solo esta con eternit y tener una tienda propia en su casa.
El reciente préstamo será destinado a la compra D. mercadería (platos, vasos, cucharas descartables, papas y arroz), todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a pagar en los plazos pactados. (Socio en la foto no pudo llegar al desembolso por motivos laborales).
texts.en:
“Emprendedoras del Valle Triunfo” (Entrepreneurs of Triumphant Valley) is a Communal Bank that consists of 11 enthusiastic and enterprising members. They are involved in different business activities in the manufacturing, retail, and service sectors and have been working with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for four months. Raquel María was elected to the position of President. She is 24 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children, ages 4 and 6. For the past two years she has been selling foods door-to-door such as stuffed potatoes, chicken soup, ceviche, and “mazamorra” (corn porridge). Raquel started this because mainly because she enjoys working and is not the type of person who likes staying at home. She feels that she has to be productive and does not want to depend on anyone else. Prior to having this business, she worked as a laborer at a cardboard factory. She is currently building her house and has already purchased a stove. Her greatest wish is to finish the roof of her house since it is the only thing left to be done. She also wants to open a store in her home. This loan will be used to buy supplies such as plates, glasses, disposable spoons, potatoes, and rice. All of the members are happy with the support that has been provided and commit to submitting their payments by the established deadlines. (The member that appears in the corner photograph was not able to attend the disbursement meeting due to work reasons.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plates, glasses, disposable spoons, potatoes, and rice

loans.name: Chhet

texts.en: Chhet C. is a most admirable struggling man from the rural village of Siem Reap province, Cambodia. He is a 46-year-old married man who lives in a small wooden house along with another family. He is a local farmer who has spent almost his whole life in the field Though he seems quite old, he is a man who can manage farming. The members of his house always appreciate and help with his work. He hired his neighbor’s cow to plow his field. Chhet C. has dreamed of having his own cow for a long time but he was not able to make that possible due to a lack of funds. So, he decided to ask a loan through Kiva's project partner, HKL, in order to buy a couple of cows.

loans.use: To buy a couple of cows.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
H. Nguyễn Thị (20203040013) is a 39 year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  H. is the group leader of a 8-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Thôn 1 nhóm 03 (Nhóm 03).


H. is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.152.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Trương Thị M. (0) is a 22 year-old female who is requesting a 7.840.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.


2.  Trương Thị L. (0) is a 20 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  Trương Thị N. (0) is a 38 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


4.  Trương Thị M. (0) is a 45 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


5.  Nguyễn Thị M. (0) is a 39 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector selling home products.


6.  Trương Thị T. (0) is a 33 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Dios Nos Ama Group

texts.es:
L. alcancía comunal “Dios nos Ama”, está conformado por 12 socios emprendedores quienes viven en L. zona alta D. El Agustino, departamento D. Lima, trabajan con EDAPROSPO-prosperidad recientemente.

José Luis tiene 38 años, es padre soltero, tiene 2 hijos D. 8 y 14 años, asume el cargo D. presidente y es una persona luchadora que saca adelante a su familia. DesD. hace 10 años se dedica al transporte como taxista, anteriormente trabajo como cobrador D. ómnibus, logro comprarse un auto pero por necesidad lo vendió, actualmente alquiL. un auto y es así como trabaja. El gran sueño D. José Luis es comprarse nuevamente un carro y tener una empresa D. taxis.

El préstamo otorgado será  destinado para L. impresión D. tarjetas para que el permita una L. mayor captación D. clientes, nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y prometen cumplir con los pagos establecidos en las fechas pactadas.
texts.en:
The “Dios Nos Ama” communal bank is maD. up of 12 entrepreneurial members who live in the upper region of El Agustino, Lima, department of Lima. They work with the recently formed Prosperidad branch of EDAPROSPO. José Luis is 38 years old. He is a single father with two children, ages 8 and 14. He is president of the communal bank and he is a fighter who puts his family first. He has been working as a taxi driver for 10 years and previously worked as a bus conductor. He bought a car but had to sell it out of necessity. Right now, he is renting a car and this is how he is able to work. José Luis’s greatest dream is to buy another car and have his own taxi company. The loan will be used to print business cards so that he can attract more customers. Our members are grateful for the support and promise to make the payments according to the agreed upon terms.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To print business cards in order to attract more customers

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Mrs. Eng L. currently weaves rattan baskets and wooden beds for sale. She sells her finished products to middlemen who come directly to her house. She makes many sets of baskets before selling out. Eng L. has a partner in her husband, who helps her in running the whole business. The couple have four teenage children; all of whom go to school or work as temporary laborers. Eng L. has been very busy with her business as she has many clients, and recently she has gotten a lot of orders from her customers. Because she lacks capital, Eng L. is looking for a loan to purchase raw materials to make enough products to fulfill her customers' needs. She proposes to use any remaining cash from the loan to mend her exiting house that needs repairs.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make enough products to fulfill her customers' needs.

loans.name: Yang

texts.en: Mrs. Yang P. is 54 years old and is a villager who lives in Srae Kruo village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice on for a living. Her husband, Mr. Phorn Yorng, is a cow middleman who is able to earn a small profit to support his family. In order to support her husband's business, Mrs. Yang P. decided to ask for a loan to buy two cows to resell. This couple has four children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory and one is a laborer while the other two are students in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Horm

texts.en: C., a 32-year-old resident of Kompong Tom Province, located about 200 km from the capital, Phnom Penh, currently makes rattan furniture. She has three children, two of whom are teenagers attending school, while the third is a baby. C. constructs ten sets of rattan and then sells them to her buyers for profit. Generally, her valued clients need to order a few days or a week in advance. Additional family income comes from her husband driving a motor taxi. C. is happy to request a loan to purchase raw materials to make rattan furniture to better meet the needs of her buyers.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make rattan furniture to better meet the needs of her buyer.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina S. lives in Lahore, a city famous for its culture and traditions in Pakistan. Married to S. S., who runs a grocery shop in the market, Sakina stitches clothes on order to make income for her family. She has three children, a son who operates a spare parts business, and two daughters, both students.

A regular client of Asasah, Sakina earlier took a loan to help her son start his business. She is now requesting her third loan from Asasah for her husband, who will use the money to expand his grocery shop by adding additional stock. Sakina is hoping that with the loan's help, her husband’s business will become more profitable and her family's living standard will rise.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: El Eden Group

texts.es:
La alcancía comunal “El Edén”, se encuentra ubicada en El Agustino, departamento D. Lima, está conformado por 8 socios, trabajan  con EDAPROSPO-prosperidad desD. hace 2 años.
Juana tiene 28 años, conviviente, tiene 2 hijos asume el cargo D. presidenta, DesD. hace 4 años Juana se dedica a la venta D. comida en las afueras D. un cementerio, además ayuda a unos familiares a vender abarrotes en el mercado los fines D. semana, con el esfuerzo D. su labor diaria asume los gastos D. la educación D. sus hijos.
El gran anhelo D. Juana es construir su vivienda, el reciente préstamo lo utilizara en la compra D. materiales D. construcción. 
Todos los socios agradecemos el apoyo brindado y a la vez nos comprometemos a cumplir con el pago D. cuotas establecidos.
texts.en:
The communal bank group “El Edén” (The Garden of Eden), is located in El Agustino, in Lima department. It is composed of 8 members, and they have worked with EDAPROSPO – PROSPERITY for the last 2 years. Juana, who is 28 years old, and lives with her partner, and has 2 children, is now president. For the last 4 years, Juana has sold meals outsiD. a cemetery, and in addition, she helps some family members selling groceries in the market on weekends. Through the efforts of her daily labor, she is able to assume the costs of her children's education. Juana's greatest wish is to construct her own house. This loan will be utilized to buy construction materials. All the members appreciate the help offered, and at the same time, commit themselves to comply with the established payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING CONSTRUCTION MATERIALS TO BEGIN BUILDING HER HOUSE

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Mrs. Lay D. is 48 years old and is a villager who lives in Spueu village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who works very hard to support her three children, while her husband, Mr. Nann Tea, is a car taxi driver who is able to earn a small income to help support the family. One of their children is a beautician and the other two attend the local school.  In order to support the beauty salon, Mrs. Lay D. requests a loan to buy beautician supplies.

loans.use: To buy beautician supplies.

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
K. Nguyễn Thị (20201060044), a 35-year-old female married mother of two school-aged children, lives in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. For over six years, K. has owned and operated a business manufacturing and selling wood products to local businesses and community members, earning approximately 3.500.000 VND a month.

In 2008, K. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5.600.000 VND from SEDA that was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products, she is now requesting a new loan, her third, of 8.288.000 VND to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. K. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. K. Nguyễn Thị (20201060044) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, K. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán các sản phẩm bằng gỗ cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. K. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, K. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2008, K. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. K. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô để sản xuất các sản phẩm bổ sung. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. K. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Lev

texts.en: Lev M. is 38 years old and lives in a village in Kompong Cham Province. Since early 2008, she has made a living running a store in front of her home where she sells various items such as cooking ingredients, soft drinks, snacks, ice-cream and sweets for children. She typically makes $5 profit a day, which she uses to meet her family’s expenses. Her husband, Phan Oun, 44, is a farmer. This couple has three children, all of whom live at home and work in garment factories. With this loan, Lev M. will buy insecticide, fertilizer, a pump and seeds to use in planting a new crop. If any money is left over, she will use it to buy items to sell in her her store. The loan will help this family improve its standard of living.

loans.use: To buy insecticide, fertilizer, a pump and seeds.

loans.name: Ham

texts.en: Ham P. is a 62-year-old widow with six children, four of whom are married. Most of her children are employed, and Ham P. makes a living by raising pigs and planting crops on a small farm. She has been in this line of work for years and usually earns around $2.50 of profit a day, all of which she uses to meet her family's needs. In the photo, we see Ham P.'s single daughter, who helps meet household expenses by working in a garment factory. Ham P. will use this loan to buy more piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Saira Bano's Group

texts.en: Saira bano lives in the city of Lahore, Pakistan, which is famous for historical sites and Punjabi foods.  She lives in a small, two-room house with her husband and four children, all of whom are very young and in school.  Saira is a caring lady, and has carried out her responsibilities as a housewife and mother very well. For the last 12 years, her husband has made a living as a rickshaw driver, but his vehicle is now old and in poor condition, which makes it difficult to get passengers. That is why Sakina has applied for a loan from Asasah to help her husband buy a new body for his rickshaw.  She is a new member of Asasah and hopes our organization will help her improve her family's life.

loans.use: To buy a new body for her husbands rickshaw, a local three-wheeled motor vehicle

loans.name: Ya

texts.en: Mrs. Ya C. is 56 years old and is a villager who lives in Srae Kruo village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice.  Aside from farming she is also a home pig breeder, which helps earn a small income to help support her family. In order to support the rice farming business, Mrs. Ya C. requests a loan to buy two oxen. Mrs. Ya C. is widow with two children who are seamstresses in the garment factory.

loans.use: To buy two oxen.

loans.name: Set

texts.en: Mrs. Set M. is married and the mother of four school-aged children. She earns a living by raising rice and a few pigs, while her husband works in construction. Recently, her crop is not growing well because it needs fertilizer. That is why Set M. has applied for a loan to buy fertilizer to increase her crop yield and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Mr. Sun S. is a middle-aged man whose wife we see in the photo. For many years, he has made a living by producing jars, while his wife owns a small hairdressing salon where she provides services to their neighbors. The couple does not yet have any children. Recently, demand for jars has been high, but Sun S. lacks the raw materials he needs to meet his customers' needs. He is applying for a loan to make it possible for him to increase his output of jars.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to meet the growing demand for jars.

loans.name: Loeun

texts.en: Mrs. Loeun E. is a 31-year-old married woman who lives in Andoung Thma village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living.  She also sells Khmer cheese in the local market, and in this way is able to earn a small income to help support the family. Mrs. Loeun E. requests a loan to buy more cheese for reselling. Her husband, Mr. Moun Tao, is a construction worker and also helps his wife with the businesses. This couple has three children who all are students in the local school. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy more Khmer cheeses for reselling.

loans.name: Han

texts.en: Mrs. N., 51, is married to Va, 52, who is a local farmer. She breeds pigs in a pigpen behind her house, and she helps her husband grow rice. The couple have five children, three of whom are married and have started new homes. The remaining two are single. The coming rainfall is good for growing, and Mrs. N. needs capital for her farm. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, seeds for planting, and to hire laborers to plow the farmland. With any remaining cash from the loan, she will purchase more pigs for her stall. Mrs. N. was not available when the photo taken, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase products and labor for farm

loans.name: Him's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Him S. is a 30-year-old married woman and is the village bank president, having been selected by the seventeen members of this group loan located in Doung TU. village in Takeo province. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different businesses.  Mrs. Him S. and her husband, Mr. Din Sorn, are farmers who own 1.20-hectare of land to cultivate rice. They work very hard with their farm but they still earn too little income to support their family. In order to increase their income, Mrs. Him S. requests a loan to buy piglets and pig food to start a pig selling business. This couple has three children who all are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en: The five people of this group loan live I. Chrey Tnoat village I. Takeo province. Mrs. Horn T. is a 54-year-old widow and the leader of this group loan having beE. selected by its members. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different businesses. The leader Mrs. Horn T. is a rice farmer who works very hard to support her two childrE. who are students I. the local school. She is also tailor, which helps earns a small profit to increase her income. She requests a loan to buy fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Kousar Perveen

texts.en: Kousar perveen lives with her family in a three-room, brick house in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a seamstress and provides her services to neighborhood clients. She is also a very good mother who worries for the future of her only son who has a welding shop in a nearby market. He welds electric equipment and returns them to working condition. He has been doing this work for over six years. Kousar has applied for a loan from Asasah for her son so he can buy another welding machine. She is hopeful that with this loan, she will be able to help her son in his business in a positive manner.

loans.use: To purchase another welding machine

loans.name: Ses

texts.en: Mrs. Ses S. is 60 years old, married and devoted to three children who are are working at different occupations. She is married to 62-year-old Eang Ten, who owns a plantation where he plants various fruits. She manages the family housework at home and sells fruit at the market to help support her family. Ses S. has been selling the fruit that her husband grows or that she buys from her wholesale supplier for several years. She wishes to buy a larger quantity of fruit to sell to retailers in the market, but she needs a vehicle for transport. To achieve her goal, Ses S. is requesting a loan to purchase a trailer to connect to her existing motorbike so that she can transport more fruit.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for a motorbike

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en: This village loan consists of sixteen members from Pou Doh village in Takeo province. Mrs. Phal M. is 44 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by the other group members. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses. Mrs. Phal M. is farmer who owns 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice while her husband is construction worker who earns a small salary to help support the family. In order to increase their income, Mrs. Phal M. requests a loan to buy a cow for breeding. This couple has eight children; three are laborers, four attend the local school, and the youngest is still at home.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Pum's Group

texts.en: Mr. Pum S. is 37 years old and is the president of this group loan, having been selected by its sixteen members from Thlok Doung Tum village in Takeo province. Each member of this group loan will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses.  The leader Mr. Pum S. and his wife are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living, B. the farm business does not allow them to earn enough to support their family. Thus, in order to make a better life for their family, Mr. Pum S. requests a loan to buy piglets and pig food for breeding. This couple has two children who all are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok K., 43 years old, is married to Sokhom, age 28, and they currently have two school-aged children. This couple has been earning a living as requirement laborers who are also hired by people to harvest their mature fruits or to build their new houses. Sok K. is taking out her first loan to buy an old motorcycle that she and her husband can use to get to work without having to pay for a taxi.

loans.use: To purchase an old motorcycle

loans.name: Srorn's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Srorn K. is 55 years old and is the president of this group loan, having been selected by the thirteen members from Thlok Doung Tum village in Takeo province.  Each member of this village loan will use it to support their different businesses.  Mrs. Srorn K. and her husband, Mr. Mook Soam, are farmers who work very hard to support their family living. Mrs. Srorn K. will use the loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline, and to pay laborers to plow the farm. Her husband is also in the cow breeding business. This couple has two children; one is a vehicle driver and another one is still at home.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline, and to hire farm laborers for plowing.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase sewing materials

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Kea P. is 47 years old and is the village bank president having been selected by the sixteen members from Thlok Doung Tum village in Takeo province.  Each member of this group loan will use their part of the loan to support their different businesses, all in hopes of increasing their income to improve life for their families. Mrs. Kea P. is a grocery seller in the local marK. who earns a small income to support her six children. She will use the loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business. Mrs. Kea P. is widow with six children; three are laborers and one is still at home.  The other two are students and also support their mother with the business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for selling.

loans.name: Zubaida Bibi's Group

texts.en: Zubaida bibi lives in an area named Yadgar which is located in the city of Lahore in Pakistan. She is a housewife and married to S. A. who is an auto rickshaw driver. She has two sons who do not read or write. One of them works in a factory and the other works in a grocery store. Zubaida’s husband has been in the driving profession for the thirty years. For the past seven years, he has driven an auto rickshaw. Zubaida bibi has applied for a loan (3rd time) from Asasah to repair her husband's rickshaw. Zubaida hopes that with the newly repaired vehicle, her husband will feel more comfortable in doing his job and will be able to work longer hours and make more money.

loans.use: Rickshaw repair

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Mẫn

texts.en:
P. Mẫn Thị (20201060046) is a 27-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, P. owns & operates a furniture-making business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members.  P. has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, P. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  P. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.600.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.  P. is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  P. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of the her family.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


P. Mẫn Thị (20201060046) là 27 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, P. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán trang thiết bị gia dụng thông thường cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  P. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, P. kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, P. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  P. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua nguyên liệu thô bổ sung để mở rộng việc giới thiệu sản phẩm.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  P. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện điều kiện sống chung của gia đình người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: For working capital and to purchase additional inventory

loans.use: To renovate business

loans.name: Trương's Group

texts.en:
Nụ Trương Thị (20203040002) is a 61-year-old female living in the town of huyện Y. Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Nụ is the group leader of a 8-member loan group with SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đôngf Thôn 1 nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).


Nụ is married and has 4 adult children. Nụ owns and operates a general store.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling school products such pencils, pens, and notebooks in the local community.  Nụ has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4.000.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Nụ joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nụ has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.256.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.048.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Nụ plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị Nghị (0) is a 53-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her livestock-raising business.


2.  Lê Thị T. (0) is a 47-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her livestock-raising business.


3.  Trương Thị V. (0) is a 41-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her livestock-raising business.


4.  Cao Thị Yến (0) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 6.048.000 VND loan to support her livestock-raising business.


5.  Nguyễn Thị T. (0) is a 30-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her livestock-raising business.


6.  Nguyễn Thị D. (0) is a 27-year-old female who is requesting a 7.840.000 VND loan to support her service-based business.


7.  Trương Thị T. (0) is a 58-year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her livestock-raising business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Nụ Trương Thị (20203040002) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Y. Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  Nụ là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 8 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đôngf Thôn 1 nhóm 01 (Nhóm 01).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các đồ dùng học tập như bút chì, bút viết & tập vở trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Nụ thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Nụ kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Nụ đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.
