Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Đào Thị L. (0) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Trương Thị H. (0) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh nhà hàng.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Bano Begum

texts.en: Bano begum lives in the historical city of Lahore, Pakistan. She is fifty four years old and stays at home to care for her five children — four sons and a daughter. Two of her sons make shoes along with their father who has been doing this work for the last 10 years. They receive orders from the shoe factories and shoe shops and earn profit by filling them on time. The other two work in the fruit market as fruit vendors. Bano has successfully completed two loans from Asasah and now has applied for the third time for her family business. With the loan amount they will buy leather, nails, and shoe polishers in bulk and fill larger orders on time to generate more profit.

loans.use: Purchase materials for shoe making business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to expand the business

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
P. Nguyễn Thị (20203060041) is a 57-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. P. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Thượng Thôn Nhóm 08 (Nhóm 08).

P. is married and has one school-aged child.  To make a living, P. owns & operates a business raising chickens for sale. P. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

P. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,152,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. The loan will be the first loan taken out by P. from SEDA.  P. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) is a 64-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  Trương Thị L. (0) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her butcher shop.


3.  Nguyễn Thị

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock

loans.name: Bilquis Bibi

texts.en:
Bilquis bibi lives in the city of Lahore which is famous for its history and Punjabi food. She is a working woman who sews clothes for her neighborhood clients and earns a reasonable amount every month. Her husband is a fruit vendor; he purchases fruit from the fruit market and sells it in different areas of the community. He has been doing this work for the last 30 years. Bilquis has four children, all of whom are getting an education. She and her husband work full-time to afford their children’s education.

Bilquis has applied for her second loan from Asasah to financially support her husband who wants to buy seasonal fruits for selling. With the loan assistance, she is hopeful that her husband will be able to do well in his business and that his income will be increased.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal fruits for reselling

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam D. owns a shop inside the market, a good location for her to earn an income. In her store, she stocks various groceries. She carries many items such as cooking ingredients, rice, plastic goods, snack foods, and some sweets for children. Sam D. is able to generate around US $5 / day to help cover her family's expenses. She has another wage-earner in her husband who is a military policeman. Sam D. is taking out this loan to purchase another kiosk in the market, where she will store her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase another kiosk in the market, where she will store her inventory

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en: Mrs. S. is an elderly woman whose husband is shown in the photo. She is a rice farmer. In addition to her farming job, she also sells fried banana to the neighbors for a daily profit. Her husband works on the field with her and is also a district policeman. This couple has six single children and a seventh who is now married and lives independently. Mrs. S. requested a loan to plant a rice crop during the coming farming season.

loans.use: To plant a rice crop during the coming farming season

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen lives in the city of Chichawatni in Pakistan. She is the mother of two sons; both of them are illiterate and couldn’t get their education due to financial problems. Both of them sell ice cream to support their family financially. Nasreen’s husband operates a small food stand, where he offers different kinds of food such as “dahi bhalas, pakodas and samosas” to his customers.

Nasreen is very supportive of her family and relatives. Earlier she helped her son start and establish his ice cream business. Now she is applying for a loan to support her brother-in-law who wants to expand his video game shop. With the help of this loan, her brother-in-law will put a larger variety of video games in his shop, which will increase his chances of earning more income.

loans.use: to purchase video games for a games shop

loans.name: Kuorn

texts.en: Kuorn S., 43, is a villager living in Battambang Province. She is a local farmer, growing rice, vegetables, and some fruit on her own farmland. Her husband helps her with the hard physical farming activities. The couple is blessed with three children who currently attend the local public school. Kuorn S. planted different types of vegetables months ago but they are not growing well because they need fertilizer. She has therefore applied for a loan  to purchase many sacks of fertilizer to increase her crop yield.

loans.use: to purchase many sacks of fertilizer to increase her crop yield

loans.name: Anfisa

texts.ru: Ачелдиева Анфиса проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 23 года. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Более 12 лет занимается растениеводством. Арендует земельный участок, где выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений, чтобы получить хороший урожай для продажи.
texts.en:
Anfisa A. lives in the Shahrituz area. She is 23 years old, married, and has two children. She has a high school education. She has been farming for more than twelve years. She rents the small plot where she grows vegetables. She is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers so that she will have a good harvest to sell.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Esmatullah

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is Esmatullah son of G. J.. He lives in Shewah district. He is 26 years old, married and has four children who are in school. He has been busy in agriculture for more than six years. Currently his land is not fertile, so he wants to take an individual loan to purchase high quality wheat seeds and mineral fertilizer to increase his products, to support his family members and make bright his children's future. 

He would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders for their effective loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To purchase high quality wheat seeds

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Chantha C. is a 29-year-old married woman and the leader of this group loan, having been selected by the other members. They all live in Doung Tum village in Takeo province. Each group member will use their part of the loan to support their different businesses. Mrs. Chantha C. and her husband, Mr. Ol Khoem, are farmers who work very hard to support their children. Mrs. Chantha C. will use the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and also to hire laborers to plow her farm. The couple has four children, two who attend the local school and two who are still too young for school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to hire laborers for plowing.

loans.name: Seak

texts.en: Mr. L. is an older man and the father of a child who is already married. L. is a local farmer who has been planting a variety of crops for years. His wife works on the farm with him. In addition to this job, L. owns a few ponds where many small fish grow. He estimates he will catch the fish to sell when they come to maturity, but unfortunately they are not very big due to the lack of food. Because he doesn’t have money, L. decided to seek help from Kiva lenders in the amount of $500 to purchase many sacks of fish food to fatten his fish.

loans.use: To purchase many sacks of fish food.

loans.name: Calister

texts.en:
Calister is a married woman with two children. Her eldest child is in school and the other is still too young for school. She rents a house with no electricity but has piped water. Her husband is a business man who contributes to their family's needs.

Calister has been operating her handcart business for the last three years, and she sells in a shop to her neighbors and passersby. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and the high cost of handcart repairs.

Callister wants to start a hardware shop. She is requesting 80,000 Kenyan shillings (Kshs) to buy locks, hand tools, housewares, paints, fasteners, and pipes to sell in her shop. She already has tents for rent, contributing to her other source of livelihood. The challenge she faces is that of seasonality. She hopes that someday she will open another hardware shop and supply goods to the entire market. She decided to work with Yehu because of the organization responsiveness to customer needs.

loans.use: To purchase locks, hand tools, housewares, paints, fasteners, and pipes.

loans.name: Bul's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Bul B. is 33 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its fifteen members who are located in Prey Lve Lech village, Takeo province. Each member of this village bank loan will use it to support their different purpose.

Mr. Bul B. and his wife, Mrs. Yoeun Chroek, are farmers who own a plot of land they use to cultivate rice for a living. In order to support this farm, Mr. Bul B. will use the loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline.

This couple has two children: one is attending in the local school while the other is a year old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline for his farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He wants to buy necessary things for his farming.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en: Joseline wants a loan to buy a freezer and tables and to pay rent for her business. She is 34 years old and married with seven children between 3 and 19 years old. She lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She owns a restaurant that started eight years ago as a tea room and has grown into outdoor catering. She expects to keep expanding her business and own assets.

loans.use: To buy a freezer and tables and pay rent for her restaurant.

loans.name: Soputheavy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Soputheavy is 50 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its fourteen members who located in Prey Lve Lech village, Takeo province. Each member of this village bank loan will use it to support their different purpose.

Mrs. K. Soputheavy is a desert seller who is able to earn a small income to improve her family living. She is now requesting a loan to buy desert supplies to support her business activities.

Her husband, Mr. Thoeun Nav, is a construction worker who is able to earn a small salary to support his family living. This couple has four children: two are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is a student, while the youngest one is a year old.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making more deserts to sell

loans.name: Nargis Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Nargis parveen has lived in Pakistan in a small city known as Chichawatni for more than fifteen years. Chichawatni is near Harappa, which is very famous for its ancient history. 

Nargis parveen has four children and all of them are studying in different classes. Her husband is a salesman and sells eatable items such as nimko, chips, and biscuits. She supports her husband by doing stitching works. She also sells bed sheets, which she purchases from Faisalabad and other big cities to sell in her own city. 

Her husband wants to purchase his products in bulk to sell and wants to expand his business. Nargis Parveen has applied for a loan from Asasah for this purpose. She is hopeful that this will make her husband’s business more profitable and, as a result, she will gain more respect in her family.

loans.use: Purchase eatable items for reselling.

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Heang C. is 32 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its fifteen members who are located in Prey Lve Lech village, Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use it to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Heang C. is a farmer who works very hard to support her two children. Her husband, Mr. Chea Ouch, is a construction worker and also helps his wife on the farm. In order to increase their income to improve their family living, Mrs. Heang C. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets to raise and pig feed.

This couple has two children, who are both attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and pig feed

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Kan N. is a single mother blessed with two children: one is already married and one is single. Both of her children are employed and provide their income to meet the family’s daily living expenses. 

Kan N. stays at home to do housework and also plants a few vegetables for the dual propose of eating and selling. 

She has requested a loan in order to purchase a secondhand motorcycle to provide transportation for her family, especially to allow to her children to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle.

loans.name: Sarit's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarit H. is 47 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its sixteen members wH. are located in Pou Doh village, Takeo province. Some of members in the photo are blocked by others. Each member of this village loan will use it’s to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Sarit H. is a farmer wH. owns 2 hectares (5 acres) of land she uses to cultivate rice and she is a farmer wH. works very hard to support her five children. Her husband, Mr. Khoeun Dok, is an ice cream seller in the local village from which he is able to earn a small profit to add to his wife’s earnings to improve the family living. This couple has five children: one is a construction worker, one is a seamstress in a garment factory, while the other three are students in the local school.

In order to increase her income to improve the family living, Mrs. Sarit H. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Savorng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Savorng P. is 34 years old is the village bank president, having been selected by its fifteen members who are located in Pou Doh village, Takeo province. Some members in the photo are blocked by others. Each member of this village loan will use it to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Savorng P. is a farmer who owns a plot of land she uses to cultivate rice for a living, while her husband, Mr. Phon Sen, is a laborer who is able to earn a small salary to support his family living. This couple has three children: two are students in the local school while the youngest one is 3 years old.

In order to support her husband’s work, Mrs. Savorng P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband’s transportation needs.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her husband's transportation needs

loans.name: Hajran's Group

texts.en:
Hajran has lived all of her life in a city called Chichawanti in Pakistan. Her husband, M. S., is a daily wage laborer.
 
She is the mother of seven children; five sons and two daughters. One of her sons is a laborer. Others are getting education at a local school. The elder son has a stall in the market selling biryani (a Punjabi rice dish famous in Pakistan).

Hajran has applied for a loan from Asasah to invest in her husband’s work. With the loan, he will buy construction tools. Presently, he rents his tools and pays the rent from the earnings.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Vanny's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny C. is 44 years old and has three children who all are traditional musicians. She was selected by the Pou Doh village bank’s twelve members to be its president. With the proposed loan, the members of this village I. Takeo province, Cambodia, plan to use their loans to support different projects.

Mrs. Vanny C. and her husband, Mr. SokH. Tieng are farmers who work very hard to support their family. They own 1.5 hectares of land upon which they cultivate rice. I. order to increase their income, Mrs. C. will use her loan to buy a cow for breeding.

Some of the members I. the picture are partially blocked from view.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Tanzanite Group

texts.en:
Patricia M., age 35, is married with three children aged 15, 11, and 6 years. She has had a pharmacy business for 10 years now. She works from 8am to 10pm daily and she is able to make monthly profits of about $262.

This will be Patricia’s second Motisha loan (Motisha loans are for clients with good payment histories) from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more medicine and has paid it back successfully. She hopes for a loan to pay for the laborers who are building her small house.

Patricia will share this loan with her loan group Tanzanite, which totals six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Patricia is the first on the right front row.

loans.use: To increase stock by buying more medicine.

loans.name: Samnan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Samnan C. is 28 years old and married to Mr. Boeun Ty, a laborer who earns a small salary to help with his family’s living expenses. The couple has four children; two attend the local school while the other two are too young to study or work. Located in Kab Nuem, Takeo province, their village bank consists of thirteen members who selected Mrs. C. to be its president. The members of this village will use this loan to support different purposes.

Mrs. C. owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates rice. She works very hard to support her family. In order to increase the family’s income, Mrs. C. wishes to use her loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He wants to buy the essential materials for farming.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim C. is 62 years old and is a villager who lives in Angk Svay Chek village, Takeo province. Mrs. C. and her husband, Mr. Chin Chea (who is shown in the photo with her), own 4.2 hectares (10.5 acres) of land upon which they work hard to cultivate rice. This couple has a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

In order to support their farming, Mrs. Sim C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a trailer to transport her harvest.

loans.use: To buy a trailer to transport her harvest

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman who has one child, who attends school. She rents a house with electricity and piped water. She cites school fees and electricity as her greatest monthly expenses. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to his family's basic needs. 

Jane has operated her shop for the past four years, selling to her neighboring community and passersby. She faces the major challenge of theft in the business. Jane is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (Ksh) because she wants to purchase 50 kilograms of rice, 50 kilograms of sugar, cooking oil, and one sack of beans. 

Jane hopes that someday she will operate a wholesale shop and supply goods to all the small-scale retailers. Her main reason to work with Yehu is because of its sustainable financial services.

loans.use: To purchase 50 kgs of sugar, 50  kgs of rice, cooking oil, and one sack of beans.

loans.name: Tutafika Group

texts.en:
Simoni A., age 28, is married with one daughter aged 4 years and 8 months. He has had a fish business for five years now. He works from 9am to 7pm daily and he is able to earn a monthly profit of about $380.

This will be Simoni ’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to develop his skills and his business -- for example, he completed driving lessons and he increased his fish stock. He has successfully paid back his loans.  

Simoni hopes for a loan to further increase his fish stock. His dream is to buy more fish, twice each day. For now he is making just one buying trip every day. 

Simoni is happy with his loans because his business is doing very well. He can even send his little child to a good school now. 

Simoni will share this loan with his loan group Tutafika, which totals 19 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Simoni is first on the left front.

loans.use: To increase his fish stock and develop his skills.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en: Mrs. Sophal P., a 23-year-old married mother of two children who are yet too young to attend school, lives in Chrouy Slaeng village, Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Chhon Chhen, shown in the photo with her, are plate and pot sellers, each earning a small income to support their family living. Since this business is going well, Mrs. Sophal P. wishes to expand and so is requesting a loan to buy more plates and pots to sell. With this business she hopes to increase their income to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more plates and pots

loans.name: Mun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mun Y. is a 46-year-old village bank president selected by the group's 14 members in Kab Nuem village, Takeo Province. With the loans, the members hope to increase their incomes to improve their families' living standards.

Mrs. Mun Y., a Khmer noodle-seller earning a small income to help support her two children, both students, is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy more Khmer noodles to sell. Her husband, Mr. Chea Teng, is a construction worker whose small salary, combined with his wife's income, helps to improve the family's living standard. Mrs. Vanna Nop, a group guarantor, is included in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more Khmer noodles to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: He wants to buy new land and start growing.

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar's Group

texts.en: Shamim akhtar lives in a small city called Chichawatni where her husband sells fruit in the fruit market. She is the mother of five children: four sons and a daughter. Three of her sons work to support the family and the other two children are studying. She is also a working woman who sells ready-made baby clothes. Her husband also drives a rented rickshaw part-time.  Now he wants to buy his own rickshaw to work full time. His own rickshaw will minimize the cost of rent and he will be able to operate it without any time limitations. Therefore, Shamim has applied for a loan from Asasah to buy a rickshaw for him.

loans.use: To purchase a rickshaw

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of eight people living in Thnong RoleU. village, Takeo Province, led by 45-year-old Mrs Sinat S., selected by the group's members as the village bank president. Each member will use their portion of the loan for a variety of purposes.

Mrs. Sinat S. is a farmer and second-hand clothing seller in the local market, able to earn a small income to support her family living. She will use the loan to bU. more second-hand clothes and a sewing machine for the business. Her husband, Mr. SoU. Nheb, is a construction worker whose small salary also helps to support his family. This couple has two children, one a construction worker and the other a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes and a sewing machine

loans.name: Tunda

texts.en:
Tunda is a widow with five children who attend school. She sells charcoal and coconut from home to her neighbors. With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to buy five sacks of charcoal and coconut. She has been in business for three years and runs a beauty salon as her other source of livelihood. Previously she was a poultry farmer.

Tunda's major challenge is seasonality, especially during rainy seasons when she experiences fewer clients and therefore a low volume of sales. She hopes to operate a fresh water shop in the future. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation and availabity of sustainable financial services. She owns a house with no electricity but with piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of charcoal and coconut.

loans.name: Khet's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Khet N. is 55 years old and he is the village bank president having been selected by its ten members. The bank is  located in Thnong Roleung village, Takeo province. The members of this village will use the loans for different purposes. 
Mr. Khet N. is a farmer who owns 1.20-hectares of land where he cultivates rice.  Aside from being a farmer he is also grocery seller at home, and is able to earn a small income to support his family. Since the grocery business is going well, he wants to expand it so he decided to ask for a loan to bU. more groceries. Mr.Khet N. is widower with four children, two are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is vehicle driver and the other stays at home and supports their father's business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Rwahi Women's Group- Ntungamo

texts.en: N. Jean, 45 years old, has had her retail shop in Ntungamo Town for 12 years. She started this business out of savings from her salary as a clerk. It goes without saying that hard work and determination have brought her this far. She has also been getting additional profits from her catering business. She is fully able to live within the ways and means of her business. To reach this milestone, she has gone through the many challenges that plague all businesses. In her case, being a widow, she has had to grapple with the operational costs of her business alone. Her strong resolve has seen her through all this. All her children describe her as a loving mother who has seen them through adversity and who has, most importantly, given them an education. In a week, her business generates reliable profits of 200,000 UGX. With this loan, she wants to buy more retail stock such as bars of soap, plastics, bags of sugar and edibles for her shop.

loans.use: buying more retail items such as sugar, soap and plastics

loans.name: Busra Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Busra bibi works very hard to afford her children's education expenses. She decided to work as a cosmetics seller in order to give them the best possible education. Busra bibi lives in the city of Chichawatni, in Pakistan. Her husband, M. A., is a cook by trade while she operates a little shop in her home selling beauty products. She wants to expand her business by adding more beauty products such as creams, cosmetics and hair colors. She is hopeful that she will be able to put her children in a better school by increasing her profits.

Note: In the photo, Khursheed, one of the group members, is showing her decorative brocades, which are specifically used in marriages and worn by the groom.

loans.use: Purchase beauty products for reselling

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Sroeung C. is 56 years old and is the village bank president having been selected by its sixteen members. The bank is located in Ou village, Takeo province. The members of this village bank will use the loans for different purposes. 
Mr. Sroeung C. and his wife are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. With this farm they face a problem because they do not have enough money to support their farm field. Thus, Mr. Sroeung C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to cultivate rice. Aside from being a farmer, his wife is also a pig breeder at home and she is able to earn a small income to improve the family living. This couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie Z. has successfully completed her payments on time to KIVA through ASHI. While continuing her previous business of making sweet delicacies and selling them, she is now requesting a loan to finance another type of business, raising chickens in 45 days for selling. Once they are sold, she will again buy replacements to sustain her business. Rosie also wants to resell low-priced clothing to her neighbors since their village is far from the market and people would not have to pay transportation fees to shop for clothes. Rosie thinks that, instead, their money could be used for other necessary purchases. 

Rey, Rosie’s husband, feels that achieving their dream to give their child a comfortable life is now easier because both he and Rosie are helping each other earn money for their family cash flow. Rosie feels that with the support and love of her husband, she will never stop working hard and expanding her business, especially since ASHI and KIVA are giving her the opportunity to receive a loan.

loans.use: To purchase chicks for raising and materials to make a cage; to purchase low-priced clothing to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to complete his stock, buy more seeds and ready his land for cultivation

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.ru: Авлякулова Муяссар проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 36 лет. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Арендует небольшой земельный участок, где выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений, чтобы получить хороший урожай.
texts.en:
Muyassar A. lives in the Shahrituz area. She is 36 years old, married, and has five children. She has a high school education. She has been farming for more than ten years. She rents the small plot where she grows vegetables to sell. She is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers so that she will have a good harvest.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Khon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khon E. is 32 years old and is the village bank president having been selected by its fourteen members. The bank is located in Ou village, Takeo province.  The members of this village bank  loan will use the loans for different purposes. 
Mrs. Khon E. and her husband, Mr. Vin Hong, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Khon E. will use their loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to buy gasoline. This couple has three children who all are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to buy gasoline for the family's farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products, especially items that are more in demand

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kong N. is a 30 year old married woman and is the village bank president having been selected by its eleven members. The bank is which located in Ou village, Takeo province.  The members of this village bank will use the loans for  different purposes.
Mrs. Kong N. and her husband, Mr. Tola Chann, are farmers who own 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice. They the work very hard to support their four children.  Mrs. Kong N. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer . Aside from being a farmer, Mr. Tola Chann is also a secondary teacher who is able to receive a small salary to support his family. Three of this couple's children are attending  the local school while another one is 2 years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Itojo Twimukye Women's Group- Ntungamo

texts.en: 15 years is the time 45-year-old M. Bibian has spent overseeing her soft drinks depot business in Itojo, Ntungamo after dropping her former profession of teaching. Not that she held it in low value, but she just wanted new challenges. She is quick to describe herself as trustworthy, sociable and a go-getter. At her operating place in Itojo trading center, she has quite a following. Her customers are mostly small scale traders .She has used monthly profits of 300,000 shillings to improve her family's welfare. She also makes a side profit from her banana plantation and farm. She is married with four children and with this loan, she wants to purchase more crates of soft drinks in addition to the tea that she will later resell.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks like sodas for her business

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en:
Arafa is a single woman who, for the last 16 years, has been selling fresh water and food to her neighbors and passersby from her home. She also sells school uniforms as her other source of income. With the Kshs 40,000 loan she is requesting, Arafa wants to purchase a freezer and start another business selling soft drinks. She faces the major challenges of competition and seasonality. Her main goal is to become a wholesaler in the future.

Arafa decided to join Yehu in order to access loans and expand her business. She owns a house with electricity and piped water, and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his business and buy more seeds for his farming

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en: Mrs. Vannak N. is 56 years old and a widow with six children.  She is a villager who lives in Pong Teuk Tboung village, Takeo province. Mrs N.  is a farmer who owns 1-hectare of land to grow rice. She works very hard to support her family. Aside from being a farmer, Mrs N. is also a cake seller in the local market. She is able to earn a small income to help the family. In order to increase income and to improve the family living conditions, Mrs. Vannak N. decided to ask for a loan to buy six piglets and pig food for her new business. Of her children, two work in security, one is seamstress in a garment factory and  the other three are students who also help in their mother's  businesses.

loans.use: To buy six piglets and pig food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase the required tools

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en: Mrs. Sarin N., (pictured here with her husband, Mr. Vanna Leam) is 42 years old and  lives in Tuol Kandal village, Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who own 4-hectares of land where they cultivate rice. Mrs. Sarin N. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, to pay for laborer to plow her farm and to buy pesticide. Aside from being a farmer, Mr. Vanna Leam is also a construction worker who is able to receive a small salary to help his family. This couple has three children, one is seamstress in a garment factory while the other two are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, to pay for a laborer, and to buy pesticide

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally E. is 41 years old and is a villager who lives in Si Sla village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1.5 hectares of land to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Thol Sao, is a high school director who is able to receive a little salary to support his family. 
Mrs. Phally E. is requesting a loan partly to pay for her children's school fees and the rest to buy rice seed to cultivate rice. The couple has four children who all are students and also support their mother on the farm. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a father of four sons. He owns a farm in Rafah, a city in the Gaza Strip, where he raises goats and sheep. Mahmoud provides butchers with goats, and since the holy month of Ramadan is around the corner, he wanted to increase the number of goats he sells in order to increase his returns.

A $1,000 loan from FATEN helped Mahmoud to purchase the goats and guarantee a better return this season. Mahmoud is also trying to save money, because his oldest son is 15, and he will need money soon to pay for his children's college education.

In the video, Mahmoud appears on his farm.

loans.use: Purchase goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his land and purchase high quality wheat seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah is married with five children and all her children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  Hadjah changed her business enterprise from selling second-hand clothing to selling charcoal. She has been in this charcoal business for a few months.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal.  Hadjah decided to change her enterprise to charcoal because  many people were engaged in clothing .  Besides this charcoal business, she sells piped water to earn additional income .  Her customers are fellow market vendors and works six days a week.  Her business challenges include transportation and seasonality.  Hadjah decided to work with MCDT because it was helping low-income women to work hard by giving them capital.  She resides in and owns a two-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, market dues and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Javzbegim

texts.en:
Javzbegim A., 39 years old and married with two children, sells fabrics for sewing the national dresses. In business for three years, she has very good taste and is always ready to advise her clients about the appropriate textile to choose for any occasion, two reasons she has many customers. Moreover, Javzbegim’s fabric prices are attractive for various levels of the population as she has a wide range of goods for any taste and any budget.

The income that she derives allows her to educate her dear children, and she hopes that she can continue to provide for them so they can receive an adequate education. Now Javzbegim needs $1500 USD to purchase new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for sale. She promises to repay the loan without any violation and expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for sale

loans.name: Massamaesso

texts.en: Madame Massamaesso P. is 33 years old and lives in Lome, Togo. A mother of one and wife of a police officer, she has been selling pagnes, a traditional Togolese wax-printed cloth, since 2006. She sells them at the largest market in Lome. In order to continue her success as a merchant and to offer more diverse merchandise to her customers, she has requested a loan of 200,000 CFA to purchase more pagnes. This is her first time taking a loan from WAGES. With this loan, she hopes to increase her sales in order to provide for her child.

loans.use: To purchase pagnes

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
M. Dilbar is a 40-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of three children. Dilbar has a grocery store which she attends to herself, aside from caring for her family and her home. She began her small business 15 years ago with financial support from her husband who is a farmer. The reason for starting the business was to increase her large family’s income and the business has been gradually growing ever since. The business went well after it started. 

Over time Dilbar expanded her business and now her grocery store is well known in her community.  In order to expand her business she requests a loan of $1500 US Dollars. Dilbar is planning to use the loan to purchase more goods to resell, thus increasing the range of foodstuffs she sells. She thanks everyone who decides to support her.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Sahro

texts.ru: Ваисова Сахро проживает в районе Кабадиян. Возраст, 51 год. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж работает в больнице. Сама Сахро более 6 лет занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить количество скот.
texts.en:
Sahro V. lives in the Qubadiyon district. She is 51 years old, married and has 5 children. Her husband works at a hospital. Sahro has been involved in animal husbandry for over 6 years. She breeds livestock at home. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle in order to increase the quantity of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Arlindo Domingos

texts.pt:
Arlindo Domingos D., nasceu na Província de Gaza, vive maritalmente é pai de 7 filhos de 2, 7, 15, 18, 25, 27 e 31 anos os quatro mas novos é que vão a escola. Vive na casa própria com sua família e sustenta sua mãe que vive em Gaza enviando lhe algum valor monetário para despesas caseiras. 

Arlindo quando freqüentava a 9ª classe é recrutado para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório, após a independência é desmobilizado e passa a trabalhar como Policia de Guarda Fronteira. Hoje é chefe de repartição da informação e plano (guarda fronteira) ha mais de 30 anos, auferindo um salario de 13.978.31 que aplica nas despesas de casa e da obra. Esta a gerir um estabelecimento comercial no quartel, de nome (sondela) pagando 1.000.00mt mensal de aluguer, conta com ajuda de 3 empregados que auferem 1,200.00mt por individuo, tem como melhor produto de venda guisados, assados e petiscos tendo de lucro cerca de 10.000.00mt mensalmente onde também consegue poupar cerca de 2.000.00mt mensalmente porque também conta com ajuda da sua esposa que é docente.

 Já teve empréstimo noutra instituição e pagou cem problemas. Este é o primeiro empréstimo de Arlindo na Hluvuku e Kiva no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos(óleo, arroz, refeições e outros). Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo para construção do seu próprio estabelecimento.
texts.en:
Arlindo Domingos was born in the province of Gaza. He is in a common law marriage and is the father of 7 children who are 2, 7, 15, 18, 25, 27 and 31 years old. The youngest four are in school. He lives in his own home with his family and also supports his mother who lives in Gaza sending her some money for her household expenses. Arlindo was drafted for mandatory military service when he was in 9th grade. After the country's independence he left the service and started to work as a Border Patrol officer. He has been the Head of the Information and Planning Department of the Border Patrol for over 30 years. He earns a salary of 13,978.31 meticais, which goes towards household and construction expenses. He currently manages a business in the barracks named Sondela. He pays a rent of 1,000 meticais and is helped by 3 employees who make 1,200 meticais each. His bestselling products are stews, roasts and appetizers. He has a profit of 10,000 meticais and saves around 2,000 meticais per month since he is also helped by his wife who is a teacher. He has had loans with other institutions and paid them back without any problems. This is Arlindo's loan with Hluvuku and Kiva, in the amount of 25,000 meticais. He intends to purchase inventory (cooking oil, rice, meals and others). He is confident he will pay the loan back ahead of schedule and request another loan to build his own shop.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of inventory (cooking oil, rice, meals and others)

loans.name: Abdurakhmon

texts.en:
T. Abdurakhmon is 32 years old. Together with his wife they have 3 children. Bakhtiyor is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than 10 years. He is baking the national bread “lepeshka” at home. His wife helps him with his business. 

Having many customers Abdurakhmon is selling the majority of his products just from his place. However, he is also running the trading place in the central local market for selling lepeshka. 

Now Abdurakhmon requests $1500 USD. He is planning to purchase flour at wholesale as required for his business. Abdurakhmon is grateful for all supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour

loans.name: Tutiniso

texts.en:
Tutiniso has built a profitable business selling kid’s clothing at the busy central market called “Panjshanbe” in Khujand. She has done well by concentrating on a product that she is interested in and where there is not a lot of competition. Tutiniso has been in business for 15 years. She is looking forward to developing it and making it successful. Tutiniso is married and has two children. She is doing all she can to ensure the best future for them. Anorkhol has requested a loan for $1500 USD to purchase additional inventory for the summer season. Previous loans from “IMON International” have been a great help to Tutiniso.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
