loans.name: Vilma Leonor

texts.es: la sra. Vilma se dedica a la Elaboracion y venta de Tortillas, le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que asi puede obtener ingresos con los que sostiene a su familia, ella es Madre soltera, cuenta con dos hijos que estan estudiando, desde muy temprano comienza con la elaboracion de las tortillas, ya que tiene clientes en varias colonias y tiene que salir a repartir su producto, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maseca, leña y carne, ya que por las noches se dedica a vender comida, su metas es llegar a graduar sus hijos y poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Vilma works making and selling tortillas. She enjoys her work because it provides her with an income that she can use to support her family. Vilma is a single mother with two children who are in school. She begins making the tortillas early in the morning, because she has customers in various parts of the city and she has to leave to deliver her products. Vilma will use this loan to buy corn flour, firewood and meat, because she also works selling food in the evenings. Her goal is to have both her children graduate from school and to be able to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn flour, water, lime, firewood, matches and meat

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es: Abelardo, de 64 años, vive en su casa que es propia, junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos.De lunes a viernes trabaja como cargador, y durante  los fines de semana labora junto a su esposa en la confección ropa.  Él se encarga  de trazar y cortar en bloque las telas de acuerdo a la medida de las prendas, y su esposa las arma para que queden uniformes. Su taller se sitúa en el segundo piso de su casa, ambiente propicio, en donde trabajan hasta altas horas de la noche. Su mayor alegría es que realiza el trabajo, al lado de su compañera de toda la vida, juntos y gracias a la  labor constante, han sacado adelante su taller. En la actualidad  también su hija mayor trabaja con ellos; aunque dice que la mayor dificultad es que  todavía  no han logrado  realizar  los acabados de las mangas y cuellos de las prendas, porque no tienen la maquina para esta labor, pero para mas adelante piensan comprarse una máquina recubridora, para realizar los acabados de mangas y cuellos, y de esta manera esperan obtener mayores ganancias.Es el  doceavo préstamo que tiene con MFP y sabe que el dinero le será muy beneficioso para mejorar  su capital de trabajo, y también con el desempeño de sus compañeras de grupo se siente muy satisfecho, porque son  personas responsables en sus actividades.Abelardo tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la reparación de su máquina de coser, y también desea comprar algunos accesorios, para continuar  confeccionando sus prendas con mayor tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Abelardo, 64, lives in his own home, together with his wife and his 2 children. From Monday to Friday he works as a porter, and in the weekends he works with his wife making clothes. He deals with the tracing and cutting of the bulk fabrics in accordance with the measurements of the garments, and his wife makes them so that they remain uniform. Their workshop is on the second floor of their home, in a favorable spot, where they work late into the night. His greatest joy is that he is doing this work, next to his lifelong parter, together and thanks to constant work, they have gotten their workshop off the ground. Currently their eldest daughter is also working with them; although he says that the greatest difficulty is that still they have not succeeded in doing the finishings of the sleeves and collars of the garments, because they don't have the machine for this job, but in the future they are thinking of buying themselves a coverstitch machine, to finish off sleeves and collars, and in this way they hope to earn more profits. It is the twelfth loan that he has had with MFP and he knows that the money will be very beneficial for improving his working capital, and also he is feeling very satisfied with the performance of the members of the group, because they are people who are responsible with their businesses. Abelardo has planned to invest the requested money on the repair of his sewing machine, and he also wants to buy some accessories, in order to continue making his garments without any worry.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his sewing machine and buy some accessories for his business

loans.name: Amistad 6 Group

texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of her group Amistad 6 (Friendship). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 3 children.

Juana is excited to be taking her 5th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and expanded her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying underwear, which she sells in her beauty salon. She will use the profits to buy some school supplies and to improve her businesses. She wants to change their structure and get more clients so that her income will increase, She will then have the opportunity to help her family more and build her house.

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy underwear

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, seed and small tools

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 25 años, es una joven muy sencilla y alegre, vive en casa de sus padres junto a sus dos hermanos y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Es entonces, que todas las mañanas, pastea su ganado por la cumbre de los altos y verdes cerros del Poblado de Cumutay (Distrito de Tarma), gracias a este esfuerzo que diariamente realiza, su ganado esta muy bien alimentado, motivo por el cual, cuando los lleva a vender a la feria de Tarma, son rápidamente comprados. Sabe que todo esfuerzo tiene su recompensa, es así que le dedicó tiempo y cuidado a sus animales, de esa manera han transcurrido 3 años, aunque en este tiempo, siempre le ha resultado pesado trasladar su ganado hasta la ciudad. Con el tiempo espera incursionar en la agricultura, para así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si desea acceder a otro crédito en el futuro, en su grupo comunal, es una socia muy responsable y siempre esta al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan en sus reuniones. Con los mil soles que solicita, comprará forraje para sus animales, para que puedan estar más sanos y fuertes.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 25, is a simple and cheerful young woman who lives at home with her parents and her two brothers. What she wants most is to improve her quality of life. This is why she grazes her cattle every morning along the high ridge and green hills of the town of Cumutay in the district of Tarma. Thanks to her hard work each day, her livestock are very well fed, which is why when she brings them to the Tarma fair, they are quickly sold. She knows that all this effort has its rewards, which is why she has dedicated her time to care for these animals over the past three years. At this time, she is taking her cattle to the city, as well. With time, she hopes to further explore agriculture, so that she can increase her income. This is her 7th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner), and she knows that she has to make all her payments on time if she wants to get another loan in the future. She is a very responsible member of her community bank and keeps up to date of all the agreements that are made at their meetings. With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy forage for her animals so that they will be healthier and stronger.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy forage for livestock

loans.name: Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Doña Auxiliadora tiene la edad de 39 años, madre soltera de tres hijos, desde hace varios años logro, comercializar la venta de ropa usada, vendiendo ambulante, y en su casa.
Casa que poco a poco ha ido construyendo, es pequeña, de bloque, y a un de tierra. Que espera mejorar.
No ha sido nada fácil para ella, ya que cuando las ventas están bajas se preocupa ya que no cuenta con el apoyo de nadie, es por eso.
Necesita invertir más en ropa usada como nueva, y otras variedades para mejorar las ventas y poder obtener las ganancias para lograr pagar sus gastos. 
Con este préstamo comprara: una docena de pantalones de dama, una docena de camisetas,  una docena de camisas de varón, una paca de ropa, para vender ya que tiene poco en inventario. Y no cuenta con mucho capital lo que la inversión viene hacer de gran apoyo al pequeño comerciante.
texts.en:
Doña Auxiliadora is 39 years old and is a single mother to 3 children. For several years she has sold second-hand clothes door to door and at her home. Little by little she has built her house. It is small and made from concrete blocks and earth andshe hopes to improve it over time. Things haven't been easy for Auxiliadora, and when sales are low she worries that she doesn't have anyone else's support. For this reason she needs to invest in more second-hand and new clothes and a greater variety of clothes to improve her sales and make enough money to cover her costs. With this loan she will purchase: a dozen pairs of women's pants, a dozen shirts, a dozen men's shirts and a pack of used clothes to sell as she has little in her inventory at the moment. Auxiliadora doesn't have much working capital so this loan will be of great support for a small businessperson.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchased second-hand clothes, new pants and shirts

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Felix, tiene 70 años, vive con su esposa e hijos, el se dedica al servicio de transporte desde hace 10 años aproximadamente, realiza el servicio de taxi en la ciudad de ica y anteriormente realizaba el servicio de colectivo a marcona, dandole a sus clientes la seguridad de un buen servicio, Felix solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas nuevas para su automovil y también para la renovación del soat entre otros arreglos que desea hacerle a su auto, se le brinda el crédito por su capacidad de pagos y por buenas referencias personales.
texts.en:
Felix is 70 years old, and lives with his wife and children. He has dedicated himself to providing transportation services for approximately the past 10 years. He provides taxi services in the city of Ica, and previously provided a colectivo (shared taxi) service to Marcona. He always provides safe transport and an excellent level of service. Felix is requesting a loan in order to buy new tires for his automobile, to renew his SOAT (obligatory auto insurance), and to make other repairs. He is being extended credit due to his ability to make the payments, and because of good personal references.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To renew his auto insurance (SOAT).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make improvements to her business locale and buy snacks.

loans.name: Gabi

texts.es: Gabi, de 35 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Andrés de 34 años y sus 2 pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy niña aprendió la actividad familiar, que es la agricultura, desde entonces cultiva papa, alverja, trabajo que le ha brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. Todo lo cosechado, lo vende en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, que es donde mejores precios obtiene por sus productos. Han transcurrido 25 años, y aún disfruta de la siembra, sin embargo el tener que transportar sus productos al mercado mayorista, le ha sido difícil por la escasa movilidad que hay. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, con el fin de incrementar su producción. Este es su séptimo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus créditos y espera serlo también ahora, en su grupo comunal es muy activa y es muy querida por el resto de las socias. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Gabi, 35 years of age, is a mother and a cheerful worker. She lives in her own home with her husband Andrés, 34 years of age, and her 2 small children for whom she hopes to provide a better quality of life. She learned the family business, farming, when she was still a young girl. Since then, she has cultivated potatoes and peas, work that has provided the necessary income to help support her family. She sells everything she harvests at the wholesale market in Tarma, which is where she can obtain better prices for her product. She still enjoys working the land after 25 years, even though she has to transport her products to the market -- a difficult task, given the scarcity of transportation in the region. Over time, she would like to purchase new lands in order to increase her output. This is her seventh loan with MFP; she has been very timely with repaying her loans, and hopes to be punctual again on this occasion. She is very active in her cooperative, and well liked by the other members in her group. She plans to use the one thousand Peruvian soles she is requesting to purchase more fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizers.

loans.name: Gloria Marlene

texts.es:
la sra. Gloria Marlene R. C. se dedica a la venta de mercaderia como ser ropa y zapatos, lociones.
tiene seis años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
Asi mismo los fines de semana elabora Nacatamales ya que tiene muchos clientes y se los encargan porque son muy ricos, esta casada y junto a su esposo han logrado sacar adelante a su familia, el credito lo utilzara para
comprar mercaderia varias y poder salir a vender a comunidades cercanas. Doña Gloria es una mujer 
muy activa y disfruta mucho lo que hace.
texts.en:
Gloria Marlene R. C. dedicates herself to selling merchandise such as clothing, shoes, and lotions. She has dedicated herself to this type of activity for six years. Likewise, on weekends, she makes nacatamales (steamed corncakes). She has a number of customers who demand her food because it is so delicious. She is married and, together with her husband, has managed to help her family get ahead. She will use the loan to buy a variety of merchandise, and then travel throughout the neighboring communities to sell her goods. Gloria is an active woman, who very much enjoys what she does.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, tiene 65 años, es un hombre que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Francisca de 55 años y su última hija María de 11 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En el poblado de Cumutay, Provincia del distrito de Tarma, se encuentran las chacras de Jorge, sus tierras son amplias y con los cuidados que les brinda la ha convertido en uno de los cultivos mejores trabajados del poblado, es por eso que cuando lleva a vender papa y alverja al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, obtiene muy buenos precios debido a la buena calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles, lleva 50 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga que afectan su desarrollo. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras en otros poblados para así aumentar su producción y variar sus cultivos. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy responsable y siempre esta pendiente de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la productividad de sus chacras.
texts.en:
Jorge is 65 years old, and a man who has always fought hard to overcome life’s obstacles. He lives in his own home with his wife Francisca, who is 55, and his youngest daughter María, who is 11 years old. They are the reason for all of his daily efforts to succeed. Jorge’s farmlands can be found in the town of Cumutay, located in the district of Tarma. He has ample acreage and, given the care with which he tends to his soil, he has converted his farm into one of the best producing enterprises in town. Because of the excellent quality of his produce, he obtains very good prices when he sells his potatoes and peas at the wholesale market in Tarma. The aspects he enjoys most about his work are planting his crops and endeavoring to make the soil fertile. He has been a farmer for 50 years, and finds the most challenging aspect of his profession to be protecting his crops against plagues that affect his plants’ growth. Over time, he hopes to buy farmland in other towns in order to increase his output and diversify the types of crops he grows. This is his seventh loan with MFP, and he knows he must make his payments on time if he wants access to credit in the future. He is a very responsible member of his cooperative, and is always cognizant of the obligations his group enters into. He will use the three thousand Peruvian soles requested to buy more fertilizers, to increase the productivity of his lands.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Diana Maria

texts.es:
En un barrio de Barranquilla donde el bingo y el festival de las cervezas es muy usual, para recaudar fondos comunes,porque lo conforma gente muy solidaria, Vive y tiene su negocio Diana María M., allí se dedica a la elaboración de comidas especialmente fritos y almuerzos. Ella  tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 12 a 27 años de edad, es separada y en la actualidad tiene a su cargo los dos hijos menores, a través del ingreso generado por este negocio.

Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que planea invertirlo en la compra del techo para su carro  de perros calientes,  o sea en una carpa y el  resto lo invertirá en materias primas como arroz, aceite y harina en mayor volumen.

Desde sus 13 años  Diana María comenzó a trabajar como empleada del servicio doméstico, hasta llegar a los 40 años, momento en el que decidió cumplir su sueño de niña: "el de tener un negocio propio", así fue como inició con la venta de fritos como patacones con  una ponchera en la puerta  de su casa;  luego amplió el negocio agregándole papas rellenas de carne o pollo y mixtas,  pasteles, almuerzos y así ha surgido y ha contribuido de manera importante con el sustento de su familia, especialmente de sus 2 hijos  a cargo,  levantándolos con esfuerzo y trabajo persistente,  por no tener el apoyo de su padre. Su sueño grande es tener una casa propia, ampliar su negocio con mayor variedad de comidas rápidas. Ahora su gran desafío es que sus hijos mayores sean independientes y también adecuar su negocio a las condiciones que exige la convivencia del barrio, así como cuando debió reemplazar rápidamente su trabajo en leña por una estufa a gas, ella se sintió mas cómoda y sus vecinos también.
texts.en:
Bingo and the beer festival are popular Barranquilla events where the community can earn money, because it is a community comprised of people with a great sense of solidarity. Diana María M. is a resident and has her business here, where she dedicates herself to making fried foods and lunches. She has 5 children ages 12 to 27, is separated and currently still cares for her two younger children. She makes her living through her business. This is her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She plans to invest the funds into the purchase of a cover for her hot dog vending cart. She will invest the rest into buying basic ingredients in bulk, such as rice, cooking oil, and flour. When she was 13 years old, Diana María started working as a domestic, an activity she carried out until she turned 40. At that point, she decided to make a childhood dream a reality: to have her own business. This is how she got started selling fried foods such as patacones (fried plantains) from the front porch of her home. She later expanded her business by adding papas rellenas (stuffed potatoes) of beef, chicken or mixed, cakes, and lunches. This activity that has gone a long way in sustaining the family, especially the two youngest children that she still supports. She has triumphed through her own effort and work ethic, given the lack of support from their father. Her biggest dreams are to own a house and to expand her business with a greater variety of fast foods. Currently, her greatest challenges are to see her older children become independent and to outfit her enterprise to meet the neighborhood’s demands. So, when she had to replace her wood stove with a gas one, she was able to work and serve her neighbors more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cover for her hot dog vending cart, and to buy basic ingredients such as rice, cooking oil and flour in bulk.

loans.name: Jhon William

texts.es:
Jhon de 21 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con aminos de tierra y lomas en disolución), El tiene un centro de fotocopiado, desde que salio del colegio para ayudar con los gastos familiares. 

Desde pequeño su papa le enseño a trabajar en fotocopiado, pero cuando creció no tenia oportunidades de trabajar en otra parte, invirtió sus ahorros en una fotocopiadora y hojas poco a poco consiguió tener una computadora.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una fotocopiadora para incrementar su negocio, en el futuro quiere tenr mas clientes en su negocio y comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Jhon is 21 years old and lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil. He has had a photocopy center since he let school, in order to help with the family’s expenses. His father taught him how to work with copiers at a young age. When he grew up, he didn’t have opportunities to work in other areas, so he invested his savings into a copy machine and paper. Little by little, he also managed to obtain a computer. He plans to use the loan to by another copier, in order to grow his business. His future plans include expanding his customer base and buying his own home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a copy machine.

loans.name: Neil

texts.es: Neil, de 23 años, es un joven muy responsable que vive en una casa alquilada.Neil trabaja en su puesto en la venta de comestibles (azúcar, arroz, fideos, conservas, entre otros). Su negocio esta ubicado en un mercado populoso de su barrio, y  sus  clientes son  las amas de casa que gustan de la buena atención que brinda. Hace varios años, el puesto era de  su familia, y él ayudaba, pero desde hace 2 años le pertenece. Se siente muy satisfecho  por la productividad de  su negocio, aunque a veces no se abastece, porque trabaja solo y le faltan manos para la atención. Para mas adelante le gustaría ampliar su negocio con mayor cantidad de comestibles, y también quiere comprarse un puesto propio en ese  mercado, para obtener mayores ganancias, y estar fijo en un solo sitio.Es el  primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que sabe que le servirá para progresar, asimismo esta muy satisfecho con el desempeño de sus compañeras de grupo porque le han demostrado ser responsables y trabajadoras.Neil tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en el  incremento de mercadería de primera necesidad, para mantener surtido su negocio, y así ofrecerles lo mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Neil is a very responsible 23 year old young man. He lives in a rented house. He works in a stand selling food (sugar, rice, noodles, canned goods, and others). His business is located in a crowded market in his neighborhood. His customers are housewives who like the good service he provides. The stand was his family’s many years ago, and he helped. But, it has belonged to him for two years. He is very satisfied with the productivity of his business even though it is sometimes not stocked. This is because he works alone, and he does not have help. Later he would like to expand his business with a greater quantity of food. He also wants to buy his own stand in the market in order to get greater earnings and to be in one fixed location. This is his first loan with MFP. He pledged to make his payments on time because he knows that will help him make progress. At the same time he is very satisfied with the performance of his colleagues in the group. They have shown themselves to be responsible and hard-working. Neil plans to use the requested money to increase his basic needs merchandise. He will do this to keep his business stocked. Then he can offer his customers the best.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for his business

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 45 años, es un padre de familia muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Reyda de 43 años y sus 2 menores hijos, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El trabajo que realiza Juan es el cultivo de papa y alverja, esta labor la realiza junto a su esposa, quien también trabaja arduamente para brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos. Él ha visto por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta la ciudad de Tarma, ya que según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtiene. Tiene 20 años realizando esta actividad, por lo que procura siempre cuidar sus cultivos de la plaga, ya que puede perjudicar el desarrollo de sus plantaciones. Con el tiempo, espera que mejore su siembra y con la venta pueda aumentar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su grupo comunal, en donde es muy querido. Con los mil quinientos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Juan, age 45, is a very unassuming and hard-working man. He lives in his own house with his 43 year old wife, Reyda, and their two minor children. They are the motivation for all of his efforts. Juan grows potatoes and peas. He does this work together with his wife, who also works arduously to give their children a good education. He has seen that it is beneficial to take his products to the city of Tarma. According to Juan, that is where he gets the best earnings. He has been doing this activity for 20 years. That is why he always tries to take care of his crops so the pests do not get to them. The pests can hamper the development of his crops. In time he hopes to improve what he sows. With their sale he will be able to increase his income. This is his seventh loan with MFP. He feels obliged to make all of his payments on time. He does not want to cause problems for the members of his communal bank where he is held in high regard. He will use the 1,500 soles he is requesting to buy more fertilizer for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more fertilizer

loans.name: Rachidatou

texts.fr: T. rachidatou est mariée et mère d'un enfant, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de totsi qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale. en ce moment elle fait face à une baisse de son stock de produits d'alimentation générale. voulant se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 15 sacs de riz, 5 bidons d'huile, 4 cartons de spaghetti et divers.
texts.en:
Rachidatou T., married with one child, lives with her family in Totsi, a suburb of Lome. She makes a living selling groceries. Her innventory is low and she wants to rebuild it. She is asking for a WAGES loan to buy 15 bags of rice, six cans of oil, four boxes of spaghetti, and so on.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grocery products

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El señor Oscar T. se dedica al negocio de transporte de personas, tiene un taxi el cual esta ubicado en un punto en el Mall las Cascadas de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa,
se dedica a este tipo de actividad desde hace varios años y cuenta con dos unidades de transporte, el credito lo utilizara para la reparacion de una de las unidades y asi dejarla en buen estado para prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar T. works in transportation. He has a taxi located at the point of the Mall las Cascadas in the city of Tegucigalpa, He has been doing this for several years and he has two transportation units. He will use the loan to repair one of the units to leave it in good condition to provide a better service for his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy automobile replacement parts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Denis

texts.es:
José Denis es un joven de 29 años, casado, padre de un hijo de tres meses de nacido, su esposa trabaja en sistema. 
Su negocio es la venta de productos plásticos, como: vasos y platos de cumpleaños. Bolsos plásticos, bolsas y variedades. El cual inicio con ahorros de su trabajo anterior y ayuda de sus padres.
Lo que desea es lograr aumentar su inventario para tener mejores utilidades.
Para lograr comprar su propio terreno ya que a un vive con sus suegros, tiene un cuarto pequeño, lo que quiere aumentar un poco mas para lograr mas espacio ya que ahora son tres.
Lo que con este financiamiento comprara materiales de construcción como: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro, perilines, zinc y otros para lograr construir.
Como padre de familia aspira a tener un techo digno para su familia lo que espera lograr a largo plazo. Mediante estos financiamiento.
texts.en:
José Denis is young man of 29 years who is married and the father of one three month old child. His wife works with computers. His business is selling plastic products such as glasses and plates for birthdays, gags, and various other things. He started with savings from his previous job and help from his parents. What he wants is to increase his inventory to have better profit in order to be able to buy his own land, since he lives with his in-laws. He has a small room, which he wants to enlarge since there are three of them now. With this loan he will buy construction materials such as: blocks, sand, cement, iron, metal sheeting, zinc, and other items for construction. As a husband and father he aspires to having a worthy home for his family, which is what his long term goal is via these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials: blocks, cement, sand, iron, sheeting and zinc to start construction to have better space in his home

loans.name: Bédéoouchatou

texts.fr: cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1999, en ce moment elle est en rupture de stock et sollicite s'approvisionner, elle demande son premier prêt pour l'achat de divers produits d'alimentation générale. elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant, avec ce qu'elle gagne de son commerce elle contribue financièrement aux charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
This woman’s revenue-generating business is the sale of food products. She has been in this business since 1999 and at this time is out of stock. She wants to stock up and is asking for her first loan to purchase various general food products. She is married and the mother of a child. She contributes financially to the family expenses with what she earns from her business.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Doña Zoila se dedica a la venta de tortillas se levanta todos los dias a las cuatro y media de la mañana para elaborar sus tortillas ya que desde muy temprano es visitada por sus clientes, vende en su casa de habitacion y tambien sale a vender a diferentes colonias cercanas a su hogar, sale caminando y las vende de casa en casa ya que tiene sus clientes fijos que les vende a la hora del almuerzo.
dependen de ella sus dos hijas de 8 y 13 años las cuales tambien le ayudan a entrgar el producto.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para la fabricacion de las tortillas.

Su esposo trabaja en otro departamento cercano a Tegucigalpa, el trabaja en la agricultura en el Departamento de Olancho y viene cada 15 dias a visitarla a ella y a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Doña Zoila sell tortillas for a living. She gets up at 4:30am everyday to make her tortillas since her customers come very early. She sells them from her home and also, she walks to the different neighborhoods near her home selling door to door because she has regular customers that she sells to at lunch time. She has two dependent daughters, ages 8 and 13, that help her deliver her product. She will use the loan to buy more materials for the production of tortillas. Her husband works in another department near Tegucigalpa. He works in agriculture in the department of Olancho and comes every 15 days to visit her and their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase corn flour, wood, lime, water and matches

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 30 años, en una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Aquiles de 29 años y sus dos queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo que diariamente realiza Luz en sus chacras, ha hecho que su siembra de alverja, papa y choclo sean uno de los mejores cultivados del poblado de Cumutay. Todas las mañanas sale muy temprano a trabajar en sus tierras, puesto que sabe que es muy importante tenerlas bien cuidadas. Han transcurrido 11 años, y considera que le gusta mucho su trabajo y más aún por que es ella quien toma las decisiones. En adelante espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y se siente en la obligación de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas en su grupo comunal, donde es muy querida y siempre es aconsejada por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los dos mil soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Luz is 30 years old and a hard working loving mother. She lives in a home of her own, along with her husband, 29 year old Aquiles, and her two children whom she loves very much and to whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Luz’s work on her farmland has ensured that her crops of peas, potatoes, and corn are the best in the village of Cumutay. She begins working her land early every morning and she knows that it’s very important to have it well cared for. She’s been doing this for 11 years and believes that she enjoys her work because she is the one who makes all of the decisions. She expects to buy new land in the future, in order to increase production. This will be her third loan through MFP and she feels obligated to repay it on time. She does not want to cause any problems for her communal group or its members, who love and advise her. She will use the 2,000 ($725) PEN to buy more fertilizer to improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos, de 51 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora,  vive en su casa que es  propia, junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos.Por las mañanas se dedica a preparar diferentes comidas en el comedor popular del estado, que esta ubicado en  su casa. Junto con una vecina  atienden, a cambio de 5 porciones de comida que le dan a cada una, como un pago para continuar con las labores de ayuda social. Y en las tardes se dedica a la confección de  diversas prendas de vestir y ropa deportiva, ya es muy conocida por el buen trabajo que desempeña. Los compradores de las prendas son los profesores y miembros de las ligas deportivas de la zona. Al iniciarse en este trabajo tenía muchas dificultades, debido a la falta de capital, y también porque no tenia clientela. Se siente complacida pues  ya  tiene 10 años desempeñándose en la confección, aunque a veces sola no se abastece, por lo que recibe el apoyo de su cuñada, y de esta manera entrega sus pedidos a tiempo. Para el futuro tiene planeado incrementar su capital de trabajo y así planea  mejorar su estilo de vida.Es el  décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, además esta muy satisfecha de trabajar con sus compañeras de  grupo, porque son personas muy responsables.Santos tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en  realizar el mantenimiento de su máquina de coser, porque es su principal  herramienta de trabajo, y esta algo deteriorada.
texts.en:
Santos, age 51, is a very hard-worker. She lives in her own house with her husband and their four children. In the mornings she prepares different food in a popular state restaurant, which is located in her house. She tends the business with a neighbor. They give each person five portions of food, which is as a payment to continue with their social work. In the afternoons she makes diverse article of clothing and sportswear. She is very well known for the good work she does. Teachers and member of sports leagues in the area buy her clothes. When she started this work she had a lot of difficulties due to the lack of capital. Also, she did not have customers. She feels very pleased that she has been working making clothes for ten years. She feels this way even though sometimes she cannot meet the demand. That is why her sister-in-law helps her. That way she delivers her orders on time. In the future she plans on increasing her working capital. That way she plans on improving her life style. This is her tenth loan with MFP. She pledges to make all of her payments on time. Also, she is very satisfied working with the colleagues in her group because they are very responsible people. Santo plans to invest the requested money in the maintenance of her sewing machine. It is her main working tool, and it is somewhat the worse for wear

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her sewing machine

loans.name: Abdul Razak

texts.fr: Monsieur K. a débuté en 2009 le commerce de portables et accessoires, il exerce ce commerce dans l’un des quartiers les plus animés de Lomé en commerce. Il est très connu par la qualité de ses marchandises. La demande actuel de sa clientèle est élevée raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES  un premier prêt pour acheter  des portables, des batteries, des pochettes et divers. Il est célibataire et ce commerce lui permet de pouvoir  se prendre en charge.
texts.en:
In 2009, Mr. K. began selling cellphones and accessories. He runs this business in one of the liveliest business districts in Lomé. He is very well known for the quality of his merchandise. He is seeking a first loan from WAGES to buy cell phones, batteries, cases, and miscellaneous items because customer demand has risen at this time. He is a bachelor and this business enables him to support himself.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cellphones and accessories

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel, de 37 años es un padre de familia muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Yuliana de 37 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor educación. Desde muy joven Manuel aprendió a trabajar con la tierra, ya que la agricultura es la actividad que siempre ha estado presente en su vida, actualmente posee tierras donde cultiva papa, maíz y alverja, productos que después de la cosecha son comercializados en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que es la actividad que le da de comer a su familia, lleva 17 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es cuidar sus productos de la plaga. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil soles que solicita, comprará más fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Manuel is 37 years old and a happy, hard working father. He lives in a home of his own, along with his wife, 37 year old Yuliana, and his two children, whom he loves very much and to whom he wants to provide a better education. Manuel learned to work with the land when he was very young and agriculture has always been a part of his life. Presently he has land where he raises potatoes, corn, and peas. After harvesting his products, he sells them in the main market in the city of Tarma. What he enjoys most about his work is working the land, as this is the activity that helps feed his family. He’s been doing this for 17 years and what he finds most difficult is protecting his crops from disease. Eventually he would like to buy more land so that he can increase production. This will be his third loan through MFP. He has always been on time with his payments and expects to continue to be. He is very united with the other members of his communal group. He will use the 1,000 PEN ($375) to buy more fertilizer to apply to his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Edith Xioamara

texts.es:
la sra. Edith Xiomara A. O. tiene 28 años de edad, vive en la colonia Rivera de la Vega en la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene dos años con su negocio, sus clientes son sus vecinos, pulperias, mercaditos, tambien hace tortillas por encargo para reuniones o fiestas.
el credito lo utilizara  para comparar harina de maiz, leña, cal, agua. desea comprar mas para tener una mayor produccion y asi tener mejores ventas.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y sacar adelante a su familia..
texts.en:
Ms. Edith Xiomara A. O. is 28 years old and lives in the Rivera de la Vega section of Tegucigalpa. She makes and sells tortillas and has been running this business for two years. Her customers include her neighbors, general stores, and small markets. She also makes tortillas to order for family reunions and parties. She is asking for this loan in order to buy corn flour, firewood, salt, and water. She wants to increase her production and improve her sales. She needs the income in order to cover household expenses and move her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and ingredients

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, de 42 años, es una madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive con su hermana en una casa alquilada y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Las chacras que con tanto esfuerzo ha cultivado Marcelina, siempre le han brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse, ella cultiva papa, alverja y maíz, las cuales después de la cosecha lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios le dan por sus productos. Durante estos 30 años, lo que más le gusta es sembrar y lo hace con mucha paciencia, pero tiene cuidar de la plaga para que no afecte el desarrollo de sus plantaciones. En adelante espera poder ampliar sus tierras, para poder sembrar más. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y desea serlo también ahora, en su grupo comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo de su grupo. Con los dos mil soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 42 years old and a simple but hard working mother. She lives with her sister in a rented house and she would really like to improve her quality of life. Marcelina has always produced the income she needs to sustain herself, thought the farmland that she has painstakingly cultivated. She raises potatoes, peas, and corn, which she then harvests and sells in the main marketplace in Tarma, because that is where she gets the best prices for her products. She has been doing this for the past 30 years and what she enjoys most is to plant, which she does with great patience, and she must ensure that plant diseases don’t affect her crops. She hopes to be able to increase the amount of farmland that she has, so that she can plant more crops. This is her seventh loan through MFP. She has had an “on-time” payment record with her previous loans and she wants to continue. She is very committed to her communal group and to its development. She will use the 2,000 PEN ($725) to buy more fertilizer in order to improve the quality of her farmland.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Building Materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Livesock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Blanca Dalide

texts.es:
Blanca de 38 años, vive en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas en disolución), ella vende almuerzo en su casa para trabajadores del sector por donde vive. 

Para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares ella comenzó a vender almuerzos por el sector donde vive, como se le fue incrementando la clientela y al no tener dinero para un local, utilizo el comedor de su casa para atender a sus clientes, poco a poco se le ha incrementado la clientela, vende platos típicos. 

Para poder construir mejor su casa y que sus clientes estén mas cómodos, ella quiere comprar con el préstamo bloques, cemento. En el futuro quiere formalizar el negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca is 38 years old and lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil (a suburban zone with dirt roads and eroding hills). She sells lunch from her home, to the workers in her sector. She began selling lunch in her sector in order to help her husband with the family expenses. As her clientele began to increase, she did not have enough money for a food stall, so she began user her dining room to serve her customers. She sells typical dishes and has increased her clientele little by little. She wants to buy cinder blocks and cement so that she can make some improvements to her home so that her customers will have a more comfortable place. She plans to formalizer her business in future.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: Cristina Paad  es una mujer  que con su negocio resuelve  problemas domésticos a las amas de casa: como el de invertir mucho tiempo lavando manualmente bajo el inclemente sol de la Costa Caribe; ella reconoce que esta tarea es pesada,  por eso creó el negocio donde alquila lavadoras entre sus vecinas del barrio, ofreciéndole comodidad a las amas de casa  en su tarea de lavar y ahorro de tiempo para realizar sus oficios domésticos y productivos habituales. Cristina es una mujer trabajadora ella también elabora y vende comidas rápidas, empanadas, caribañolas, arepas, frutas, jugos y bolis, ese fue precisamente  el negocio con el cual inició su microempresa hace 7 años, como mecanismo para solventar las necesidades básicas del hogar, alimentación, servicios y el alquiler de su vivienda que aun no la tenia. Con su primer crédito en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace 5 años, pudo  mejorar algunas herramientas y adquirir bicicleta con carruaje que transporta a 4 personas a bajo costo, o bici taxi,  para su esposo que se encontraba desempleado y desde ese mismo momento, ambos empezaron a trabajar y a generar ingresos para el hogar equilibradamente. Este es su cuarto crédito con el cual comprará  dos lavadoras  e insumos para elaboración de sus comidas rápidas. Cristina recuerda  como ya con su segundo  crédito, fue que adquirió las lavadoras para alquilarlas  en la vecindad  por horas, y como, desde hace dos años, con mucha disciplina en el manejo de la inversión, lograron utilidades, que le permitieron ahorrar su cuota inicial  para comprar el apartamento que hoy tienen y que actualmente pagan  en  módicas  cuotas trimestrales. En estos momentos ella y su cónyuge se sienten muy  satisfechos por los sacrificios que han realizado y que aun continúan haciendo a fin de lograr su mas firme propósito: el de terminar de pagar el apartamento mediante el trabajo honrado y  la persistencia en su negocio.
texts.en:
Christina R. is a woman who, with her business, resolves domestic problems for housewives. She recognized that these housewives spend a lot of time washing clothing by hand in the harsh sun of the Caribbean Coast, which is difficult work. For this reason, she believed that a business renting washers to housewives in her neighborhood would offer them convenience in their washing tasks and save them time so they could carry out their other domestic chores and productive activities. Christina is a hardworking woman who also makes and sells fast food: empanadas, caribañolas (boiled yucca stuffed with meat), arepas (corn bread), fruit juice and bolis (frozen juice snacks.) She started this small business 7 years ago as a way to cover the basic household expenses: food, utilities and the rent on her home, as she did not own a home. With her first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo 5 years ago, she was able to get some better tools and acquire a pedicab that transports 4 people at a low cost for her husband, who was unemployed. From that moment, they both began to work and generate income for a stable home. This is her 4th loan, and with it she will buy 2 washing machines and supplies to make her fast food. Christina remembers how, with her second loan, she was buying the washing machines to rent by the hour. After 2 years, with a lot of discipline and management of the investment, they achieved profits that allowed them to save for a down payment on an apartment. Today they have that apartment, and are currently making payments in modest quarterly installments. Now she and her husband feel very satisfied with the sacrifices they have made, and are continuing to work toward their main goal of paying off the apartment through honest work and persistence in their business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will buy 2 washing machines and supplies to make her fast food

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis Carlos A. Z. es un joven de 24 años que vive en la zona central de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Vive en casa de sus padres junto a su hermano y su hermana menor. Luis y su hermano acuden a la Universidad y por las noches a un instituto para convertirse en Chefs.
Todos juntos tienen un restaurant de comida tradicional de Cochabamba por más de 30 años y son un restaurant muy conocido en la ciudad por su calidad y limpieza. Luis necesita el préstamo para poder renovar sus utensilios de cocina que tiene puesto que estos ya están muy usados. 
El nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder en un futuro abrir sucursales de su Restaurant por todo Bolivia y de esa manera lograr cumplir el sueño que está pendiente de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Luis Carlos A. Z. is a youth of 24 years of age who lives in the central area of the city of Cochabamba. He lives in his parent's home with his brother and his younger sister. Luis and his brother attend the University, and at night they study to become chefs. The family has had a restaurant in Cochabamba that serves traditional food for more than 30 years, and it is a restaurant that is well known in the city for its quality and cleanliness. Luis needs a loan to replace his kitchen utensils, because the ones he has are very old. He tells us that his main dream is to be able to open branches of his restaurant throughout Bolivia, and in this way manage to accomplish a dream that his whole family would like to see become reality.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils for his family restaurant

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
La señora Martina tiene 33 años está casada con el señor Damián Rocha y juntos tienen 3 hijos de (12,8 y 1) años, hace tres años atrás el esposo sufrió un accidente de tránsito, el trabajaba de chofer realizando viajes nacionales a diferentes ciudades del país trasportando cargas, donde hubo 3 muertos y varios heridos, ellos tuvieron que pagar todos los gastos y por lo tanto perdieron todos sus ahorros que tenían para pagar del lote y construir su propia casa.

La señora Martina y su familia viven en la ciudad de COCHABAMBA provincia CHAPARE en una casa en alquiler donde solo cuenta con dos habitaciones, una habitación la usan los padres y en otra los tres hijos. Su principal actividad es la agricultura, produce papa, locoto (ajillo) y haba verde, también se dedica al comercio de frutas (mandarina, naranja, manzana entre otros).

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de semillas y abonos, para la producción de papa y haba verde.
Entre sus sueños y metas es tener su casa propia, ya que después del accidente su esposo no trabajo durante unos años, ya después superado ese trauma empezó a trabajar y van ahorrando poco a poco para ofrecer una casa cómoda a sus tres hijos
texts.en:
Martina is 33-years-old and married to Mr. Damián Rocha. Together they have 3 children (12,8, and 1 years old). Three years ago her husband suffered a car accident. He worked as a driver for national trips to to different cities in the country, transporting cargo. Three died in the accident and various people were wounded. Martina and Damián had to pay all the expenses and they lost all of their savings that they had to buy a lot and build their own house. Martina and her family live in the city of Cochabamba in the province of Chapare in a rented house where they only have two rooms. The parents use one room and the three children use the other. Her main activity is agriculture. She grows potatoes, garlic, and beans. She also sells fruit (mandarins, oranges, and apples, among others). The loan will be used for the purchase of seeds and fertilizer for the production of potatoes and beans. Among her dreams and goals is having her own house. After the accident her husband didn't work for some years, but after he recovered from the trauma he began to work again, and, little by little they're saving up to offer a comfortable home to their three children.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of seeds and fertilizer to grow potatoes and beans

loans.name: Miguel Omar

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Omar S. se dedica al transporte de personas, tiene un taxi, tiene vario tiempo de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y cuenta con tres unidades de transporte, el prestamo que esta solicitando lo necesita para la reparacion de una de las unidades y asi dejarla en buen estado para prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con los gastos de su hogar y para darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Miguel Omar S. has been working as a taxi driver for quite a while. He has three taxis. He needs a loan to repair one of his vehicles so it is in a good condition for his customers. Miguel needs the money he earns to cover household expenses and to provide his family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy shock absorbers and other spare parts for his taxi

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús, de  22 años, es un joven soltero, que vive solo en un cuarto alquilado.Se dedica a la panadería; es un especialista en amasar y  labrar las roscas y alfajores (bocadillos dulces). El principal comprador de sus productos, es una  empresa  de transporte, a la que abastece de sus deliciosos bocadillos. Desde muy joven trabajo como ayudante, pero desde hace dos años se independizo e incursiono en el  negocio. En  la actualidad  su madre lo apoya en la labor junto a algunos ayudantes, y de esta manera  entrega a tiempo  sus pedidos. Se siente muy satisfecho con la labor que desempeña, aunque el alquiler de la panadería le absorbe gran parte de sus ganancias;  más aun porque no cuenta con un stock de insumos para cubrir al 100% sus pedidos. En adelante piensa ampliar su mercado y mejorar su servicio para abarcar nuevos mercados.Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues sabe que el dinero le será muy beneficioso para aumentar el capital de su negocio.Jesús tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de  varios sacos de harina, azúcar y mantequilla, asimismo piensa realizar los tramites para regularizar  la licencia de funcionamiento de su panadería, pues desea continuar ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
22-year old Jesús is a young man, unmarried, who lives alone in a rented room. He is a baker whose speciality is kneading dough and making bread rolls and alfajores (filled cookies). Most of his delicious products are bought by a transportation company. Ever since he was young, Jesús worked as an assistant in a bakery, but two years ago he opened his own business. Currently his mother helps him as well as several assistants so he is able to deliver orders on time. He feels very satisfied with this work although the cost of renting the bakery takes a large part of his earnings. Another problem is that the ingredients that he stocks are not enough to cover 100% of the orders. In the future Jesús is thinking of expanding his customer base and improving service so he can move into other markets. This is his first loan with Kiva partner MFP and he promises to make his repayments on time because he knows that the money will be very beneficial in increasing the amount of capital available to him. Jesús is planning to use the loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, and butter. He also wants to complete the necessary paperwork and obtain a business licence, and continue expanding the bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy baking ingredients and a business licence

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, de 23 años, es una joven muy alegre y sencilla, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposo Jaime de 26 años y su único hijo Yosmel de 3 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La actividad a la que se dedica Maribel, es el cultivo de papa y alverja, sobre tierras que compró, es así que trabaja con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo en su actividad, luego de un tiempo al cosecharlas son comercializadas en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. Disfruta mucho el trabajo que realiza, y de esa manera han transcurrido 3 años, trabajando y tomando sus propias decisiones. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que ser puntual en sus pagos, como la ha sido en sus anteriores créditos. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy solidaria y esta muy comprometida con el desarrollo de sus grupos. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
23-year old Maribel is a cheerful straightforward young woman. She and her husband, 26-year old Jaime and their only child 3-year old Yosmel, live with her parents. Her husband and son are what motivates Maribel to work hard. She grows potatoes and peas on a plot of land that she owns. She puts in a lot of effort and hard work. After harvesting the vegetables, she sells them at the wholesale market in Tarma. Maribel enjoys her work. She’s been doing this job and making her own decisions for three years. In the future she hopes to buy more land and increase production. This is Maribel’s first loan with Kiva partner MFP. She knows she has to be punctual with her repayments as she has been with other loans in the past. In her community group she is considered a dedicated member, committed to the development of the group. With the loan she plans to buy more fertilizer for her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
La señora Blanca L. tiene 44 años de edad y se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de golosinas, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion en la Colonia Flor del Campo, realiza sus ventas de Lunes a Domingo de 5:00 Pm hasta las 10.00 Pm,  cuenta con clientes fijos
quienes le gusta mucho los Tacos que hace, asi mismo vende yuca, tajaditas de platano fritas y
pastelitos.
Siempre le ha gustado dedicarse a la venta de comida, Blanca utilizara el prestamo para comprar mas materiales para la fabricacion de las golosinas, ya que hace dos meses su hija estuvo muy enferma y tuvieron que operarla, por lo que tuvo que hacer varios gastos y necesita reponerse de lo sucedido.
Gracias a dios su hija ya esta recuperada, Blanca es madre viuda, ya que su esposo fallecio hace algunos años y  se quedo criando los dos niños sola. En la zona es muy conocida por el buen gusto que le da a la comida.
texts.en:
Blanca L. is 44 years old and works preparing and selling sweets. She has been doing this for many years. She has her business in her house in the Flor del Campo neighborhood, and she makes her sales from 5:00pm until 10:00pm Monday through Friday. She has regular customers who really like the tacos she makes. She also sells yuca, plantain chips and cakes. She has always liked selling food. Blanca will use the loan to buy more materials to make the sweets, since two months ago her daughter was very sick and they had to operate on her. For this reason she had to spend extra, and now she needs to recover from what happened. By the grace of God, her daughter is now recovered. Blanca is a widowed mother, since her husband passed away several years ago and she was left raising both her children alone. She is well-known in the area for the good flavor she gives her food.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks, corn flour, condiments, oil, chicken, disposable plates, plantains, potatoes, lard, juice

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El señor David L. C. tiene 47 años y vive en casa de sus suegros en la zona Tabladita del Barrio Méndez Arcos de la ciudad de Tarija. David es casado con la señora primitiva Oña Ramírez de 45 años de edad con quien tiene 5 hijos. David se dedica a trabajar como albañil desde hace más de 20 años teniendo obras en diferentes puntos de esta ciudad.   
                        
David quiere tener mejores ingresos para brindarles una mejor vida a su familia pero el nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar más herramientas de trabajo. Es por eso que el crédito será destinado a la compra de más herramientas, para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.      
                                                                                                                                                                                                 David nos cuenta que quiere darles a su esposa e hijos toda la comodidad que pueda, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de la casa donde vive.
texts.en:
David is 47 years old and lives at his in-laws house in the Tabladita zone of the Mendez Arcos district, in the town of Tarija. David is married to Primitiva Oña Ramirez who is 45 years old. They have 5 children. David has been a bricklayer for more than 20 years and has done construction in different parts of town. David wants to increase his income to improve his family's life but tells us that he needs to purchase more working tools. This is why this loan will be used to buy more tools so that he can increase his income. David tells us that he wants to give his wife and children the most comfort he can and for that he says that the next loan he requests will be to improve the conditions of the house he lives in.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tools for construction work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tu buy riced 80/20, pheasant-rice, sugar, oil, sodas

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 30 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Héctor de 30 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy temprano, Nancy abre su tienda, siendo uno de los establecimientos más visitados de su localidad.  Es así que cada mañana sus clientes y vecinos encuentran todo lo necesario, además que con su calida atención ha logrado captar más compradores. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinos, así han transcurrido 4 años realizando esta actividad. Su mator anhelo es ampliar su tienda y llenarla de más mercadería, para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad de productos. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP y esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su grupo comunal, donde es muy querida por sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más productos, para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Nancy is a thirty-year old, very happy, and hard-working, mother of a family. She and her husband, Hector (also age thirty), live in their own home with their there three beloved children, to whom they want to provide a better quality of life. Nancy opens her store very early in the morning since it's one of the most frequented establishments in the area. This is how her customers and neighbors find everything they need each day. She has been able to bring in more customers because of the warm treatment she offers her customers. The thing she likes most about her job is talking to her neighbors. She has been doing this for four years and her greatest wish is to widen her store and fill it with more merchandise to be able to offer her customers a better variety of products. This is her seventh loan with MFP and she is ready to make her payments on time since she does not want to cause problems for her communal bank, where she is much loved by her companions. She will buy more products to improve her store with the thousand soles she is asking for.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products to stock her store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: la Señora Elena vende dulces,chocolates, cigarrillos y otros productos en los distintos acontecimientos como, fiestas de matrimonios, bautizos y en restaurantes por las noches, desde hace veinti cinco años se dedica a esta actividad, vive en alquiler, la Sra. vive sola, se encuentra en su tercer ciclo, tambien pertenece al banco de emprendimiento San Andres, esta en su segundo ciclo con este banco de emprendimiento, ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
Elena sells sweets, chocolates, cigarettes and other goods at various events like weddings and christenings, and in restaurants at night. She has been doing this for twenty-five years. She lives alone in rented accommodation. She is in her third loan cycle. She also belongs to the San Andres communal bank. She is in her second cycle with this communal bank and has proved herself to be a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy cornflour, tortillas, cooking fat, beef and pork, chicken, sausages, beans, rice, sugar, eggs, bleach, gas, milk, churros, dairy products

loans.name: Nestor

texts.es: Néstor, de 37 años, es un padre de familia muy amoroso y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Valvina de 32 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Con el apoyo de su esposa, Néstor decidió comprar hace 20 años, unos terrenos en los cuales pudiera trabajar y así mejorar la economía de su familia. Actualmente esos terrenos los sigue trabajando, pero ahora son mucho más productivos, ya que sus cultivos de papa, alverja y maíz son de muy buena calidad y con el paso del tiempo ha aprendido a obtener la mayor producción de sus chacras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la relación tan cercana que tiene con la tierra, además disfruta mucho viendo sus sembríos crecer, sin embargo lo más difícil es tener que cuidar sus campos de las inclemencias del clima, ya que cualquier descuido puede afectar la cosecha. Para más adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP; esta muy contento por obtenerlo, ya que lo necesita urgentemente para mejorar su negocio. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy querido, ya que siempre pone mucho orden en las reuniones. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Néstor is 37 years old and a loving hardworking father. He lives in his own home with his wife Valvina, age 32, and their three beloved children for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. Twenty years ago, Néstor received the support of his wife and decided to buy some land so that he could work and improve his family’s financial situation. He continues to work on the land, but now he is much more productive. His crops of potatoes, peas, and corn are of very good quality, and over time, he has learned how to obtain a better production rate at harvest time. What he enjoys most is the close relationship he has with the land. He likes watching his crops grow. On the other hand, Néstor finds it difficult to care for his fields whenever inclement weather is present since any type of neglect can affect the harvest. Later on he hopes to buy additional land so that he can increase his production.

This is his seventh loan with MFP. Néstor is very happy to obtain this loan since he already has an urgent need to improve his business. He is an admired member of his Communal Bank because he always seeks to restore order at the meetings. The loan of 3000 PEN that he requested will be used to buy more compost so that he can improve the productivity of his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Mirtha Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora Mirtha  tiene 31 años de edad tiene dos niños de doce y siete años ella vive en la Maica Central parada seis  que es un cantón de la ciudad de Cochabamba a unos veinte minutos de la ciudad, ella vive sola con sus hijos y con la cuñada.

Mirtha es una persona responsable y trabajadora es la única mujer de cuatro hijos los cuales salieron solos porque sus padres se divorciaron cuando eran niños y ella vivía con la abuela ya que la mama les  abandono  cuando su padre se fue de la ciudad entonces ellos quedaron solos, Mirtha se puso a trabajar desde muy niña ayudando a la abuela con la actividad de la producción de leche  de esa manera ella se quedo con esa actividad de producción de leche ella tiene tres cabezas de ganado lechero que le dan una producción de 60 litros diarios con los cuales ella realiza quesillo y los comercializa en el mercado, de los cuales ella paga el estudio de sus hijos y al mismo tiempo cuidad a la abuelita porque ella se encuentra delicada de salud y como es su abuela quien la ayudo a Mirtha ella dice que le debe mucho a su a abuela y tiene que ayudarla para que pueda vivir más.

Mirtha pide el crédito para la compra de cascara de soya, para poder aumentar la producción y de esa manera poder producir más leche y realizar más quesillo, con esa ayuda ella tendrá más ingresos con los cuales ayudara a sus hijos en la escuela y que sus niños terminen y realicen una carrera  en el futuro.
texts.en:
Sra. Mirtha is 31 years old and has two children, ages 12 and 7. She resides in Maica Centra Parada Seis, which is a canton of the city of Cochabamba that is located twenty minutes away from downtown. Mirtha lives alone with her children and her sister-in-law.

She is a responsible person and a hard worker. Mirtha is the only daughter of four children. After her parents divorced, she went to go live with her grandmother since her mother abandoned them and her father already left town. Mirtha started working as a young girl by helping her grandmother collect milk. She continues in this same line of work and now has three dairy cows that provide 60 liters per day that she uses to make fresh cheeses that are sold in the market. The income she earns goes toward her children’s education and the care of her grandmother since she is in delicate health. Mirtha says she owes so much to her grandmother, so she has to help her live longer.

Mirtha is requesting a loan to buy soybean husks to feed to her cows so that they can produce more milk. This will allow her to make more cheese, which means she will have more income to help her children with their schooling and enable them to earn a degree in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soybean husks for her cows

loans.name: Maria Elsi

texts.es:
María Elsi, tiene 50 años de edad, Viven en  Caserío El Monte, del Municipio de San Jorge, departamento,  San Miguel, es Casada, vive solo con su esposo y no tiene hijos, tiene una tienda y venta de Pupusas (tortilla de maíz con queso y carne).
El negocio de venta de pupusas tiene más de 20 años de funcionar, sus padres se dedicaba a la venta ganado y la madre ama de casa, este negocio fue por iniciativa propia, las ventajas es que hay mucha gente que la conoce por la zona y por eso le va bien en las ventas. Ella está solicitando un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima como son: maíz, aceite, queso, carne de cerdo, especies que son utilizados para elaborar las pupusas.
Este préstamo le servirá para aumentar el negocio lo cual le permitirá generar ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares. Las aspiraciones de María son cubrir los compromisos del crédito, seguir generando ingreso para cubrir sus necesidades, para mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
María Elsi is 50 years old and lives in the village of El Monte in San Jorge Township, Department of San Miguel. She is married, but she and her husband live alone since they do not have children. María Elsi has a store and sells “pupusas” (corn tortillas filled with cheese and meat).

Her pupusa business has been in operation for more than 20 years. María Elsi’s parents sell cattle and her mother is a homemaker. She started this business of her own initiative. The advantages are that there are many people and she has personal knowledge of the area. For this reason she has done well with her sales. María Elsi is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of supplies such as corn, oil, cheese, pork, and spices used in making pupusas.

This loan will help to increase her business, which will enable her generate income to cover her family expenses. María’s aspirations are to fulfill her loan obligations, continue generating income to cover her needs, and improve the quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, oil, cheese, pork, and spices

location.town: Caserio El Mogote, San Jorge, San Miguel

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana María tiene una tienda de barrio desde hace dos años y medio, este crédito lo utilizara  para comprar mercadería para su tienda como refrescos, dulces, galletas, abarrotes, etc. Esta en su segunda secuencia donde ha demostrado ser una persona responsable con la institución y muy trabajadora ya que desde tempranas horas de la mañana ya atiende su tienda hasta largas horas de la noche, vive en casa de su mama, tiene dos hijos, recibe el apoyo de su esposo, ya que ambos corren con los gastos de la casa, su esposo trabaja de chofer en transporte urbano, están muy agradecido con emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgación del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Ana María has managed a neighborhood store for two and a half years. This loan will be used to buy merchandise for her store such as soft drinks, candy, cookies, groceries, and other items. Since this is her second loan, she has already demonstrated to Emprender that she is a responsible person and a very hard worker. From the early morning hours until late at night, she looks after her store.

Ana María lives at her mother’s house with her two children. She receives the support of her husband and both of them share responsibility for the household expenses. Her husband works as a public transportation driver. They are extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their trust by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda, de 42 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Samuel de 47 años y sus 2 hijos menores, quienes son el principal motivo de sus esfuerzos. La siembra de papa y alverja es la actividad a la que se dedica Nilda. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano, trabaja en sus campos agrícolas con el fin de hacerlas más fértiles y abundantes su producción. De esto depende para obtener más ganancias en su comercialización en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden malograr sus sembríos. Lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que tiene que llevarlos con mucho cuidado. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Nilda is 42 years old and a cheerful hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband Samuel, age 47, and their two dependent children who are the main reason behind all of her efforts. Nilda grows potatoes and peas. Every morning she begins work early in hopes of making her land more fertile so that she will have an abundant and productive harvest. This determines how much she will earn when she sells her products at the wholesale market in Tarma. What she enjoys most about her work is protecting her crops from pests that can ruin her harvest.
