Nilda has been farming for 30 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products to the market because they have to be handled with great care. In time she wants to buy additional land so that she can increase production.

This is her seventh loan with MFP. Nilda knows that she has to submit all of her payments on time and she is determined to do so. As a member of her Communal Bank, she is committed to the development of her group. The loan of 1000 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more compost to improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia, de 54 años, vive en su casa, que es propia en compañía de sus 4 jóvenes hijos.Desde hace 7 años, empezó a fabricar billeteras artesanalmente, y sus hijos aun  pequeños le ayudaban en lo que podían. Hoy en día, uno de sus hijos diseña, el otro remacha y graba los dibujos a las billeteras y  ella es la  costurera oficial, que termina con el acabado de cada una de las billeteras, es así que trabajan en conjunto. Y cuando le realizan grandes pedidos, todos se esfuerzan para la entrega oportuna. Uno de sus hijos, es el encargado de guardar los diversos modelos que realizan, para mostrarlos a sus nuevos  compradores. Sus clientes asiduos, son los comerciantes informales, que semanalmente acuden a su casa para solicitar mas  pedidos, porque las billeteras que realiza son de buena calidad. Para mas adelante tiene planeado ampliar su negocio de fabricación de billeteras, además de construir su casa.Es el  doceavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente como hasta hoy, además esta muy satisfecha de trabajar con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, porque son muy responsables en el pago de sus cuotas.Alicia tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de cueros y telas, para continuar trabajando en la confección de billeteras, pues desea  continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Alicia is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her four teenage children. Seven years ago, she began making handcrafted wallets and even her children helped out in whatever way they could. Today one of her children is responsible for making the designs, another secures the studs and etches the designs, and she handles the sewing and making the finishing touches to each of the wallets. Whenever they receive large orders, they must work together and strive to deliver on time. One of her children is in charge of maintaining samples of what they have created in order to show to new buyers. Her regular customers are informal merchants who come to her home on a weekly basis to place more orders because the wallets she produces are of good quality. In order to stay ahead, she plans to expand her wallet manufacturing business as well as build a house.

This is her twelfth loan with MFP. She commits to submitting her loan payments on time, like she does today. Alicia is very satisfied with the work of the members of her Communal Bank because they are responsible with their payments. She plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of leather and fabrics so that she can continue manufacturing wallets and making progress.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase leather & fabric

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel, de 28 años, es una madre muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Percy de 27 años y sus dos queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El arduo trabajo que Raquel realiza en sus chacras, han hecho que sus cultivos de alverja y papa sean muy productivos y abundantes. Sus productos, los lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde obtiene buenos precios por sus productos, ya que tiene clientes muy fieles, quienes le compran todo al por mayor. Han transcurrido 9 años, y aún le gusta sembrar y cuidar sus plantaciones de la plaga, ya que estos afectan el desarrollo de su cosecha. Con el tiempo desea comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta hacerlo. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Raquel is 28 years old and a modest hardworking mother. She lives in her own home with her husband Percy, age 27, and their two beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. The hard work that she performs in her fields has yielded productive and abundant crops of peas and potatoes. Her products are sold at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma where she is able to obtain good prices and has very loyal customers who buy everything in bulk. After nine years of farming, Raquel still enjoys planting and protecting her crops from pests that can affect their development. In time she wants to buy additional land so that she can increase production.

This is her fifth loan with MFP. Raquel knows she has to submit all of her loan payments on time and is determined to do so. In her Communal Bank she is one of the more cheerful and supportive members. The loan of 500 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more compost for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
María Cristina  tiene 65 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de San Miguel, es casada vive con el esposo, un hijo de 23 años, la nieta de 18 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de tamales de gallina y frijoles.
La Señora se dedica hace cinco años a la venta de tamales de gallina, el negocio lo aprendió cuando era soltera junto a la madre, las ventajas es que hay mucha personas de la zona que la conocen y tiene clientes por lo cual las ventas son positivas, le gusta mucho el negocio y es una persona emprendedora, actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo, para compra de materiales para elaborar los tamales, ella lo invertirá en: maíz, carne de pollo, frijoles, hojas de planta de quineo, especies, y otros productos para la elaboración de los tamales. 
Este préstamo le servirá para generar ingresos, los cuales le servirán para solventar gastos de alimentación de la familia y otros, los sueños de María son apoyar a su nieta con los estudios hasta que esta sea una persona profesional.
texts.en:
María Cristina is 65 years old and resides in the town of San Miguel. She lives with her husband, a 23 year old son, and an 18 year old granddaughter. María Cristina sells chicken tamales and beans.

She has been selling chicken tamales for five years. When she was single, she learned the business from her mother. Her sales have been positive because she has the advantages of having several customers and being in an area where most of the people know her. María Cristina enjoys her work and is an enterprising person. At the moment she is requesting a loan to buy supplies for making tamales such as corn, chicken, beans, banana leaves, spices, and other products.

These funds will help generate more income and enable her to cover the cost of feeding her family and other expenses. María dreams of supporting her granddaughter with her studies until she becomes a working professional.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, chicken, beans, banana leaves, spices, and other products

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, D. 54 años, vive en su casa propia, en compañía D. su esposo y sus 6 jóvenes hijos.Se dedica al tejido D. chompas y buzos D. lana, en su taller, ubicado en el sótano D. su casa, y es donD. teje tranquilamente, hasta altas horas D. la noche. Las prendas que elabora  con mayor frecuencia, son las chompas D. niños, mientras que  las chompas para  adultos  son D. mejor venta y cotización, durante  la temporada D. invierno. Aun trabaja  sola, como en sus inicios, y cuando tiene grandes pedidos, su hija la apoya o contrata a algunos ayudantes, para entregar  a tiempo sus pedidos. Por todos estos logros esta muy contenta con su trabajo, y ya lleva 10 años tejiendo sin descuidar su hogar. Para mas adelante tiene planeado adquirir nuevas máquinas para  tejer nuevas variedades D. chompas.Es el  doceavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que el dinero  le será muy fructífero para aumentar su capital D. trabajo, además esta muy satisfecha D. trabajar con los integrantes D. su grupo comunal, porque son personas trabajadoras y puntuales.Norma tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra D. lanas al por mayor, para cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendientes, D. esta manera quiere continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Norma is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and six teenage children. She produces woven sweaters and pullovers maD. of wool in her workshop located in the basement of her house. There she works quietly until the late hours of the evening. The garments that she produces the most are children’s sweaters. However, adult sweaters sell very well during the winter season when she can command higher prices. Norma usually works alone, like she did when she first started, but she has the help of her daughter or hires a few assistants whenever she receives large orders so that she can deliver them on time. She is very happy with everything she has accomplished through her work and has managed to maintain her weaving business for the past ten years without neglecting her household. Later on she plans to acquire new machines so that she can weave new styles of sweaters.

This is her twelfth loan with MFP. Norma knows the money will result in fruitful returns since it will increase her operating capital. In addition, she is satisfied with the work of the members of her Communal Bank because they are hardworking individuals who are prompt with their payments. Norma plans to invest the money she requested in a bulk purchase of wool so that she can complete her pending orders and continue making progress.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy chicken, beef, tomatoes, onions, potatoes, oil, corn, and spices

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a second hand clothes pack.

loans.name: Las Exitosas Group

texts.es:
L. Señorita Katherine tiene 19 años, es L. presidenta del nuevo grupo “LAS EXITOSAS”, ellas son 10 socias, todas viven en el distrito D. Los Olivos, departamento D. Lima. 
ElL. cuenta con un pequeño negocio D. productos D. belleza venD. todo tipo D. productos como labiales, esmaltes  para uñas, perfumes, cremas etc.
 También se ayuda haciendo chocolatería, L. socia empezó a vender chocolates para sus amigas entre ellas se pasaban L. voz y le  recomendaban a nuevos clientes es así que poco a poco amplio su negocio. L. mayora D. sus clientes son jóvenes. Sus ingresos le permiten cubrir sus gastos D. estudio y transporte  porque elL. estudia turismo y hotelería en un instituto. Quisiera invertir el préstamo en L. compra D. mercadería particularmente D. ropa para señoras ya que incursionara en ese negocio, para más adelante le gustaría tener una tienda granD. porque todavía venD. en su casa y a domicilio, le gustaría mostrar sus productos para tener mas ganancias.

* Katherine es L.  cuarta D. las paradas esta vestida con pantalón Jean y chompa negra
texts.en:
Señorita Katherine is 19 years old, and is the president of the new "Las Exitosas" (The Successful) group. There are 10 women who are members and they all live in the Los Olivos district in the department of Lima. She has a small business selling beauty products such as lipstick, nail varnish, perfume, creams etc. She also makes chocolates, originally for her friends, but word got around and her friends recommended her to new customers so that, little by little, her business grew. Most of her customers are young people. Her income allows her to cover her study and transport expenses, as she is studying tourism and hotel management in an institute. She would like to invest this loan in the purchase of merchandise, particularly women's clothing, as she is already getting into this business and she would like to have a large shop some time in the future. She currently sells clothing from her house and door-to-door, but she would like to have somewhere to display her goods in order to increase her earnings. * Katherine is the fourth woman standing on the left, wearing jeans and a black sweater.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy women's clothing for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase rice, canned goods and cooking oil

loans.name: Jose Rigoberto

texts.es:
José Rigoberto tiene 43 años de edad, reside en el Municipio del Tránsito, departamento de San Miguel, es casado, vive con la esposa, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 19,9 y 5 años. Se dedica a la Agricultura.
Desde la edad de 15 años se dedica a trabajar la tierra, los padres le inculcaron el trabajo por la tierra, el cultiva maíz y frijoles, y actualmente está solicitando un préstamo, para comprar abono y fertilizante, para el cultivo de maíz y frijoles, el dinero será de mucha ayuda para que la cosecha sea buena, la dificultad seria que las lluvias no fueran favorables para el cultivo. 
Las aspiraciones de José son continuar trabajando la tierra, para obtener ingresos y lograr sacar la familia adelante, apoyarles para que no les falte la alimentación, mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
José Rigoberto is a 43-year-old man who lives in the Transito municipality of the department of San Miguel. He is married and lives with his wife, with whom he has three children ages 19, 9 and 5. He works in agriculture.

He has been working the land ever since he was 15 years old. His parents instilled in him the love of working the land. He grows corn and beans, and he is currently requesting a loan in order to buy organic and chemical fertilizer for his crops. The money will greatly help him to have a good harvest. One difficulty for him would be unfavorable rainfall for his crops.

José's aspirations are to continue working the land so that he can earn a living, and to help his family get ahead, supporting them so that they do not lack food and improving their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase organic and chemical fertilizer for corn and bean crops

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.es:
Oswaldo es un padre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos menores hijos en el sector San Pablo, una zona rural que se encuentra comprendida dentro del distrito de Pomalca. Las actividades económicas dela zona son la agricultura, la crianza de animales menores y la elaboración artesanal de sombreros.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la elaboración de adobes (bloques de barro y pajilla de arroz, utilizados en la construcción de viviendas, su bajo precio y accesibilidad le hace muy usado en las zonas rurales y de bajos recursos del país). Durante el tiempo que ha venido trabajando se ha hecho conocido en la zona y actualmente distribuye su mercadería entre los vecinos del lugar en donde vive y en las zonas aledañas.

Adicionalmente percibe ingresos criando y vendiendo animales. El cría animales menores en la parte posterior del domicilio en donde vive y ocasionalmente los vende a sus vecinos y a diversos compradores. Con estas actividades el sostiene la economía de su familia.

Oswaldo desea adquirir diversos insumos para seguir elaborando adobes, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo. El es una persona bastante trabajadora yque siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar adelante a los suyos.
texts.en:
Oswaldo is a 28-year-old father who lives with his wife and two young children in the San Pablo sector, a rural area that is located within the Pomalca district. The main industries in the area are agriculture, small animal breeding, and the production of handmade hats.

He has been making adobe (bricks made of clay and rice straw, used in home construction; adobe's low price and accessibility makes it popular in the country's rural and low-income areas). During the time that he has been working, he has become well-known in the area, and he currently distributes his merchandise to his neighbors and to people in surrounding communities.

Additionally, he earns a living by raising and selling animals. He raises small animals behind his house, and he occasionally sells them to his neighbors and to other buyers. With these businesses, he supports his family.

Oswaldo would like to obtain several different materials to keep making adobe. For this reason, he is requesting a 500.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternative for the first time, which will help him reach his objective. He is a very hard-working person who is always giving his best to help his loved ones get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make adobe bricks

loans.name: Daissy Alexandra

texts.es:
Daissy Alexandra L. P. tiene 23 años.  Es soltera y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 niños, Tania (8) y Melani (2). 

Daissy es una socia de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Daissy se dedica a la agricultura, al negocio de legumbres, papas, trigo, habas, y arbejas. Realiza sus compras cada mes, el viernes, en Guaranda, y sus ventas en Echeandia el domingo, cada semana. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar chanchos y para poner más productos en su negocio de legumbres. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener más producción y un terreno para su trabajo, y tener una casa para su familia. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en papas, y enfermedades a los animales. 

Le gusta ayudar a su mama en la casa en su tiempo libre, y lavar las ropas.
texts.en:
Daissy Alexandra L. P. is a 23-year-old single woman who lives with her parents in the Guaranda canton of the Bolívar province. She has two children: Tania (8) and Melani (2). Daissy is a member of the Patrón San Juan rural microfinance institute, located a half an hour from Guaranda. There is a total of 16 members in the group, the majority of whom cultivate corn and potatoes. This is the group's first loan from the San José cooperative. Daissy is in agriculture. She sells vegetables, potatoes, wheat, broad beans and peas. She makes her purchases every month on Friday in Guaranda and sells her produce in Echeandia every Sunday. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase pigs and to offer more products in her vegetable business. She thinks that this loan is an opportunity for her to get ahead. She dreams of increasing crop production and of owning a plot of land for her work and a house for her family. She is facing some challenges, such as pests on her potato crops, and her animals are ill. She likes to help her mother at home and wash clothes in her spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs and expand vegetable business

loans.name: Mario Vinicio

texts.es:
Mario Vinicio L. O. tiene 26 años.  Es casado y vive con su esposa e hija, Evelin (9 meses), en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Mario es un socio de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Mario trabaja en la agricultura, desde los 14 años, siembra mora, trigo y cebada. Tiene cerdos y gallinos también y un Disco Móvil. Realiza sus compras en Guaranda y vende sus productos cada semana en Guaranda también. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para  cultivar moras. Piensa que el crédito le ayudara a la siembra de  moras. Su sueño es tener una casa propia. Faltan vías de comunicación para ayudarlos a ir a Guaranda hacer ventas y compras.

Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
Mario Vinicio L. O. is a 26-year-old man who lives with his wife and daughter, Evelin (9 months), in the Guaranda canton of the Bolívar province.

Mario is a member of the Patrón San Juan rural microfinance institute, located a half an hour from Guaranda. There is a total of 16 members in the group, the majority of whom cultivate corn and potatoes. This is the group's first loan from the San José cooperative.

Mario has been working in agriculture for the last 14 years. He grows berries, wheat, and barley. He also raises pigs and chickens, and offers disc jockey services. He makes his purchases in Guaranda and sells his products there every week.

He is requesting this loan in order to purchase supplies to cultivate berries. He thinks that this loan will help him with berry cultivation. His dream is to own a house. There is a lack of roads to help them go to Guaranda to buy and sell.

He likes to listen to music.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for berry cultivation

loans.name: Ángel Fausto

texts.es:
Ángel Fausto L. V. tiene 60 años.  Es casado y vive con su esposa y 4 hijos, de 25, 23, 20 y 18 años, en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Ángel es un socio de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Ángel trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando papas, cebada, trigo y otros cultivos. Realiza sus compras en Guaranda y Echeandia y sus ventas cada 6 meses en los 2 pueblos.
 
Solicita el préstamo para poner un negocio de animales, para comprarlos y después venderlos. Piensa que el crédito le ayudara a ganar mas dinero para seguir adelante e invertir en el negocio. Su sueño es encontrar ayuda para la agricultura. Dice que no es seguro de tener la cosecha con las plagas. También en el verano hay sequía y en el invierno, demasiado agua. 

Le gusta trabajar. Quisiera que sus hijos sean estudiantes o bachilleratos.
texts.en:
Ángel Fausto L. V. is a 60-year-old man who lives with his wife and 4 children, ages 25, 23, 20, and 18, in the Guaranda canton of the Bolívar province.

Ángel is a member of the Patrón San Juan rural microfinance institute, located a half an hour from Guaranda. There is a total of 16 members in the group, the majority of whom cultivate corn and potatoes. This is the group's first loan from the San José cooperative.

Ángel works in agriculture, cultivating potatoes, barley, wheat, and other crops. He makes his purchases in Guaranda and Echeandia and sells his products every 6 months in the those two towns.

He is requesting this loan in order to start selling and buying animals. He thinks that this loan will help him earn more money so that he can make progress and invest in the business. His dream is to find help with his agriculture. He states that there is no guarantee of a good harvest because of pests. There is also drought in the summer and too much rainfall in the winter.

He likes to work. He would like for his children to become students or get their degrees.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Launch animal business

loans.name: Deysi Liliana

texts.es:
Deysi tiene 19 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres, una familia de agricultores, en el sector San Pablo, una zona rural que pertenece al distrito de Pomalca, sus principales actividades con la agricultura y la crianza y venta de animales menores.

Deysi se dedica a la crianza y venta de cuyes, ella cuenta con varios ejemplares de este roedor oriundo de la serranía del Perú y de carne muy estimada. Cría a sus animales en un ambiente despejado, ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio y los vende principalmente a sus vecinos, aunque también los  vende a personas que viven en lugares aledaños. Con esta actividad ella solventa sus gastos personales y apoya a sus padres con el mantenimiento de la economía familiar.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta de animales con la compra de aves de corral, para ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Deysi es una joven emprendedora y que siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si para salir adelante. Sus amigos y conocidos de la zona le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Deysi is a 19-year-old woman who lives with her parents, a family of farmers, in the San Pablo sector, a rural zone that belongs to the Pomalca district. Her main activities are agriculture and raising and selling small animals.

Deysi raises and sells guinea pigs for a living. She has several of these rodents, which are native to the mountainous region of Peru, and whose meat is greatly esteemed. She raises her animals in an open environment, located to the rear of her house. She sells them mainly to her neighbors, but she also sells them to people who live in the surrounding communities. With this business, she is able to cover her personal expenses, as well as help her parents with the family expenses.

She hopes to expand her animal breeding business by purchasing fowl. In order to do so, she needs to request a 500.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first time, which will help her reach her objective.

Deysi is a young entrepreneur who is always trying to give her best so that she can get ahead in life. Her friends and acquaintances in the area esteem her and are very fond of her.


Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fowl to expand animal business

loans.name: Miryan Amaril

texts.es:
Miryan Amaril A. A. tiene 32 años.  Es casada y vive con su esposo e 2 hijos, Fátima (15) y Diomede (7), en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Miryan es una socia de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Miryan trabaja desde hace 15 años, en quehaceres domésticos y en el comercio de legumbres en Echeandia. También tiene ganadería y crianza de cerdos. Realiza sus compras en Guaranda y sus ventas el día domingo en Echeandia. 

Solicita el préstamo para aumentar su negocio y crianza de cerdos. Piensa que el crédito le ayudara a mejorar la calidad de vida. Su sueño es tener una casa y un terreno y ayudar sus hijos a convertirse en profesionales. Dice que las vías de comunicación no están buenas y que es un gran problema. 

Le gusta tejer suéteres y ponchos en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Miryan Amaril A. A. is a 32-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 2 children, Fátima (15) and Diomede (7), in the Guaranda canton of the Bolívar province.

Miryan is a member of the Patrón San Juan rural microfinance institute, located a half an hour from Guaranda. There is a total of 16 members in the group, the majority of whom cultivate corn and potatoes. This is the group's first loan from the San José cooperative.

Miryan has been working for the last 15 years doing domestic work and working at the vegetable market in Echeandia. She also raises cows and pigs. She makes her purchases in Guaranda and sells her products every Sunday in Echeandia.

She is requesting this loan in order to expand her business and her cattle farm. She thinks that this loan will help her improve her quality of life. Her dream is to own a house and a plot of land, as well as help her children become professionals. She says that there is a lack of communication, which is a big problem.

She likes to knit sweaters and ponchos in her spare time.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business and cattle farm

loans.name: Francisco Segundo

texts.es:
Francisco Segundo S. S. tiene 40 años.  Es soltero y vive con sus 2 hijos, Flor Maria (18) y Neiser (10), en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Francisco es un socio de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Francisco trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando papas, maíz y habas. Trabaja también en la ganadería, tiene 3 vacas. Realiza sus compras en Guaranda y hace sus ventas cada mes en Guaranda también. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar una vaca de leche para hacer queso. Piensa que el crédito le ayudara a comprar la vaca para aumentar su ganadería y su producción de leche. Su sueño es enviar sus hijos a la Universidad. Enfrenta problemas de salud en la familia. 

Le gusta jugar fútbol y voleibol.
texts.en:
Francisco Segundo S. S. is a 40-year-old single man who lives with his 2 children, Flor Maria (18) and Neiser (10), in the Guaranda canton of the Bolívar province.

Francisco is a member of the Patrón San Juan rural microfinance institute, located a half an hour from Guaranda. There is a total of 16 members in the group, the majority of whom cultivate corn and potatoes. This is the group's first loan from the San José cooperative.

Francisco grows potatoes, corn, and broad beans for a living. He is also a cattle farmer who owns 3 cows. He makes his purchases in Guaranda and sells his products there every month.

He is requesting this loan in order to purchase a dairy cow so that he can start making cheese. He thinks that this loan will help him obtain the cow so that he can increase his cattle farm and his milk production. His dream is to be able to send his children to the university. There exist some health problems within his family.

He likes to play soccer and volleyball.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy cow for cheese production

loans.name: Maryorie Jissela

texts.es:
Maryorie Jissela V. V. tiene 19 años.  Es soltera y vive con sus padres, en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Maryorie es una socia de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Maryorie trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando papas. También tiene una tienda donde vende colas y salchipapas (plato típico con salchichas y papas). Realiza sus compras cada semana el lunes y sus ventas el viernes y sábado en Guaranda.

Solicita el préstamo para aumentar su negocio de salchipapas y poner leche y otros productos. Piensa que el crédito le ayudara para vender más y aumentar su negocio. Su sueño es tener una casa y un terreno. 
Le gusta ver televisión e ir a pasear en Guaranda.
texts.en:
Maryorie Jissela V. V. is a 19-year-old single woman who lives with her parents in the Guaranda canton of the Bolívar province.

Maryorie is a member of the Patrón San Juan rural microfinance institute, located a half an hour from Guaranda. There is a total of 16 members in the group, the majority of whom cultivate corn and potatoes. This is their first loan from the San José cooperative.

Maryorie grows potatoes for a living. She also has a shop in which she sells soda pop and salchipapas (South American street food made with pan-fried sausages and fries). She makes her purchases every Monday and sells her products on Fridays and Saturdays in Guaranda.

She is requesting this loan in order to expand her salchipapa business, as well as to offer milk and other products. She thinks that this loan will help her boost sales and increase business. Her dream is to own a home and a plot of land.

She likes to watch television and to go out in Guaranda.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand street food business and sell milk and other products

loans.name: Edgar Duberly

texts.es:
Edgar Duberly V. A. tiene 28 años.  Es casado y vive con su esposa y 3 niños, Jasón (7), Andrea (3) y Katy (1), en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Edgar es un socio de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Edgar trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando papas. Realiza sus compras cada semana y sus ventas cada 3 o 4 meses en Guaranda.

Solicita el préstamo para sembrar papas: comprar semillas, abonos y fertilizantes. Su sueño es llegar a tener algo más, como terreno o casa, y un poco más de ganadería (vacas). Enfrenta gripe por los cultivos

Le gusta jugar voleibol
texts.en:
Edgar Duberly V. A. is 28 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and 3 children, Jasón (7), Andrea (3) and Katy (1), in the canton of Guaranda in the Bolívar province. Edgar is a member of the rural communal bank Patrón San Juan. It is located half an hour from Guaranda. There are 16 members total and the majority of them grow potatoes and corn. This is their first loan with the San José Cooperative. Edgar grows potatoes for a living. He makes his purchases weekly and sells every 3 or 4 months in Guaranda. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, manure and fertilizer. His dream is to have something more, such as land or a house, and a few more cows. He has had to deal with crop disease. He likes to play volleyball.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds, manure and fertilizer in order to plant potatoes

loans.name: Sara Pastoriza

texts.es:
Sara Pastoriza L. V. tiene 53 años.  Es casada y vive con su esposo, en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 7 hijos, 2 que son casados, 2 solteros, 2 en colegio y un pequeño.

Sara es una socia de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Sara trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando papas, trigo, cebada, habas y arbejas. Realiza sus compras y sus ventas en Guaranda.

Solicita el préstamo para sembrar papas: comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes y pagar gente para ayudarla. Su sueño es tener un terreno y dar estudios a sus hijos. Enfrenta enfermedades en la familia (su esposo).

Sus 2 hijos que están en el colegio trabajan con ella por la tarde (cuando no están al colegio).
texts.en:
Sara Pastoriza L. V. is 53 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in the Guaranda area of Bolívar province. She has 7 children: 2 are married, 2 are grown up but still single, 2 are in high school, and the youngest is a little boy. Sara is a member of the Patrón San Juan communal bank, which is located half an hour from Guaranda. There are 16 members in total, most of whom work growing potatoes and maize. This is the first loan they have taken with the [field partner] San José Co-operative. Sara works in agriculture, growing potatoes, wheat, barley, beans and peas. She sells them, and buys what she needs, in Guaranda. She is seeking the loan to plant potatoes: to buy the seed potatoes, fertilizers and manure, and to pay people to help her. Her dream is to have her own land and to pay for her children's studies. She is also concerned about her husband, who is battling illness. Her 2 children who are at high school help her at work after school.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed potatoes and fertilizers, and to pay people to help grow potatoes

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa tiene 42 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio del tránsito, departamento D. San Miguel, es casada,  tiene tres hijos D. las edades D. 15,13 y 8 respectivamente, se dedica a la venta D. tortillas y pupusas (tortilla D. maíz con queso y carne D. cerdo).
Inicialmente María, vendía frutas, y hace ocho años tiene su negocio D. venta D. tortillas y pupusas, tiene un puesto en el mercado municipal del Tránsito, la mayoría D. los clientes son amigos y personas que visitan el mercado, el negocio lo atienD. todos los días en un horario D. 7.00 am – 5:00 pm, la ventaja es que tiene mucha gente que la conoce. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra D. materia prima como son: Maíz, carne D. cerdo, queso, cal, aceite, condimentos y gas propano. Este inversión le ayudara a que ella continúe con el negocio y pueda generar  ingresos para solventar necesidades económicas D. la familia.
Las aspiraciones D. María son mantener el negocio y generar  ingresos para invertir en la educación D. los hijos, para que se conviertan en personas profesionales
texts.en:
María Teresa, 42, lives in the city of Tránsito, San Miguel department. She’s married and has three children who are 15, 13, and 8 years of age respectively. She’s a tortilla and pupusa (corn tortilla stuffed with cheese and pork) merchant. At first, María was a fruit vendor but she has had her tortilla and pupusa sales business for the last 8 years. She has a stall in the Tránsito Municipal Market. Most of her customers are friends and people who visit the market. She is open for business daily from 7am to 5pm. She has an advantage because she’s very well known by many people. She is asking for funds to buy raw materials like: corn, pork, cheese, lime powder, cooking oil, condiments and propane gas. This investment will help her continue with her work and produce income to meet the family’s economic needs. María’s aspirations are to keep her business to generate income to pay for her children’s education so that they may become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, pork, cheese, lime powder, cooking oil, condiments and propane gas.

loans.name: Tobías Emiliano

texts.es:
Tobías Emiliano L. V. tiene 39 años.  Es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

Tobías es un socio de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Tobías trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando papas, trigo, y maíz. También trabaja con motosierra. Realiza sus compras y sus ventas cada semana en Guaranda.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, abonos y fertilizantes para sembrar papas. También quisiera ampliar el huerto familiar (legumbres para consumir). Piensa que este crédito le dará facilidad para comprar lo que necesita. Su sueño es mejorar su alimentación. Enfrenta desafíos porque no hay lluvia en verano y se necesita agua del rió pero no hay. 

Le gusta trabajar y jugar indoor fútbol.
texts.en:
Tobías Emiliano L. V. is 39 years old. He’s single and has no children. He lives in Guranda canton in Bolívar province. Tobías is a member of the Patrón San Juan communal bank which is located half an hour from Guaranda. It has a total of 16 members most of whom are potato and corn farmers. This is the first loan they have taken out with Cooperativa San José. Tobías farms potatoes, wheat and corn. He also operates a power saw. He makes his purchases and sales weekly in Guaranda. He is asking for funds to buy seed, manure and fertilizers for his potato crops. He would also like to expand the family garden (vegetables grown for their own consumption). He feels that this loan will facilitate his buying everything he needs. His dream is to improve his nutrition He faces certain challenges because there is no rainfall in summer and water must be gotten from the river but there isn’t any. He enjoys working and playing indoor football.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed, manure and fertilizers for his potato crops.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
María Guadalupe es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el sector San Pablo, una zona rural del distrito de Pomalca, sus principales actividades son la agricultura, la ganadería y la artesanía.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la comercialización de productos de uso diario en una pequeña bodega instalada dentro de su domicilio, ella ofrece a sus vecinos algunos productos de primera necesidad que son dificiles de adquirir por la zona, esto le ha permitido obtener un grupo de clientes fieles que siempre acuden a su establecimiento. Adicionalmente cría animales menores, los cuales ofrece en venta a sus vecinos. Con estos ingresos ella ayuda a su esposo, que trabaja como obrero en una fábrica de ladrillos, a sostener la economía de su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más abarrotes, de modo que pueda implementar su negocio y ampliar sus ventas, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme  Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

María es una mujer de trato amable y servicial, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
texts.en:
María Guadalupe, 28, is a mother who lives with her husband and three children in the San Pablo sector, a rural area of Pomalca district. Her main economic activity is farming, cattle raising and handicrafts. For the last year she has had a grocery store set up in her home. She offers her neighbors basic need items that are hard to find in her area. This has brought her regular customers that always come to her store. In addition, she raises small farm animals to sell to her neighbors. Income she earns helps her husband, who is employed as a laborer in a brick factory, to support the family. María would like to expand her business buying more groceries so that a greater variety of stock will produce higher sales. For this reason, she has called upon Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to request a 500 new sol loan. María is a kind and helpful woman. Her neighbors and acquaintances hold her in high regard and respect.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock grocery items for her store that's in her home.

loans.name: Freddy Wilfrido

texts.es:
Freddy Wilfrido V. L. tiene 30 años.  Es soltero y vive con su padres y niña Melani (20 meses), en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

Freddy es un socio de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Freddy trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando papas, trigo, cebada y maíz. Realiza sus compras cada semana, y sus ventas cada 4 o 6 meses, en Guaranda.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, abonos y fertilizantes para cultivar papas. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara a trabajar bien. Quisiera seguir adelante trabajando y dar estudios a su hija. Enfrenta enfermedades y dificultad para comprar los insumos. 

Le gusta hacer deportes: jugar indoor fútbol y voleibol.
texts.en:
Freddy Wilfrido V. L. is 30 years old. He’s single and lives with his parents and his daughter, Melani (20 months old) in Guaranda canton, Bolívar province. Freddy is a member of the Patrón San Juan communal bank which is located half an hour from Guaranda. It has a total of 16 members most of whom are corn and potato farmers. This is their first loan with Cooperativa San José. Freddy farms potatoes, wheat, barley and corn. He makes his purchases weekly and his sales every four or six months in Guaranda. He is asking for funding to buy seed, manure and fertilizers for his potato crops. He feels that this loan will help him work well. He’d like to continue working to provide for his daughter’s education. He faces illnesses and difficulties to buy raw materials. He enjoys playing sports like indoor football and volleyball.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed, manure and fertilizers for his potato crops.

loans.name: Heidy Marilu

texts.es:
Heidy Marilu L. R. tiene 22 años.  Es casada y vive con su esposo y 2 niños, Antonio (3 años) y Wendy (17 meses), en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

Heidy es una socia de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Heidy trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando papas, trigo, cebada y maíz. Realiza sus compras cada semana y sus ventas cada 6 meses en Guaranda.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, abonos y químicos para cultivar papas. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara para progresar más en los cultivos. Su sueño es que a su hijo le vaya bien (fue operado en Quito hace poco días). La enfermedad del niño es su mayor desafió. 

Le gusta divertirse y jugar basketball como deportes.
texts.en:
Heidy Marilu L. R., 22, is married and lives with her husband and two children, Antonio, 3, and Wendy, 17 months, in Guaranda canton, Bolívar province. Heidy is a member of the Patrón San Juan communal bank located half an hour from Guaranda. It has a total of 16 members most of whom are corn and potato farmers. This is the first loan they have requested from Cooperativa San José. Heidy farms potatoes, wheat, barley and corn. She makes her purchases weekly and her sales every six months in Guaranda. She is asking for funds to buy seed, manure and chemical fertilizers for her potato crops. She feels that the loan will be helpful in order to make more progress with her crops. Her dream is that her son does well (he was operated on in Quito a few days ago). Her son’s illness is her greatest challenge. She likes to have fun and to play basketball as a sport.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed, manure and chemical fertilizers for her potato crops.

loans.name: Gloria Luzmila

texts.es:
Gloria Luzmila R. R. tiene 20 años.  Es soltera y vive con sus padres, en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

Gloria es una socia de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Gloria trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando papas. Realiza sus compras y sus ventas cada 2 meses en Guaranda.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, abonos y fertilizantes para cultivar papas. Piensa que este crédito le ayudara a trabajar bien. Quisiera trabajar más y ayudar a su familia. 

Le gusta limpiar la casa.
texts.en:
Gloria Luzmila R. R., 20, is single and lives with her parents in Guaranda canton, Bolívar province. Gloria is a member of the Patrón San Juan communal bank located half an hour from Guaranda. It has a total of 16 members most of whom are potato and corn farmers. This is their first loan request from Cooperativa San José. Gloria farms potatoes. She makes her purchases and her sales every two months in Guaranda. She is asking for funds to buy seed, manure and fertilizers for her potato crops. She feels the loan will help her work well. She’d like to work more and help her family. She enjoys cleaning the house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed, manure and fertilizers for her potato crops.

loans.name: Juana Lidia Cristina

texts.es: La señora Juana Lidia Cristina T. V. de 36 años de edad, con nivel  académico de sexto primaria aprobado, Casada, vive con un hijo. Se dedica a la elaboración de Muebles de madera como: Roperos, Chineros, Mesas entre Otros, quiere ampoliasr nsu capital de trabajo, para tener una mejor producccion en catidad de los muebles que elabora, tiene empleados a su cargo y lo que  espera es mejorar sus ganancias del trabajo que realiza , la que contribuirá a obtener mejores ingresos y tener una superación y mejor calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Mrs Juana Lidia Cristina T. V. is 36 years old and has a sixth grade education. She is married and lives with one son. She works at making wood furniture such as wardrobes, china cabinets, tables and others. She wants to increase her working capital to be able to have increased production of the furniture that she makes. She has employees working for her and wants to improve her realized gains, this will contribute to her obtaining better income and growth and a better quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nelly Judith

texts.es:
Nelly Judith V. B. tiene 33 años.  Es casada y vive con su esposo y 4 hijos, Edwin (15), Ronaldo (13), Adriano (10) y Wilson (8), en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar.

Nelly es una socia de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Nelly trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando papas, trigo, cebada y maíz. Realiza sus compras cada semana y sus ventas cada 6 meses en Guaranda.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar 2 vacas de leche si puede, para hacer queso. Sus sueños son tener un terreno y dar estudios a los niños. Trabaja duro y enfrenta falta de lluvia. 

Le gusta trabajar y ver la televisión cuando tiene tiempo.
texts.en:
Nelly Judith V. B., 33, is married and lives with her husband and four sons: Edwin, 15, Ronaldo, 13, Adriano, 10 and Wilson, 8, in Guaranda canton, Bolívar province. Nelly is a member of the Patrón San Juan communal bank located half an hour from Guaranda. It has a total of 16 members most of whom are potato and corn farmers. This is their first loan request from Cooperativa San José. Nelly farms potatoes, wheat, barley and corn. She makes her purchases weekly and her sales every six months in Guaranda. She is asking for a loan to buy two dairy cows, if possible, to make cheese. Her dream is to own a plot of land and to provide schooling for her sons. She works hard and faces the challenge of lack of rain. She enjoys working and watching television when she has time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows, if possible, to make cheese.

loans.name: Ángel Agnelio

texts.es:
Ángel Agnelio V. M. tiene 61 años.  Es casado y vive con su esposa, en el cantón de Guaranda en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos, 2 que son casados, 2 pequeños y los otros adolescentes.

Ángel es un socio de la ventanilla rural Patrón San Juan, que está ubicada a media hora de Guaranda. Son 16 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a cultivos de papas y maíz. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Ángel trabaja en la agricultura, cultivando papas, trigo, cebada y maíz. Realiza sus compras y sus ventas en Guaranda cuando haga la cosecha.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para sembrar papas. Quisiera tener plata para comprar lo que necesita y salir adelante. Falta dinero para trabajar. 

Le gusta jugar voleibol.
texts.en:
Ángel Agnelio V. M., 61, is married and lives with his wife in Guaranda canton, Bolívar province. He has 6 children: two who are married, 2 who are still little, and the rest who are adolescents. Ángel is a member of the Patrón San Juan communal bank located half an hour from Guaranda. It has a total of 16 members most of whom are potato and corn farmers. This is their first loan request from Cooperativa San José. Ángel farms potatoes, wheat, barley and corn. He makes his purchases and his sales in Guaranda when he harvests his crops. He is asking for funds to buy raw materials for potato farming. He’d like to have money to buy what he needs and move ahead. He lacks money to work. He enjoys playing volleyball.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for potato farming.

loans.name: Cesar Armando

texts.es:
Cesar es un padre de familia de 23 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus menor hijo en el barrio 22 de Octubre, una zona urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Cajamarca, una ciudad de la sierra norte del país, muy conocida por su carnaval,  se encuentra ubicada a mas de seis horas de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la venta de prendas de vestir en un mercado conocido como la Plataforma José Carlos Mariátegui, allí el ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, este centro de abastos es bastante frecuentado por lo que Cesar siempre cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles que prefieren los productos que ofrece.

Cesar desea adquirir mas mercadería para surtir mas su negocio y así captar mas clientes, ya que podrán encontrar mas variedad de ropa en su puesto, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Cesar es un joven que lucha diariamente por sacar adelante a su familia, su mayor anhelo es darles la estabilidad y calidad de vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Cesar is a 23-year-old father who lives with his wife and their small son in the 22 de Octubre neighborhood, an urban area on the edge of the city of Cajamarca. Cajamarca is a city in the mountains in the northern part of the county, and is well known for its carnival. The city is located more than 6 hours from the city of Chiclayo if traveling by car. For more than 5 years Cesar has made a living selling clothing in the Plataforma José Carlos Mariátegui market. He offers his customers all types of clothing for women, men, and children. The market is the wholesale food market and is quite busy, and that is why Cesar always has a loyal group of customers who prefer the products that he offers. Cesar wants to purchase more merchandise so that his business will be better stocked. This will allow him to attract more customers, since they will be able to find a greater variety of clothing at his booth. That is why Cesar has asked for his first loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 soles, which will help him to achieve his goal. Cesar is a young man who struggles daily to support his family. His greatest wish is to provide his family with the stability and the quality of life that they deserve.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing clothing so that he can increase his merchandise at his booth.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase candies to stock his business.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia tiene 64 años de edad y es separada desde hace 10 años, vive junto a su familia en la ciudad de Chota, una zona ubicada en la sierra norte del país (2394 m.s.n.m.), pertenece a la región Cajamarca y se encuentra ubicada a diez horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de verduras y especias en un puesto de venta ubicado dentro del mercado central de su ciudad, ella lleva trabajando en este negocio desde hace mas de 10 años, con estos ingresos ella trata de solventar los gastos familiares y sacar adelante a su familia.

Lidia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de verduras para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, el  mercado donde ofrece sus productos es bastante frecuentado por personas tanto de la ciudad, como también de los diversos distritos cercanos como Bambamarca y Tacabamba.

Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles. Sus compañeros y trabajo y conocidos le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Lidia, 64, has been separated for the last 10 years. She lives with her family in the city of Chota, located in the mountains in the north of the country (2394 meters above sea level). It belongs to the Cajamarca region and is located ten hours away from the city of Chiclayo. She is a vegetable and spice merchant in a stall located inside the city’s central market. She has been working thus for over 10 years. Income from this work is used to meet family expenses and to get the family ahead in life. Lidia wants to expand her business buying more vegetables to meet customer demand. The market where she’s set up is quite popular both with customers from the city and from the various nearby districts like Bambamarca and Tacabamba. To meet her objective, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 500 new sol, loan. Her coworkers and acquaintances consider her to be a level-headed, responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Aydee Gladis

texts.es:
Aydee tiene 55 años D. edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive junto a su familia en el distrito D. Chota, una zona ubicada en la sierra norte del país, específicamente a 2394 m.s.n.m., pertenece a la región Cajamarca y se encuentra ubicada a diez horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Ell cuenta con una bodega desD. hace mas D. 20 años, allí ofrece diversos artículos D. pasamanería, bebidas, lanas y vestimentas típicas para utilizarlas durante fiestas patronales. Este negocio le permite sacar adelante a su familia y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad se ha vuelto conocida por la zona y cuenta con un grupo D. clientes fieles.

Aydee se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la adquisición D. diversos productos que le permitan seguir captando mas clientes y percibir mas ganancias.

Ella goza D. muy buenas referencias por la zona en donD. vive, sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer trabajadora y que siempre fa lo mejor D. si para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Aydee, 55, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in the Chota district, an area located in the northern mountains of the country at an elevation of 2394 meters above sea level. It’s part of the Cajamarca region and located ten hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. For over 20 years she has had a general store where she stocks various items like lace trim, beverages, wool fabric and typical items of clothing to be used during festivals. This business allows her to support her family and help her husband meet household expenses. Because of the length of time she’s been in this business, she is very well known in the area and she has a group of regular customers. Aydee is asking Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 2000 new sol, loan that she plans to use to buy various items that will make it possible for her to attract more customers thus earning more profits. She has very good references where she lives; her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a hard working woman who always gives the best of herself to get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lace trims and assorted items for her store.

loans.name: Mujeres Audaces Group

texts.es:
Esta foto fue tomada en el negocio de la señora Josefina C. O., una  integrante del grupo Mujeres Audaces, que está ubicado en el Estado de Puebla en México. En la foto podemos apreciar su mercancía.   Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa  que inició hace 13  años. Solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en la venta de ropa además de que piensa iniciar con la venta de abarrotes. Las personas la estiman mucho y la reconocen como una persona muy trabajadora. Por el momento muestra los dos tipos de mercancía en un solo local.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se encuentra muy entusiasmada ya que considera que con ello podrá invertir más en su negocio y poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes en tiempo.  Tiene 38 años, estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria es casada y tiene en total 3 hijos (2 mujeres 1 varón).  Quiere este crédito para que en un futuro pueda tener un local para cada tipo de negocio.  Ella tiene la ilusión que con las ganancias de sus dos negocios bien establecidos pueda seguir construyendo más habitaciones a su casa.

El grupo está conformado por  10 integrantes y los otros integrantes son:

Maricela M.M.				Venta de repostería.
Sandra Rosario C.C.			Venta de pollo.
Cristina V.O.				Venta de refrescos.
Magdalena Herminia Z.R.		Venta de artículos para el hogar.
Evelia N.P.				Venta de Ropa.
Damaris I.F.				Venta de trastes.
Ignacia M.M.				Venta de ropa.
Maricela L.V.				Venta de ropa.
Guadalupe C.R.			Venta de cosméticos.
texts.en:
This photo was taken in Josefina C.O.’s business. She’s a member of the Mujeres Audaces (Daring Women) communal bank located in the Mexican state of Puebla. We can see her merchandise in the photo. She is a clothing merchant, a business she started 13 years ago. She is asking for funds to invest in the clothing sales business but she is also thinking about starting to sell groceries. People like her very much and recognize her as a hard working person. At present, she is stocking both kinds of items in the same location. At the moment of requesting the loan she is very excited because she feels that this will make it possible for her to invest more in her business and be able to fill all her pending orders from customers on time. She is 38 years old and finished 9th grade. She’s married and has three children, two girls and one boy. She wants this loan so that in the future she can have a separate location for each type of business. She hopes that with combined profits from both businesses she will be able to add on to her home. The Group has 10 members who are: Maricela M.M. Pastry sales. Sandra Rosario C.C. Chicken sales. Cristina V.O. Soft drinks sales. Magdalena Herminia Z.R. Home articles sales. Evelia N.P. Clothing sales. Damaris I.F. Dinnerware sales. Ignacia M.M. Clothing sales. Maricela L.V. Clothing sales. Guadalupe C.R. Cosmetics sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in clothing sales.

loans.name: Dulce Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “DULCE” y está ubicado en Lerma, este grupo se integra D. 10 integrantes se auto llamo Dulce ya que todas las clientas son muy alegres y risueñas en ocasiones también como hablan el dialecto Otomí se dicen algunos chistes y se L. pasan riendo. En este grupo se encuentra L. Sra. Adelina L.G. mejor conocida en el grupo como “AD.” elL. es L. tesorera del grupo y nos comenta que su abuelita y su mamá le enseñaron el arte del bordado desD. muy pequeña, además D. su dialecto natural que es el Otomí y D. el cual está orgullosa y también lo transmite a sus hijos ya que todavía perdura en esta región, L. señora AD. nos comenta que el crédito lo invierte en comprar material para su bordado como son telas e hilos, para elaborar sus servilletas y venderlas entre sus conocidos y aparte le distribuye a una D. sus hermanas quien las venD. en el Distrito Federal, esto lo realiza con el propósito D. apoyar a su esposo y sacar adelante a su pequeña hija.
   En este mismo grupo se encuentra L. señora María L. R. quien tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, L. clienta cuenta con 3 hijos, uno D. ellos ya es casado y los otros dos estudian, uno L. preparatoria y el más pequeño estudia L. secundaria, L. clienta ocupará el crédito  para poder surtir su tienda y poder obtener una mayor utilidad para así sacar adelante a sus hijos y darles una carrera profesional.
Los otros integrantes del grupo son:
PRESIDENTA:
 Roció MR
TESORERA:   
 Adelina LG
INTEGRANTES: 
 Valentina LP
 María Luisa RF
 Rosenda GG
 Tomasa Juliana GD
 Amalia FR 
 Zenaida BB
 MarceL. FH
 María Isabel D. L. CT
texts.en:
This Group is called DULCE (Sweet) and is located in Lerma. The group has 10 members. They named themselves Dulce because all the members are cheerful and happy. Sometimes, since they speak the Otomí dialect, they tell jokes among themselves and laugh together. One of the group members is Adelina L.G., better known in the group as “AD..” She is group treasurer and she tells us that she learned embroidery from her grandmother and mother since she was a little girl. Also, her native tongue is Otomí and she’s very proud of this and she transmits it to her children since it still perseveres in the region. AD. tells us that the loan will be used to buy supplies for her embroidery like fabric and thread to make napkins to sell among her acquaintances. She also supplies some to one of her sisters who goes to sell them in the Federal District (México City). All this is in an effort to help her husband and get her small daughter ahead in life. María L.R. is also a member of this group. She has a small grocery store in her home. She has three children. One of them is already married and the other two are in school, one in high school and the youngest in middle school. She will use the funds to stock her store in order to have higher profits so that she can proviD. her sons with professional studies. The other group members are: PRESIDENT: Roció MR TREASURER: Adelina LG MEMBERS: Valentina LP María Luisa RF Rosenda GG Tomasa Juliana GD Amalia FR Zenaida BB MarceL. FH María Isabel D. L. CT

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy embroidery supplies like fabric and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase vegetables & spices to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia P. is from the village of Cogon, Ozamiz City in Misamis Occidental Province.  Alicia is 58 years old and married with three adult-aged children. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a flower shop.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fresh flowers in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Alicia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia is requesting her first loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.  She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for a flower shop.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn T. is from the city of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental Province.  Rosalyn is 32, married, and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Rosalyn owns and operates a boarding  houses for students in the local community. Rosalyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rosalyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalyn is requesting her first loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to fund her business. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As working capital for the operation of a boarding house for students.

loans.name: Dorina

texts.en:
Dorina M. is from the city of Carmen Annex Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental Province.  Dorina is 35, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Dorina owns and operates "tricycle" (three-wheeled motorcycle taxi) transport services. Dorina has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Dorina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dorina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Dorina is requesting her sixth loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair a tricycle motorcycle engine. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a "tricycle" motorcycle taxi engine.

loans.name: Chanthon's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people who live in Samraong Mreah village in the Takeo province. Mrs. Chanthon M. is the group leader of the loan, having been selected by its members. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Chanthon M. and her husband, Mr. Lach Chin, are corn and sweet-potato sellers who are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to increase income to improve their family's living conditions, Mrs. Chanthon M. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets for breeding. 

This couple has four children, all are whom are students and also support their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn C. is from the village of Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental Province.  Jocelyn is 29, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a small general store where she sells a variety of products such as candies, biscuits, shampoo, coffee, and sugar.  Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn is requesting her first loan of 5,000 PHP which she will use to expand her business.  She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla C., age 48, is from the village of Gata Diot Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Merla and her husband have four grown children. To make a living, Merla runs a general store, where she sells a variety of different products such as sugar, shampoo, juice packs, milo, milk, and soft drinks in the local community. Merla has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Merla joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Merla has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Merla is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Merla from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Marialita

texts.en:
Marialita G., from the village of Lucsoon Tudela Misamis Occidental, is 43 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marialita owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products such as sardines, noodles, salt, sugar, and snacks in the local community. Engaged in her business for over five years, she earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Marialita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC, she is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be Marialita's fourth loan from GDMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Pet's Group

texts.en:
Eight people make up this village loan and they live in Samraong Mreah village, Takeo province. Mrs. Pet C. is the village bank president having been selected by its eight members. Each member of this village loan will use it to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Pet C. and her husband, Mr. Sroy Bun, are farmers who own a plot of land they use to cultivate rice and they work very hard with their farm to support their four children. Aside from farming, Mr. Sroy Bun is also a construction worker who is able to earn a small income to improve his family living.

For this farm, Mrs. Pet C. will use the loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to cultivate rice.

This couple has four children: one is laborer in an ice factory while the other three are students and also support their parents businesses. Mrs. Sok Soy, Mrs. Mao Lach and Mrs. Chinda Choun, who are group guarantors, are also shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline to cultivate rice

loans.name: Yolanda's Group

texts.en: Yolanda A. is from the village of Bolinsong Bonifacio. She is 52 years old. Yolanda is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by GDMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Yolanda is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Yolanda raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Yolanda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Yolanda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Mao's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao O. is 44 years old and she is the village bank president, having been selected by its thirteen members who live in Samraong Mreah village, Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use it to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Mao O. and her husband, Mr. Kong Paong, are farmers who owns a plot of land they use to cultivate rice and they work very hard to support their family living. Aside from farming, Mr. Kong Paon is also a construction worker.

In order to increase their income to improve their family living, Mrs. Mao O. will use the loan to buy a cow for breeding.
