This couple has five children: two are seamstresses in a garment factory while the other three are students in the local school.

Mrs. Srun K., Mr. Saem Phoeun, Mrs. Yoeung Meas and Mrs. Yeng O., who are group guarantors, are also are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Moun

texts.en:
Mrs. Moun M. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Chorm Kheun, live on an island of the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 1970 and have five children: one son and four daughters. Three of them have married and live outside the family home and the other two are cleaners. Mr. Chorm Kheun is a fisherman.

Moun has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to a middleman, who then takes them to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. Moun is asking for a loan in the amount of $100 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea M. (in the photo) is 34 years old and her husband, Mr. Moeun Mem, is 33 years old. They have been married since 1999 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Mr. Moeun Mem has been selling cows for three years. He buys cows from his village and sells them in other districts far away from his house. Sometimes, there is a middleman who comes to buy cows at his home as well. 

Sophea has been selling vegetables and meat in the local market for six years. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $700 to help her husband purchase a cow for resale.

loans.use: To help her husband purchase a cow for resale

loans.name: Lai's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lai S. is 37 years old and she is the village bank president, having been selected by its nine members who live in Samraong Mreah village, Takeo province. Each member of this group loan will use their loan to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Lai S. and her husband, Mr. Sis Nhoem, are farmers who own a plot of land they use to cultivate rice and they work very hard to support their children. For the farm, Mrs. Lai S. will use the loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline and to dig a well. Aside from farming, Mrs. Lai S. also sells corn and sweet potatoes and is able to earn a small income to support her family living.

This couple has three children: two are attending the local school while another one is fO. years old.

Mrs. Chanty Mook, Mrs. Lakk C., Mrs. Chamroeun Ten, and Mrs. Mat Nhim, who are group guarantors, are also shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline and to dig a well

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Mr. Chea P. (in the photo) is 36 years old and his wife, Mrs. Mala Chhoung, is 32 years old. They have been married since 1996 and have four children: one son and three daughters. All of them are in school. The family is living in a suburb of Phnom Penh City.  

Chea has been driving a motor taxi for more than five years. He drives in Phnom Penh. His wife has been a garment-factory worker for two years. Besides these occupations, the couple also operates a business by renting out a space of their house. 

Chea does not have a proper restroom to use in his family, so he is asking for his first loan in the amount of $300 in order to build a restroom.

loans.use: To build a restroom for his family to use

loans.name: Yon's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yon O. is 54 years old and she is the village bank president, having been selected by its twelve members who live in Samraong Mreah village, Takeo province. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purpose. They each hope to increase their income to improve their family living.

Mrs. Yon O. is a farmer who works very hard to support her three children; aside from farming, she also sells groceries and is able to earn a small profit to support her family. For her grocery store, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business activities.

Mrs. Yon O. is a widow with three children: one is a vehicle driver, one is a laborer in a garment factory, while the other one stays at home and also helps with the mother’s businesses.

Mrs. Thou Chap, Mrs. Rey Toem and Mrs. Bopha Vorn, who are group guarantors, are also shown in the group photo.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoin K. (shown in the photo with her husband) and her husband, Mr. Hor Leng, have been married since 1994 and have one daughter, who attends school, and one young son. They are living across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sophoin sells gasoline to travelers. To earn extra income to support her family, Sophoin is a silk weaver as well. She weaves silk at home. Her husband has been a motorbike and bicycle repairer since 2006. 

She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business. She also will use a part of the loan to buy additional motorbike and bicycle spare parts for her husband’s motorbike and bicycle repairing business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to buy additional spare parts for her husband’s motorbike and bicycle repairing business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma F. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Mapait, Brgy. Su-ay, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures:  fishing , fish vending and hog fattening. Her husband Antonio, who is 51 years old, works as a fisherman and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 4 children aged 16 to 25. 

Gemma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gemma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her to earn a monthly profit of PHP 16.000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 14th loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 26,000, which she intends to use to buy fishing gear so that she can continue to save up to renovate her home and to send her children to college. Gemma F. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF :In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: to buy more fishing gear

loans.name: Tarcela

texts.en:
Tarcela J. is a widow  who lives in Sitio Mapait, Brgy. Su-ay, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  fishing and a general store.

Tarcela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1989 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Tarcela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. 

Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a profit of PHP 18,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 50,000, which she intends to use to buy fishing gear and new multi-cab (a mini-truck) to use for her deliveries. She can then continue to save up for future house renovations.  J. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF)  is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and a mini-truck

loans.name: Andres Vicente

texts.es: El solicitante es soltero tiene un pequeño negocio en su domicilio una tienda lo cual percibe un ingreso semanal de S/. 300.00. el destino del credito es para compra de mercaderia y tener una tienda mas surtida
texts.en:
The borrower is a single man who runs a small shop in his home. His income from this business is 300 Soles per week (a little over US$100). The loan will be used to buy merchandise, so his shop is better stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Phen's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Phen V. is 61 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its thirteen members who are located in Chheu Neang Khpos village, Takeo province. With their loan, each member of this village bank hopes to increase his or her income to improve the living of their family.

Mr. Phen V. and his wife, Mrs. Nhor V., are farmers who own 2-hectares (5-acres) of land that they use to cultivate rice. For this farm, Mr. Phen V. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer.

Aside from farming, Mr. Phen V. is also the village chief who receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has four children: one is a farmer while the other three are students who also support their parents’ farming activities.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Ray Ronald

texts.es: El solicitante es casado tiene una hija de 04 años de edad; el cliente es chofer de mototaxi vive con su suegro con el cual comparte gastos. El destino del credito es para cosas que necesita en su hogar. su sueño es tener su propia movilidad y su casa
texts.en:
The borrower is a married man with a 4 year old daughter. They live with his father-in-law, with whom they share household expenses. Ray is a mototaxi driver. The loan will be used to buy things he needs for the home. His dream is to have his own transport and house.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Yaen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yaen M. is 33 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its seventeen members who are located in Chheu Neang Khpos village, Takeo province. With their loan, each member of this village hopes to increase their income to improve the living of their family.

Mrs. Yaen M. is a farmer who owns 2-hectares (5-acres) of land that she uses to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, she also sells groceries in the locality and is able to earn a small income to support her five children.

For her grocery selling, Mrs. Yaen M. will use the loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business activities. She is widow with five children, one of whom is a laborer, one is a farmer, while the other three are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma lives in a city called Chichawatni in Pakistan. She is the mother of three children, all of whom are attending school. Her husband has a cosmetics shop while Salma bibi supports her husband by working. She weaves carpet to order and completes it in three to six months, earning a good profit on it. 
 
Her husband wants to expand his cosmetics business; Salma has applied for a loan from Asasah for this purpose. With the help of the loan, Salma’s husband will put more cosmetics in his shop, which will definitely increase his chances of making more income.
 
Salma wants to renovate her home and she is hopeful that she will be able to do it with the help of the increased profits.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics for cosmetics shop

loans.name: Nhy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhy T. is 45 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its thirteen members who are located in Pou Khvet village, Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use it to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Nhy T. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, she is also a fruit seller in the local market and is able to earn a small profit to support her family.

For her fruit-selling business, Mrs. Nhy T. will use the loan to buy more fruits to sell. With the rest of the loan she wants to buy fertilizer for her rice cultivation.

Mrs. Nhy T. is a widow with two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the other is a student who also supports its mother’s businesses.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell plus fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Novel

texts.en:
After Novel A. has proven her capability to run and manage a hog-raising business, she now wants to venture into another kind of business. Through a much larger loan she is requesting through Kiva for the second time, Novel plans to open a “sari-sari” store, which will basically sell small quantities of various foodstuffs, grocery items and beverages. 

“Sari” in a native dialect of Antiquenos means "variety." This is just a small store that is either attached to the owner’s house or in a small native cottage not far away from the owner’s house. Items sold through this business bring convenience to people in the village, especially those who live far away from the town proper where the market is located.

Novel’s vision now becomes clearer because she has been able to inspire her irresponsible husband to cooperate through her previous business. Together with him, she will continue to work hard in achieving her dreams for her children.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of inventory for her "sari-sari" variety store

loans.name: Sokny's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokny C. is 45 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its sixteen members who are located in Pou Khvet village, Takeo province. With their loans, the members of this village will use the money to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Sokny C. is a farmer who owns 1.20-hectares (3-acres) of land that she uses to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, she is also a fruit and Khmer cake seller who is able to earn a small income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Saroeun Horm, is a government worker who receives a small salary to add to his wife’s income to improve the family living.This couple has two children: one is attending the local school while the youngest one is three years old.


In order to increase her income to improve the family living, Mrs. Sokny C. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig feed for a pig-breeding business.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and pig feed

loans.name: 10-15-03-Dong Son Group

texts.en:
"Van L. T. (31) is a 62 year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Van is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 03-Dong Son (10-15-03-Dong Son).


Van is married and has 3 adult -aged children.  To making a living, Van operates a family member's business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Van has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2005, Van joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Van has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3079800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6000000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 20th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Van plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  L. T. Hao (28) is a 57 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business.

2.  N. T. Hoa (32) is a 38 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a clothing business.

3.  L. T. Nhung (15) is a 58 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

4.  L. T. Duc (3) is a 64 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

5.  N. T. Nu (16) is a 40 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6000000 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom T. is 40 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its nine members who are located in Pou Khvet village, Takeo province. The members of this village loan will each use it to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Sokhom T. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, she also sells groceries in the local village and is able to earn a small income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Soeun Heng, is a fisherman and also supports his wife on the farm. This couple has three children: one is a farmer and the other two are students in the local school.

In order to support her husband’s business, Mrs. Sokhom T. will use the loan to buy a fishing boat. She will use the rest of the loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business activities.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat for her husband and more groceries to sell

loans.name: Nishan's Group

texts.en:
Nishan is applying for a loan to financially assist her husband who wants to expand his construction supply business. 
She is a housewife and lives in a city called Chichawatni, Pakistan. She has no children. She does stitching work to make some extra income. 
With the loan, her husband will put more construction supplies in his shop to make his business more profitable. 
Nishan will save the money from the profit for a rainy day.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies for resale

loans.name: Srey Pov's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Pov K. is 35 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its twenty members who are located in Kraom village, Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use the loan to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Srey Pov K. is a farmer who owns 1-hectare (2.5-acres) of land that she uses to cultivate rice. Her husband is a fisherman and also helps his wife on the farm. With these two businesses, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. This couple has three children who are all students in the local school.

In order to support their farm crop, Mrs. Srey Pov K. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Hong Leng's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Hong Leng H. is 36 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its nineteen members who are located in Kraom village, Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use the loan to support their different purpose.

Mr. Hong Leng H. and his wife, Mrs. Chan Thoeun Saem, are farmers who own 1.5-hectares (3.75-acres) of land that they use to cultivate rice. In order to support this farm, Mr. Hong Leng H. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer.

Aside from farming, Mr. Hong Leng H. is a rock breaker. This couple has four children: two are attending the local school and two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Parveen akhtar lives in the small city of Chichawatni Pakistan. 
She is the mother of five children. Three of them work while the other two are getting an education.


She is a housewife and takes care of her home and family. She is very supportive of her family and is always ready to help her husband and sons if they face difficulties. 


One of her sons is a rickshaw driver. His rickshaw needs to be repaired but his income is not high enough to pay the maintenance charges. So, Parveen is applying for a loan from Asasah to help her son repair his auto rickshaw. 


She always loves to see smiles on the faces of her children and she is sure that this help will make her son’s life easier and will put a smile on his face.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is applying for a loan from Asasah for her husband who wants to buy grocery items for his grocery shop.
She is the mother of four children. None of them could get an education due to financial constraints. They all live in the city of Chichawatni, in Pakistan. 


Her husband’s shop is the only one in his area so, there is potential to make a good income from his business. By carrying a greater variety of items, he can get a good profit.

 
Rukhsana is hopeful that investment will make a positive impact on her husband’s business and he will be able to make positive changes in his family life.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mr. Chea N. is an elderly man. His wife appears on the left of the photo at their house. Chea N. works as a requirement laborer who is hired by people to carry firewood for fee. He also assists his wife in cultivating rice and vegetable crops when he is free from his job. The couple is blessed to four children: two are already married and others are single. Recently, their crops required fertilizer; however, Chea N. doesn’t have enough money to buy fertilizer to grow his crops. For this reason Chea N. has decided to ask a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow his crops.

loans.name: Moeun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Moeun S. is 44 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its fifteen members who are located in Sdok Prei village, Takeo province. Each member of this village loan will use the loan to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Moeun S. and her husband, Mr. Cheas S., are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to grow rice and vegetables for a living. Aside from farming, they also make and sell fishing nets and are able to earn a small profit to support their family. This couple does not have any children.

Mrs. Moeun S. will use the loan to buy raw materials to make more fishing nets to sell.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make more fishing nets to sell

loans.name: Try

texts.en: Try S. is 23 year of age and a married woman. She resides with her husband who is shown on the left of the photo. They have two kids who attend the public school. To earn a daily income, Try S. produces and sells Khmer noodle to her nearby villagers for their breakfast Her husband operates a motor-taxi service. Their taxi often needs repairs, so Try S. is applying for a loan to repair it.

loans.use: To repair a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Cham Roeurn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. ChA. Roeurn B. is 55 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its fifteen members who are located in Sdok Prei village, Takeo province. With their loans, the members of this village will use the money to support their different purposes.

Mrs. ChA. Roeurn B. and her husband, Mr. Oem Sart, are farmers who work very hard to support their family. This couple has five children: two are coconut sellers, two are seamstresses in the garment factory, while the last one is a student.

With the farm, they still earn less income than needed to support their family. In order to increase their income to improve their family living, Mrs. ChA. Roeurn B. decided to ask fO. a loan to buy bamboo fO. a chicken house and to buy piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy bamboo for a chicken house and to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Tab's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tab P. is 47 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its fourteen members who are located in Sdok Prei village, Takeo province. With their loans, the members of this village will use the money to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Tab P. and her husband, Mr. Hen Nei, are sugar palm sellers who are able to earn a small income to support their family. This couple has seven children: three are construction workers while the other four are students in the local school and also support their parents’ business.

In order to support their business, Mrs. Tab P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more sugar palm to sell.

loans.use: To buy more sugar palm to sell

loans.name: Cher

texts.en: Mrs. Cher S. is a 26-year-old married woman and a local villager. She lives in a medium-sized home with other family members in Kompong Cham Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow a rice crop for the dual propose of eating and selling. Another source of family income is from her husband’s job. He also appears in the photo. He owns a motorcycle and trailer-cart that he uses to pick up the merchandise for fees. Unfortunately, his vehicle has been breaking down frequently. To remedy the situation, Cher S. would like to make a loan of $500 that she would use to replace the broken vehicle.

loans.use: to replace a wornout motorcycle.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mrs .Van K. has spent her entire life cultivating crops. It is a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young. She is now married and has three school-aged kids: one is married and the remaining two are single. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Growing crops is an annual operation with which she has had great success. She has been following both rainy and dry seasons. The coming rainfall is good for growing, but, Van K. doesn’t have enough capital yet to use on her farm. So, Van K. is asking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To use towards purchasing fertilizers, insecticides, a pump machine, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Jumabu's Group

texts.ru:
Человек порой, подобен листку, упавшему в речку, и теперь плывущему вниз по течению жизни в направлении неизвестности и неопределённости. Однако, разум и трезвое суждение, смекалка и чуточку везения уже делают этот лист твёрдым, способным самостоятельно преодолевать барьеры на пути и самому решать для себя, где же ему следует остановиться. 
Джумабу Дыйканбаева – лидер данной группы. Судьба уже испытала твёрдость характера Джумабу, когда погиб её муж. В свои преклонные годы, люди её возраста обычно уже перестают бороться за жизнь и предпочитают просто плыть по течению. Джумабу вполне заслужила такой отдых и отречение от всех обязанностей. Ведь она не только прожила последние годы, неустанно трудясь, а ещё вырастила и воспитала четверых детей. Ей удалось привить своим детям те самые качества, которые бы помогли детям не только достичь успеха в своих делах, но и благодаря которым Джумабу бы не пришлось за них краснеть, а наоборот только гордилась бы ими. Дети Джумабу выросли трудолюбивыми людьми, почитающими своих детей. Сейчас все дети работают и сами устраивают свои жизни. Единственная дочь замужем и живёт отдельно. При этом Джумабу всегда была для своих детей, прежде всего заботливой матерью, а не каким – нибудь начальником, или служащим. Чтобы не сидеть на шее своих детей, Джумабу на сегодня продолжает трудиться и зарабатывать себе на жизнь. Она занимается своим любимым и привычным делом – разведением скота. Благодаря этому занятию они даже построили дом. Сейчас тот самый трезвое суждение подсказывает ей не ждать своих средств, а обратиться за помощью. Джумабу надеется, что получив этот кредит, она сможет купить жеребёнка. 
Партнёры Джумабу по группе:
Султанбек Бабаев – отец троих детей. Ему пятьдесят один год. Чтобы прокормить свою семью Султанбек разводит скот, а его жена продаёт молоко. Султанбек обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить дойную корову для содержания.
Марие Ногоевой сорок шесть лет. Мария – мать пятерых детей. Старшему сыну двадцать пять, а младшей дочери тринадцать лет. Мария занимается скотоводством, и дети ей помогают. На кредит она хочет купить телёнка. 
Алымкан Байышовой сорок шесть лет. Алымкан воспитывает троих детей. Старшие сын и дочь учатся в ВУЗах и параллельно работают. Сама Алымкан занимается разведением скота и продажей молока. Алымкан, если получит кредит, хочет купить бычка, для откорма и дальнейшей перепродажи.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
A human being can sometimes be compared to a leaf that had fallen into a river and is now being carried by the current of life in an unknown and uncertain direction. However, reason, solid judgment, quick wit and a bit of good luck strengthen that leaf, enabling it to clear hurdles and decide independently where to stop. Jumabu D. is this group’s leader. Fate has already tested Jumabu’s character when her husband perished. People of that advanced age usually stop fighting for a better life and prefer simply to swim with the current. Jumabu would fully deserve getting such a rest and renouncing all responsibilities. After all she has not simply been working incessantly for years, but also managed to bring up four children. She has been able to inculcate in her children the qualities which would allow them to be successful, so that they would not embarrass Jumabu, but, on the contrary, would make Jumabu proud of them. They have grown up hard-working and respectful of their [parents]. Now all her children work and are responsible for their own lives. Her only daughter is married and lives separately. With that, Jumabu has always been for her children a caring mother, first of all, and not some kind of boss or bureaucrat. In order to avoid being a burden on her children, Jumabu still continues to work and support herself. She does the kind of work she knows and loves—raising livestock. Thanks to this work they have even been able to build a house. Now Jumabu’s sense of judgment tells her not to wait until she has the means but to turn for help. She is hoping to obtain this loan and to buy a foal. Jumabu’s partners in the group: Sultanbek B. is the father of three children. He is 51 years old. In order to support his family, he raises cattle, and his wife sells milk. Sultanbek requested a loan in order to buy a dairy cow. Mariya N. is 46 years old. She is the mother of five children. Her oldest son is 25 years old, and her youngest daughter is 13. Mariya raises livestock, and her children help her. She wants to use her loan to buy a calf. Alymkan B. is 46 years old. She is taking her three children. The older children, a son and a daughter, go to college and also work. Alymkan raises cattle and sells milk. If she obtains her loan, she would like to buy a calf for fattening and later resale.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a foal for breeding

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San S. is 38 years old and is a resident of Kompong Cham Province where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows rice crops which she plants twice a year.

San S. is widowed and is the mother of two children who are no longer in school but who work selling items at the school.

San S. is a hard-working woman who never wastes time when she could be earning money to ensure that her family has an adequate standard of living. She is applying for a loan to use as capital towards purchasing some farm supplies to use on her field.

loans.use: To use towards purchasing some farm supplies

loans.name: Larisa's Group

texts.ru:
Испытания, которые выпадают на долю человека, имеют двоякий результат. Они могут как и сломать человека, так и закалить его. К счастью, герои нашей истории, как правило воспринимают любое испытание, в качестве теста на прочность и в самым удачным образом её и проявляют, тем самым являя собою пример стойкости и уверенности. Как например, Лариса Шабданбекова, для которой потеря мужа и явилось тем самым испытанием. Ведь Лариса – мать двоих детей и перспектива жить дальше без отца, без главы семейства, и главного кормильца – довольно тяжёлый удар для любого человека, какой бы смелостью он ни обладал. Сейчас сыновья уже подросли и научились зарабатывать себе на жизнь. Сейчас ей 53 года и Ларися до сих пор продолжает трудиться во благо семьи. Старшему сыну тридцать лет. Он решил попытать счастья в России и сейчас находится там на заработках. Второй сын остался здесь в Кыргызстане и сейчас работает на стройке. Сама Лариса занимается животноводством. Хоть это и не совсем женское занятие, Лариса справляется с хозяйством вполне хорошо и притом ей помогает сноха. Лариса также продаёт молоко. Это ей приносит ежемесячно около тысячи трёхсот сомов. Лариса хотела бы увеличить поголовье. Для этого она считает необходимым приобрести ещё одного телёнка. Она уверена, что при правильном уходе и искреннем подходе всё получится.
Партнёры Ларисы:
Токтобубу Касымбековой шестдесят два года. Вместе с мужем они вырастили шестерых детей. Сыновья уехали в Казахстан, а дочери вышли замуж и живут отдельно. Чтобы прокормить самих себя,  Токтобубу с мужем занимаются животноводством. Токтобубу нужен кредит, чтобы купить строительные материалы для постройки сарая. 
Тинатин Ороспаевой пятьдесят три года. Она разведена и у Тинатин всего один четырнадцатилетний сын. Сама Тинатин зарабатывает на жизнь работая учителем в средней школе.  Тинатин обратилась за этим кредитом, чтобы купить тёлку для разведения. У Тинатин много планов. Она хотела бы открыть швейный цех, и за счёт прибыли от цеха, дать сыну хорошее образование. 
Максатбеку Мамбетову сорок лет. Максатбек женат. И у него четверо детей. Чтобы прокормить семью Максатбек предоставляет услуги сварщика и электрика. Он когда то оканчивал курсы, а по их окончании решил сделать сварочный аппарат и открыл у себя дома мастерскую. Максатбек нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить тёлку для увеличения поголовья. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Trials that a person comes across in life have a dual result. They can either break a person or make him stronger. Luckily, the heroes of our story, as a rule, treat any trials as tests of strength and have the best ability to show it, becoming examples of strength and confidence. Such is an example of Larisa S., for whom the loss of her husband became this trial. After all, Larisa is a mother of two children, and life without the head of household and main breadwinner is a fairly hard hit for any person, regardless how brave he could be. Now that her sons grew up, they learned to earn their own living. She is now 53 years old, and Larisa still continues to work hard for the benefit of her family. The oldest son is thirty years old. He decided to try his luck in Russia and now works there. The second son stayed here in Kyrgyzstan and now works at a construction site. Larisa is involved in animal husbandry, even though it is not a typical women's trade. Larisa takes care of the household well enough, plus, her daughter-in-law helps her. Larisa also sells milk, which yields a monthly income of close to three thousand som. She wants to increase the livestock headcount and needs another calf for this purpose. She is certain that with the right care and genuine approach, everything will work out well. Larisa's partners are: Toktobubu K. is sixty-two years old. Together with her husband, she raised six children. The sons left to go to Kazakhstan, and daughters got married and live separately. In order to support themselves, Toktobubu and her husband are involved in animal husbandry. Toktobubu needs a loan in order to buy building materials for the construction of a barn. Tinatin O. is fifty-three years old. She is divorced and has only one fourteen-year-old son. Tinatin earns a living working as a teacher at a secondary school. She requested this loan in order to buy a heifer for breeding. Tinatin has many plans. She wants to open a sewing factory and use profits from it to provide her son with good education. Maksatbek M. is forty years old. He is married and has four children. In order to support his family, he provides welding and electric services. Some time ago, Maksatbek was finishing his classes and after finishing the classes, decided to make welding equipment and opened a shop at his home. Maksatbek needs a loan to buy a heifer for increasing the headcount.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
The people shown in the photo are Mrs. Kem L. and her husband. They are villagers living with their children in a medium-sized home in Kompong Cham Province.

This couple owns 2 hectares (5 acres) of farmland that they inherited many years ago from their grandparents. On their land, they grow different kinds of crops and are able to plant twice a year.

The heavy rains are falling everywhere and this situation is good for planting. However, Kem L. doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. Thus, she is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing fertilizer, insecticide, a water pump and seed to grow, and to pay for a laborer to plow their farmland.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer, insecticide and a water pump and to pay for plowing

loans.name: Mairamkul's Group

texts.en: Infrastructure within a city plays a crucial role in the wellbeing of its residents. A city with many factories, enterprises and companies has a lot to offer for its residents regarding jobs and career opportunities. Tash Komur city used to be a prospering coal mining city with a predominantly Russian population. After the collapse of the Soviet Union, the mining process stopped and the whole process of development of the city’s infrastructure deteriorated. Now, this city is one of those cities that are regarded as dead cities, due to its high level of migration and unemployment. Our heroes are today’s residents of this city and Mairamkul T. is the leader of this group. She is a widow and has raised her children, facing all the difficulties herself. Now she is forty-two and, to provide for her family, she is occupied with cattle breeding. About fifteen years ago, she bought a cow and three goats and started raising cattle. Apart from that, she is also engaged in farming, growing certain kinds of vegetables. Mairamkul is the mother of four children. Her eldest son is a tractor driver and the rest of her children are daughters who help her look after the cattle and the garden. Mairamkul has applied for this loan as she wants to buy one more cow so as to have more milk for sale. She plans to send her eldest daughter to Jalalabad city to a medical school. Mairamkul’s partners: Aigerim T., 19, is married and has a daughter. She trades in watermelons and vegetables, as her mother-in-law offered to look after her child. Sometimes she and her husband sell vegetables by driving around the city in their car. Aigerim needs a loan to repair their kitchen. Meriza S., 19, is single and lives with her grandmother. To provide for herself and her grandmother, she grows vegetables, breeds cattle, and works as a waitress in a café. She needs this loan to buy two calves. Kubataaly K., 65, is retired. He grows corn, tomatoes and onions and, besides this, he keeps cattle. By having two occupations, he has been able to build a two-story house. He needs a loan to build a winter kitchen. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase one more cow

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Kim T. is 31 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its twelve members located in Tnaot Village in Takeo province. With the loan, the members of this village hope to increase their income to improve their family living.

Mrs. Kim T. is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Touch Phin, is a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family and also helps his wife on the farm. This couple has three children: two are attending the local school while the youngest one is 3 years old.

Mrs. Kim T. will use the loan to buy piglets to raise. With the rest of the loan she wants to buy fertilizer to grow rice on her farm.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Monishon's Group

texts.en: Unity is the premise of success and welfare. When all members of a family are united, this family will always be able to easily overcome temporary difficulties. Monishon Y., the leader of this group, has such a family. Monishon is forty years old and has raised three children. Her husband works as a security guard in a hospital. As to Monishon, she is engaged in selling milk and milk products. She can always rely on her family, be it her husband or her daughters. In the past, they used to just farm their piece of land. However, later, they were able to save sufficient funds to purchase cattle. Since then, they have also been breeding cattle, which has allowed them to buy new furniture for their house. Monishon’s daughters often sell milk from her business and they do their best to help their mother out. Monishon realizes that there is much work ahead. She plans to marry her daughter, provide a college education for her other two daughters and also make an extensive repair of their house. Now, Monishon’s monthly income is around 70 USD, and this is not sufficient to save money. She needs a loan to purchase sheep or goats to raise. That way she will be able to increase her income. Monishon’s partners: Motaborhon M., 41, is married and has a son. Her husband is a builder. Motaborhon is engaged in selling milk and milk products. Besides that, she works as a nurse. She needs a loan to purchase sheep to raise. Rohathan T., 36, has three daughters and breeds sheep. All her daughters are school students and, in their free time, actively help their parents to look after the cattle. Rohathan has applied for this loan to purchase some sheep to increase the total population of their livestock. Hafisahon U., 27, is engaged in breeding sheep but her regular job is in a hospital where she works as a nurse. She is married and, for now, does not have children. She hopes to obtain this loan and purchase sheep for breeding. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase sheep or goats to raise

loans.name: Khem's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khem S. is 61 years old and is the village bank president, having been selected by its ten members located in Tnaot Village, Takeo province. The members of this village loan will use the money to bU. supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Khem S. is a farmer who works very hard to support her two children. Her husband, Mr. K. Khoem, is a hammock seller who is able to earn a small income to support his family. This couple has two children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory while the other is a construction worker.

In order to increase her income to improve the family living, Mrs. Khem S. decided to ask for a loan to bU. piglets to raise.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Rysbubu's Group

texts.en: The Soviet Union built many cities and equipped them with the necessary infrastructure and established factories and plants. However, after the collapse, the Government failed to preserve production and the working process. Consequently these factories went bankrupt due to lack of strategic reformations in management and people had to adjust to a totally new reality. They had to start their lives all over again, and former engineers had to learn market economy and start trading. The heroes of our story are former factory workers and today’s entrepreneurs. Rysbubu D. is the leader of this group and is fifty. She had to raise her child on her own, as she lost her husband many years ago. In the Soviet period, Rysbubu purchased three sheep and started breeding livestock. Now she has a decent population of livestock and her son helps her look after the livestock. When a need for money appears, she sells some of her livestock and thus meets her daily needs. Rysbubu has applied for this loan as she wants to purchase three sheep to raise. She hopes to save enough funds to pay for her son’s marriage. Rysbubu’s partners: Emilbek S., 50, has a daughter and his wife is engaged in selling industrial products and foodstuffs. Emilbek is occupied with breeding livestock and hopes to obtain this loan to buy construction materials for a temporary building. Kuluipa A., 57, is a widow and is engaged in raising and selling livestock. Her son also helps her look after the livestock. Kuluipa would like to buy five more sheep and has therefore applied for this loan. Syinat O., 57, is a widow and, to provide for herself and her son, she breeds livestock. She needs a loan to buy five more sheep for sending them to summer pasture. She hopes that by means of livestock breeding, she will be able to build a house for her son. Gulzamira S., 53, is a widow who earns her livelihood by breeding livestock. Many years ago she bought four sheep and five goats and, since then, livestock has been her main source of income. Now, she hopes to obtain this loan to buy two sheep. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase three sheep

loans.name: Tasleem's Group

texts.en:
Tasleem has lived all of her life in a city called Chichawatni in Pakistan. She is 29 and a mother of four children who are all still very young. Her husband belongs to a plants selling business. He has the contacts with the other nurseries (plant sales outlet). 

He also has a nursery where he displays purchased plants for resale. He has been doing this business for 13 years, now he wants to expand his business for which Tasleem has applied for a loan for the first time from Asasah. With the loan amount her husband will buy more plants and sell them at his nursery. 

Tasleem hopes that with the help of an investment, her husband’s income will be increased which will help her to send her children to school.

loans.use: plants for nursery (plant sales outlet)

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia G. is from the village of Laturan, Libona, Bukidnon. She is 58 years old. Lucrecia is married and has four adult children. Lucrecia owns and operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies and also buying and selling different kinds of junk like plastic and steel in the local community. Lucrecia has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 7000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2006, Lucrecia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 21,000 PHP and was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

Lucrecia is now requesting her eighth loan from HSPFI, for 23,000 PHP, which will be used to to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Leocadia

texts.en:
Leocadia C. is from the village of Greenheights, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 54 years old. Leocadia is married and has nine adult children. Leocadia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Leocadia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Leocadia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Leocadia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leocadia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: buying additional products to sell

location.town: Green Heights, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis O

loans.name: Ainagul's Group

texts.en: Ainagul A. is the leader of this group. She is 45 and divorced. She has raised three daughters: two older daughters are at school and the youngest one is not yet in school. Fifteen years ago Ainagul, with an initial investment of 1,000 soms (approximately 22 USD), bought some products and began a retail trade. She sells convenience goods and various fruits and vegetables. In this way she makes 2,500 soms per month. With the money received from the loan, Ainagul wants to purchase various products to increase the turnover of her business. In the future she plans to expand her business and purchase a vehicle. Ainagul’s partners: Eliza S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 22 and married and has a son who is just three years old. Her husband works in construction. In order to make money Eliza sells socks and underwear. She started her activity two years ago with an initial investment 15,000 soms and now she makes 33,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase goods to increase the turnover of her business. In the future she wants to purchase a vehicle. Saktiyan I., 55, is married and her husband works as a security guard. They have two sons and two daughters. The older daughter is married and lives separately with her own family. The older son just started to work and the other children are students. In order to earn some money Saktiyan stared to sell various goods (cigarettes, bubble gum, chocolate, etc.) and, in this way, she makes 1,500 soms per month. She and her husband also breed cattle, and she applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase a calf for breeding and products to expand her business activity. In the future she plans to increase the number of her cattle and to repair her house. Liyrakan K., 45, is a widow. She has a daughter who is twelve and who studies at school. Six years ago, with an initial investment of 4,000 soms, Liyrakan started to sell toiletries and, in this way, she makes 5,000 soms per month. With the money received from the loan she wants to purchase a fridge. In the future she wants to expand her business to be able to support her daughter and pay for her education. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase various products to increase the turnover of her business

loans.name: Anwari's Group

texts.en:
Anwari lives in a city called Chichwatni in Pakistan. She is fifty years old lady who has four children but only one of them has got his education till 10th standard. 

Her husband buys animals, raises them, and then sells them in the animal market. He has been doing this business for almost 20 years. Anwari supports her husband by making and selling artificial flowers. She is very good at this art. 

Anwari has successfully completed its first loan from Asasah and now is applying for a loan for the second time to financially support her husband who will buy more animals for selling to expand his business and to increase his income. Anwari is hopeful that the investment in her husband’s business will bring a good positive change in her financial life.

loans.use: Purchasing animals for resale

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en:
Prescilla C. is from the village of Greenheights, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 60 years old. Prescilla is married and has six adult children. Prescilla owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main sources of income for the business come from selling both food & daily use products and also buying and selling eggs in the local community. Prescilla has been engaged in her business for less than two years and earns approximately 6000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Prescilla joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Prescilla is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Prescilla from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda T. wants to strengthen her food-selling and sari-sari (variety) store business to be able to increase the amount of profit she earns through it. A sari-sari store basically sells small quantities of various foodstuffs, grocery items and beverages. “Sari” is a word in the native dialect of Antiquenos meaning “variety”. This is just a small store that is either attached to the owner’s house or in a small native cottage not far away from the owner’s house. Items sold through this business bring convenience to people in the village, especially those who live far away from the town proper where the market is located. Erlinda started operating this kind of business when she first received a loan from Kiva through ASHI. Now that she has been able to pay back the whole amount of the loan she received, she would like to request a loan almost double the amount of the previous one. This would be used to grow her store and increase the volume of inventory she has for sale. Hopefully, by this she will achieve her goal of helping her neighbors to have access to food and other basic things they need for their everyday lives. With faith that one day her life, along with that of her children, will be changed and will be better, Erlinda is determined to face a lot of challenges, even without a partner. Having her two loving children with her is such a great inspiration for her to be strong and determined.

loans.use: To purchase a large volume of inventory for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Hort

texts.en: Mrs. Hort P. has spent her entire life raising crops, and is widely known as a skilled farmer who does an excellent job of helping to support her family. She is married and nine children, six of whom are married and living on their own. Her husband, who we see in the photo with Hort P., frequently works in the fields beside her. Last month, Hort P. planted potato crops but they are growing slowly due to a lack of fertilizer. To solve this problem, she has applied for a loan to buy the fertilizer she needs to improve her farm's output.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer to expand her farm's output.

Mrs. Mom M. and her husband, Mr. Vart Sau, are farmers who work very hard to support their children. In addition to farming, Mrs. Mom M. is a pig breeder at home. In order to increase her income to improve her family's standard of living, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy sugar palm and rice to make Khmer cake to sell. With the rest of her loan, she wants to buy fertilizer to grow rice. The couple has a child who attends a local school.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She rents a house with no electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are hospital bills and school fees.

Getrude operates a business buying and supplying maize and tobacco to the entire market. She has been supplying her products wholesale for the last seven years. She normally supplies all her products to local customers and to retailers in the market.

Getrude decided to work with Yehu so as to access loans to improve her business. With the Kshs 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase five sacks of tobacco, green vegetables, fruits, one sack of dried maize and green maize. She hopes to build her own business shop and become a big supplier in future.

loans.use: To purchase tobacco, green vegetables, fruits, dried maize and green maize

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Mrs. Thai T. is a middle-aged woman and is the mother of two children, both of whom go to school or work. In order to support her family, Thai T. sells a few grocery items out of her home. She began doing this a year ago and earns approximately $3 per day. She has a life partner in her husband who shown in the photo above. He is a domestic farmer who owns a machine that he uses to pick rice for fees. Thai T. has two hectares of farmland where she and her husband want to plant potatoes to make extra income but don’t have the capital to do so. Because she doesn't have money, Thai T. decided to request a loan to buy farm supplies for her field. Additionally, she hopes to enlarge her grocery business with any remaining cash from the loan.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and to enlarge her grocery business.

loans.name: Kishwar's Group

He works very hard to cover the expenses of his family but does not make enough to send his children to school. Kishwar’s husband wants to improve his business by putting more hair-related items such as hair tonics, creams, gels and dyes. So Kishwer has applied for a loan for the first time from Asasah for her husband so he can buy these items and enhance his business.

loans.use: Purchase hair products for barber shop

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
34-year-old Jocelyn L. is from the town of Santa Josefa. She is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a business venture, with her husband, in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also grows pigs for fattening and sale. From her income, she has also been able to open a small sari-sari store where, according to her, she gets daily income to support her children who go to school.

Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and feeds for the pigs. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Jocelyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve her business. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary D. is currently in the business of selling dried fish and Irish potatoes at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock bags of local Sudanese beans (ful) to sell.  Mary is 35 years old. She is married and her a husband is a teacher. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits resulting from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock bags of local Sudanese beans (ful) to sell.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally A. is from the village of Lower Tambo, Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 28 years old. Sally is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Sally owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products. Her income comes from selling personal home products and ready-to-wear products like dresses and shoes to the local community members. Sally has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Sally joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Sally is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & used as working capital. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Sally from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Aleksan

texts.en:
Aleksan A. was born in 1966. He lives in Aghavnavank village, Ijevan region, with his wife and three children: two sons and a daughter. After serving in the Armenian Army, Aleksan fought in Nagorno-Karabakh war conflict and received two medals for bravery. After that Aleksan engaged in stock-raising and beekeeping. His wife and children help him in his farming and thus they support their family. 
Aleksan asks for a 300,000 AMD loan, which he will use for buying 4 or 5 piglets and to install a gas cylinder in his car (this car he uses to transport milk from his farm to another village for sale).

loans.use: For buying 4 or 5 piglets and to install a gas cylinder in his car.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is the resident of a city called Chichawatni. She lives there with her husband who has a scrap business. She helps her husband financially by doing labor work and stitches clothes part-time for her neighborhood clients. She is the mother of five children. Three of the children are getting their education and two are not of school age yet. Nasreen wants her children to become successful in life by getting a quality education. 

She is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah. She will use the funds to financially support her husband who wants to expand his scrap business by buying more scrap. She thinks that continuous investment is the life-line of a successful business. She hopes that her husband’s business condition will be improved as a result of investment.

loans.use: Purchase scrap for scrap business.

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mrs. San N. earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house. She raises them both for their offspring and for slaughter. In addition, she also assists her husband in the cultivation of crops from her own farmland. The couple has a child who is already married and lives at home. San N. has raised a lot of piglets and she had hoped to sell them to buyers four months after she began raising them. Unfortunately, the pigs are not big enough, due to the lack of food. To help solve this problem, San N. has requested a loan of $1100 that she will use to buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs. She will use rest of the loan towards purchasing farm supplies to use on her field.

loans.use: To buy many sacks of pig feed to fatten her pigs.

loans.name: Roldan

texts.en:
Roldan L. is from the town of Santa Josefa. He is 27 years old and has a one-year-old child. To make a living, Roldan owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Roldan has been engaged in his business for over 3 years.

Roldan joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Roldan has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. He is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Roldan from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga Q. is from the village of Lower Tambo, Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 27 years old. Dominga is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Dominga runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Dominga has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Dominga joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Dominga is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Dominga from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Macasandig, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For purchasing different kinds of watches.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen has been a resident of the city called Chichawatni in Pakistan for the past 14 years. Her husband has a scrap business in the local market. 
Forty four years old, Nasreen has eight children. Only three of them are getting their education while the other two do labor work to financially support their family. 

Nasreen sells bangles to help her husband financially. She is applying for a loan from Asasah for her husband who is a loader by trade. He has been in this work for the past ten years. He uses his donkey cart to load different items, such as fruits & vegetables, and delivers it to the designated places. Presently, his cart has become rough and needs replacement. Nasreen is hopeful that, with his new donkey cart, her husband will be able to work more efficiently and provide better services to his clients.

loans.use: Purchase a new donkey cart for loading business.

loans.name: Kishmish

texts.en:
Kishmish S. is married and has two children. She lives in Ijevan city. She works at Ijevan Polyclinic as a nurse and, at the same time, she and her husband are engaged in beekeeping. Thanks to income from beekeeping they have kept their family, bought necessary furniture for their house and also organized their children’s weddings. 

Kishmish has taken a loan from Nor Horizon four times and now. She is asking for a 900,000 AMD loan that she will use to buy some bee families for her business.

loans.use: To buy some bee families for her business.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Юлдашева Сайера проживает в районе Кабадиян. Возраст, 33 года. Разведена, имеет 2 детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Образование среднее. Более 6 лет занимается животноводством. Откармливает и продает скот. Имеет большой опыт в этой области. Она любит свою работу и счастлива, что может прокормить свою семью. Кредит берет для закупа скота, чтобы увеличить их количество. Она благодарит Кива и людей, которые ей помогают в расширении ее деятельности.
texts.en:
Sayora Y. lives in the Qubadiyon area. She is 33 years old, divorced, and has two children. She lives with her parents. She has a high school education. For more than six years she has worked in animal husbandry. She fattens and sells cattle. She has vast experience in this area. She loves the work and is happy that she can support her family. She is taking out a loan to buy cattle and increase her herd. She is grateful to Kiva and to the people who are helping her expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa B. is from the town of Santa Josefa. She is 35 years old. Jesusa is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jesusa owns & operates a business venture planting and harvesting rice for sale. She also raises pigs, to have an extra source of income.

Jesusa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jesusa has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jesusa is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Jesusa from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.
