In the picture,  Amri is second from the right, in the back row wearing a grey t-shirt

loans.use: To buy two machines, one for drilling and one to plane wood

loans.name: Marcia Del Rocio

texts.es:
Marcia de 36 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas en disolución),  ella vende productos naturales, como medicina para las dolencias del cuerpo, y otro tipo de síntomas.

Ella vende productos naturales desde hace años atrás, con la ayuda de una amiga que le hablo para que venda productos naturales para poder mantener a sus tres hijos ya que se separo de su esposo. Poco a poco con esfuerzo ella pudo vender los productos, trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días.

Para poder construir mejor su casa y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, piedras y arena. En el futuro quiere tener otro punto de venta de productos naturales.
texts.en:
Marcia is 36 years old and she lives in Fortín de Guayaquil (a semi-urban area, with dirty paths, and deteriorating hills). She sells natural products like medicines for body pains and other kinds of symptoms. She has sold natural products for several years, with help from the friend who told her to sell natural products to support her children since she separated from her husband. Little by little, she has be able to sell her products. She works from eight in the morning until seven in the evening every day. In order to build a better house, and provide better service to her customers, she wants to buy cement, stones, and sand with the loan. In the future she wants to have another place to sell natural products.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement, stones, and sand.

loans.name: Ulezi Group

texts.en:
Swaumu Kassim, age 33,  is single  and has one child of 14 years.  She also looks after her late sister’s son, who is 14 years old and goes to school.  She  has operated a  beauty salon for  8 years.  She works from 6am to 9pm and she is able to make a monthly profit of about $165.

This will be Swaumu’s 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy two motor-bikes and she has paid back the loans successfully.  She is requesting a loan to increase on the salon equipments.

Swaumu will share this loan with her loan Group  Ulezi, which totals 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 
	
In the picture,  Swaumu is 1st on the right.

loans.use: To increase her beauty salon equipment

loans.name: Inti Group

texts.es:
La A.C. Inti tiene como presidente al señor Hernán Z., la mencionada asociación comunal pertenece al Centro Focal de Santiago II.  Muy rara vez se escoge como presidente a un varón, en general se elige a alguna de las socias mujeres, en todo caso esto significa que las socias confían en el señor Hernán.
Don Hernán está casado, es  padre de 6 hijos, ingreso a la asociación comunal hace 3 años, actualmente se dedica a pintar locales de fiestas. Cuando se le pregunta en que invertirá el dinero de su crédito el comenta que comprará pinturas y rodillos de pintura.   
Las integrantes de la asociación comunal tienen negocios de comercio de detergentes, venta de utensilios de cocina. Para este ciclo han optado por pagos mensuales.
texts.en:
Hernán is the president of the Inti Community Group. This group belongs to the Santiago II Focal Center. Very rarely a man is chosen to be the president, normally a one of the women members are picked. That means the members trust Hernan. Hernan is married and the father of six children. He joined the Group three years ago and currently works as a painter of party venues. When asked about the destination of the money from his loan he says he will buy paint and paint rollers. The members of the Community Group have businesses selling detergent and kitchen utensils. For the current cycle they have opted for monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paint rollers, paint

loans.name: Urafiki Group

texts.en:
Aloquin N., age 50, is married with 3 children ages 23, 21 and 16 years.  He has operated a cement business for 3 years now.  He works from 8am to 6pm daily and he is able to make a monthly profit of about $336.

This will be  Aloquin’s 1st Motisha  loan (loan given to good payers) from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He hopes to get a loan to buy more cement. 

Aloquin will share this loan with his loan group   Urafiki, which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture  Aloquin is in a blue T-shirt.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cement

loans.name: Fantasy Group

texts.es:
Ellos son el grupo Fantasy, llamado así por propuesta de uno de los integrantes ya que querían un nombre alegre, único y que los diferenciara, integrado por cinco personas con valentía,  coraje y muchas ganas de trabajar, además de un gran espíritu de visión y determinación y que trabajan diariamente para salir adelante y poder brindarle un mejor futuro a sus familias. Ellos radican en la comunidad de Ixtapaluca en el Estado de México. Los integrantes del grupo son: Araceli M. F. (Venta de Botanas y perfumes), Laura H. G. (Taller de Costura), Rosalba F. F. (Venta de ropa en general), Verónica M. C. (Venta de Cosméticos por catalogo) y Alejandro Juárez López (Venta de Bisutería)

Araceli F. es representante del grupo, tiene 35 años, con dos hijos que estudian primaria y secundaria, desde hace 13 años se dedica a las ventas ya que es una persona a la cual le gusta tener su propio dinero para así poder brindarle una ayuda a su papá y ayudar con los gastos de su casa, actualmente vende botanas como cacahuates, pistaches, gomitas, dulces, etc., y acaba de iniciar con la venta de perfumes, Araceli sale cada tercer día a ofrecer sus productos de casa en casa en su comunidad, sus días de mayor venta son los fines de semana. Araceli desea que sus hijos puedan terminar de estudiar y lleguen a tener una carrera ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de hacerlo, al igual que desea poder ampliar su casa y tener un mejor espacio para su familia El crédito que solicita lo va a destinar a la inversión de su mercancía como perfumes en general y botanas, para poder tener más clientes.

Cada integrante tiene planes y expectativas diferentes pero todos tienen deseos de hacerlos realidad y agradecen a Kiva el apoyo que se les brinda a través de Fundación Realidad.
texts.en:
Introducing the Fantasy Group, whose name was suggested by one for its members looking for a unique and happy name that would distinguish them. The group is formed by five resolute, brave and hard-working people with great spirits, vision and determination, working daily to progress and to offer a better future to their families. They live in the community of Ixtapaluca, Mexico. These are the members of the group: Araceli M. F. (snacks and perfumes sale), Laura H. G. (sewing workshop), Rosalba F. F. (clothes sale), Verónica M. C. (cosmetics sale by order) and Alejandro Juárez López (costume jewelry sale). Araceli F. represents the group: she is 35 years old, she has two children attending primary and secondary school and has been engaged in trading for 13 years, as she is likes being able to count on her own earnings so that she can help her father and help covering for the expenses of her house. She currently sells snacks such as peanuts, pistachios, wine gums, sweets and so on, and she has just started selling perfumes. Every three days, Araceli goes around her community selling her products door to door, and the week-end is when she makes the most out of her sales. Areceli wishes for her children to finish school and have a career, because she did not have the chance to do it; at the same time she wishes to extend her house and gain more space for her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy perfumes and snacks in order to gain more customers. Every member has different plans and expectations, but they all wish to make their dreams come true, and they are thankful to Kiva for the support it offers them through Fundación Realidad.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy snacks, perfumes and other different core products to sell.

loans.name: Jairo Enrique

texts.es:
Hace 22 años, de manera casual y por la necesidad del momento, en que no trabajaba y estudiaba arquitectura, hizo sus primeras camisetas y dese entonces se ha dedicado a la confección de ropa en tejido de punto. Al principio tenía una sola maquina pero gradualmente,cuando se incrementaron sus ventas y a fin de mejorar la calidad de su producto y buscar la eficiencia del proceso, ha ido comprando y adecuando su maquinaria hasta tener las que hoy tiene doce; Asì empezó el negocio Jairo J. S. hoy confeccionando al lado de su esposa, quien después de ser secretaria  se preparó en el Sena para dedicarse completamente a su negocio; ella es quien patrona y escala y él se dedica al diseño, corte, estampado y a la comercialización, principalmente: así tiene como sus clientes a colegios importantes en la ciudad de Barranquilla, a quienes les confecciona sweaters, sudaderas y todo lo que tiene que ver con la línea deportiva, que es el enfoque principal de su negocio. Jairo  apoyado siempre por su esposa ha sacado adelante a su familia,  que la conforman juntos con sus tres hijos de 15, 17 y 21 años de edad. A ellos sueña verlos profesionalmente realizados y en la actualidad está solicitando  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, un crédito educativo, por valor de $1.355.500 COP,  pues su hijo va a estudiar la carrera de abogado. Este es su sexto crédito con esta organización y siente que le ha ido muy bien porque ha logrado darle a sus hijos estudios principalmente.
Jairo dice que la internacionalización de la economía, es su gran desafío, porque lo ha afectado, en la medida en que el mercado trae desde la China, camisetas a muy bajo costo, pero las que en su familia fabrican son de mayor durabilidad; Jairo adema´s de trabajar en sunegocio con su esposa e hijas, tambien trabaja su madre y empleadas que trabajan por producción, el siempre está en busca de estrategias para poner en marcha toda su maquinaria, seguir ganando dinero y lograr trabajo y su bienestar familiar, que es el suyo propio. Jairo  es un miembro de familia incondicional y además es un buen pintor de hermosos cuadros que exhibe con mucha alegria en las paredes de su hogar.
texts.en:
22 years ago [Jairo J. S.] did not work and studied architecture on a casual basis. It was then that he manufactured his first t-shirts and has been sewing garments ever since. He started with a single sewing machine and gradually increased his number, as his sales increased, so that he could increase his efficiency and the quality of his products. He now has 12 machines. And so began Jairo J. S.'s business. He now sews alongside his wife, who was once a secretary, but now works exclusively in this business. She does the measuring and hiring, and he primarily does the design work, cutting, printing, and sales. His customers include prominent schools in the city of Barranquilla, for whom he makes sweaters, sweatshirts; and everything having to do with sports, which is his business' specialty. Jairo, along with his wife's support, has managed to move his family ahead. His family includes his three children, ages 15, 17, and 21. He hopes that he will one day be able to see them all have professional careers. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1.355.500 COP ($725), through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo because his son is going to begin studying to become a lawyer. This will be his sixth loan though this organization and he feels that things have gone well, because he has managed to provide his children with a primary education. Jairo tells us that the global economy has been a great setback to him, especially because of the Chinese merchandise that has entered the market. Their t-shirts are very inexpensive, but the ones he and his family manufacture are of better quality. Aside from Jario, his wife, and daughters, his mother and several employees also work in production. He is constantly looking for strategies to keep all of his machines producing, creating work, earning money, and providing for his family's (and his own) well being. Jario is a member of a loving family and is also a good artist who proudly displays his paintings on the walls of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Photocopier

loans.name: Jacira

texts.es: Jacira tiene 22 años, comparte su vida con su madre, juntas viven en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 2 años se dedica en la venta de comida, en un pequeño local que arrendó cerca de su casa. Desde entonces, y a partir del medio día, empieza con la venta de comida, además su madre es el principal apoyo que tiene, ya sea en la preparación o atención de los clientes. Afirma además, que disfruta mucho el trabajo que realiza, ya que recibe los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su hijo, otras de las ventajas que tiene con este trabajo, es que puede cuidar de su hijo. Por tanto desea mejorar su establecimiento, implementándola y mejorando en la atención. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de ollas nuevas, mesas y alimentos no perecibles que le servirá en la preparación de comida.
texts.en:
Jacira is 22 years old and shares her life with her mother. They live together in her parents' house. For the past two years she's been selling food from a small stall that she set up close to her home. Ever since then, beginning at noon, she begins selling food. Her mother is her primary helper, whether it includes food preparation or tending to customers. She says that she enjoys the work she does, especially because she earns the income she needs to support her son. Another advantage this business gives her is that she is able to care for her son. Now, she would like to improve her establishment and customer service. This will be her first loan through MFP and she is very happy, knowing that she has financial support and she is grateful to be a part of a communal group because all of its members are very responsible and supportive. She will use the money from this loan to buy new cookware, tables, and non-perishable food items that she will use to prepare her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies and ingredients

loans.name: Yvette Akouavi

texts.fr: cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de cartes de recharges téléphoniques Togocel Moov et illico,elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2009, elle fait face à une baisse de son stock de cartes de recharges, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour l'achat de diverses cartes de recharges téléphoniques.elle s'approvisionne auprès des divers grossistes de la capitale. elle est célibataire et c'est avec le revenu de son commerce qu'elle subvient à sa charges.
texts.en:
Since 2009 this lady has sold Togocel Moov and Illico mobile phone topup cards for a living. She is currently facing a drop in her phone card stock levels, and so is seeking her first credit from WAGES in order to purchase some more. She purchases her goods from various wholesalers in the capital. She is single and uses the revenue that she generates in order to see to everyday needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mobile telephone topup cards

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua H. is a widow and is taking care of seven dependents. She is responsible for the welfare of her dependents. She has received junior high education.

Ekua cooks banku (a local dish made from corn dough) and fried fish with hot pepper sauce for sale at Abura. She has been selling banku and fried fish for twenty years now. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize to prepare her dough to make banku to sell and to also sell some of the raw corn.

Ekua hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize to prepare more banku and also to sell

loans.name: Las Morenitas Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SOLIDARIO SE LLAMA LAS MORENITAS, ESTA UBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE JALOXTOC, EN EL ESTADO DE MORELOS, MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 6 INTEGRANTES QUE SE CONOCEN POR SER VECINOS. ESTE ES EL 1er. PRESTAMO CON FUNDACION REALIDAD.66
EL REPRESENTANTE DEL GRUPO ES LA SEÑORA ROCIO M. C. TIENE 37 AÑOS ESTUDIO HASTA EL 6º. AÑO DE PRIMARIA Y TIENE 4 HIJOS 3 HOMBRES Y 1 MUJER,  EDUARDO TIENE 20 AÑOS, EDGAR TIENE 17 AÑOS, LUIS FRANCISCO TIENE 9 AÑOS Y CARMEN TIENE 23 AÑOS. LA SEÑORA ROCIO TIENE SU NEGOCIO DE VENTA DE REFRESCOS Y ARTICULOS DE BELLEZA PARA DAMA, CON SU PRESTAMO VA A COMPRAR REFRESCOS, PERFUMES, DESODORANTES, LAPIZ LABIAL, BARNIZ, ARETES, BOLSAS, ETC. 
SU NEGOCIO ESTA EN SU CASA EN JALOXTOC y lo INICIO HACE 1 AÑO POR QUE LE GUSTA VENDER PARA TENER DINERO PARA PODER SOLVENTAR SUS GASTOS, ANTERIORMENTE LOS SABADOS Y DOMINGOS VENDIA POZOLE, TACOS DE SUADERO TACOS, DORADOS, TOSTADAS, PERO SU ESPOSO TUVO UN ACCIDENTE Y DEJO DE VENDER. 
HAY VECES QUE TIENE QUE SALIR CON SU ESPOSO A TERAPIAS MEDICAS, SU NEGOCIO ES MUY IMPORTANTE PARA ELLA, YA QUE LE AYUDÓ A CUBRIR LOS GASTOS DE LA FAMILIA CUANDO SU ESPOSO ENFERMÓ Y CON LAS UTILIDADES HA PODIDO SEGUIR COMPRANDO MERCANCIA PARA SEGUIR VENDIENDO Y CUBRIR LOS GASTOS DE SU CASA.
SUS SUEÑOS SON INCREMENTAR SU TIENDA QUE ESTE MAS GRANDE Y BIEN SURTIDA Y QUE SU PEQUEÑO HIJO ESTUDIE Y TENGA LA OPORTUNIDAD DE TENER UNA CARRERA. LOS DESAFIOS QUE A ENFRENTADO ES QUE DEJO DE VENDER LOS SABADOS EL POZOLE Y LOS TACOS DE SUADERO POR QUE SU ESPOSO TUVO UN ACCIDENTE Y YA NO PUEDE ATENDERLO PUES TIENE QUE SALIR A LOS CHEQUEOS MÉDICOS. 
LOS DEMÁS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SON: 
*JUANA M. M. Y VA A COMPRAR CON EL PRESTAMO PANTALONES, BLUSAS, FALDAS, CALCETINES Y ROPA INTERIOR
*MARIA O. M. VA A COMPRAR PERFUMES PARA DAMA Y CABALLERO, LABIALES, DESODORANTES, DELINEADORES
*JUANA A. V. VA A COMPRA REFRESCOS POR CAJA DE 2 LITROS, 1 LITRO Y MEDIO Y JUGOS
*ALMA DELIA J. V. VA A COMPRAR  PALETAS, CHICLES, CHICHARRONES, CHOCOLATES ETC. PARA INICIAR SU NEGOCIO
*PAULA V. A. VA A COMPRAR  2 BORREGOS HEMBRA Y MACHO PARA QUE  SE REPRODUZCAN. 

LOS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO QUIEREN DECIR A KIVA Y A FUNDACION REALIDAD: “GRACIAS POR ABERNOS PRESTADO Y QUE SIGAR AYUDANDO A MAS PERSONAS QUE LO NECESITEN Y QUE SALGAN MAS PRESTAMOS PERO SIN AUMENTAR EL INTERES GRACIAS”
texts.en:
This Solidarity Group is called "Las Morenitas" ("The Brunettes"). It is located in the community of Jaloxtoc, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. The group has 6 members who know each other because they live in the same neighborhood. This is their first loan with the Realidad Foundation. The group's representative is Rocio M. C.. She is 37 years old and has been educated through the 6th year of primary school. She has four children, three boys and one girl; Eduardo is 20, Edgar is 17, Luis Francisco is 9, and Carmen is 23. Rocio's business is selling soft drinks as well as beauty products for women. With her loan, she will buy soft drinks, perfumes, deodorants, lipstick, gloss, earrings, purses, etc. Her business is located in her home in Jaloxtoc. She started it one year ago, because she likes to sell things and earn money to buy more stock. Previously, on Saturdays and Sundays she sold pozole (a soup), tostadas and pan-heated and fried tacos, but her husband had an accident and she stopped selling. There are times when she has to go out with her husband for his therapy sessions. Her business is important to her, because she was able to cover her family's expenses when her husband became ill. With her profits, she can keep buying more merchandise to keep selling and also support her household. Her dreams are to expand her store, so it will be larger and well-stocked, and also that her youngest son will be able to attend the university and have the chance to pursue a career. The challenges she has faced include stopping her sales of pozole and tacos on Saturdays, because her husband had an accident and she had to take care of him and sometimes go out to medical checkups. Another member of the group is Juana M. M., who will use the funds from the loan to buy pants, blouses, skirts, socks and underwear. Rocio M. C. will buy flavored soft drinks in 2-liter and 500-ml bottles to stock her business. Maria O. M. will buy women's and men's perfumes and colognes, lipstick, deodorants, and mascara. Juana A. V. will buy soft drinks by the case in 2-liter and 1.5-liter bottles, as well as juices. Alma Delia J. V. will buy popsicles, gum, pork rinds, chocolates, etc. to start her business. Paula V. A. will buy two sheep, male and female, so she can start breeding them. The group members would like to say to Kiva and to the Realidad Foundation: "Thank you for having granted the loan to us, and we hope you will continue helping more people who need it, and that more loans will be granted, but without raising the interest rate; thank you!"

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying soft drinks, perfumes, deodorants, lipstick, gloss, earrings, purses, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy natural and chemical fertilizers for his corn and bean crops

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua K. produces locally-made soap and fries fish at Abura for sale. She has been in soap production for about ten years. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients to make soap to meet her increasing number of customers. She is optimistic that she will be able to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a shop.

Akosua has been through junior high school. She is divorced with six dependents. She is responsible for educating, feeding and clothing her dependents.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to make soap

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 55 años, vive en su casa propia con sus 3 hijos. DesD. su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura y desD. entonces continua cultivando en terrenos que le fue heredado D. sus padres. Los productos que siembra principalmente son: papa y maíz así como también algunas hortalizas como cebolla, lechuga y zanahorias que después D. su cosecha lo lleva a vender a los comerciantes D. los diferentes mercados D. su zona. Sus 3 hijos la apoyan  en todo este proceso D. cultivo, en donD. se requiere fertilizar y cuidar las plantas, D. esa manera se ahorra el contratar mano D. obra. La siembra en años anteriores no le fue muy bien debido a los cambios climáticos, pero a pesar D. esta dificultad siempre tiene disponible  el alimento necesario para su familia, además con una parte D. su cosecha prepara comida, en el que luego son vendidos todas las tardes cerca D. su casa. En el futuro desea adquirir más semillas para sembrarlas. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D. saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas para su nueva temporada D. siembra así como nuevos platos para su reciente negocio D. comida.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 55, lives in her own house with her three children. She has devoted herself to farming since she was a child. From then on she has continued to cultivate the fields that she inherited from her parents. The products she plants primarily are potatoes and corn. She also grows some vegetables like onions, lettuce, and carrots. After the harvest she takes her products to sell to the merchants at the different markets in her area. Her three children help her with the whole cultivation process. The plants need to be taken care of and fertilized. This way she saves the labor costs. In previous years the planting did not go very well for her due to weather changes. In spite of this difficulty, she always has food available to feed her family. Also, with part of the harvest she prepares food. The food is later sold close to her house every afternoon. In the future she wants to get more seeds to plant. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support. She has always shown herself to be responsible with her payments. Also, she is pleased to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible people, and they are very united. She will use the requested loan to buy seeds for the new planting season. She will also buy new plates for her new food business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds for the next planting season

loans.name: Diamante Verde Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama “Diamante verde”, está ubicado en la comunidad de barrio San Bartolo, Tlalnepantla, en el estado de Morelos, México. El grupo está conformado por 5 integrantes que se conocen, este es su 1er. préstamo con Fundación Realidad. 
El representante del grupo es la señora Cristina Colín R., tiene 26 años, estudio hasta el 6º año de primaria, tiene 3 hijos 2 niños y 1 niña  Gerardo Guadalupe tiene 6 años, Leonardo David  tiene 1 año y medio y Jazmín Araceli tiene 8 años, los dos más grandes están estudiando. Ella se dedica a sembrar nopal y venderlo al centro de acopio, son varios compradores que van de varias ciudades como de Toluca, Hidalgo con camiones para transportar los nopales. Ella va a utilizar su préstamo para comprar abono orgánico, para fertilizar su siembra de nopal y de mas nopal, más bonito y verde, ella apenas inicio con el negocio porque su papa le acaba de heredar el terreno que se llama “Tlallelpa” para llegar al terreno se hace media hora caminando de su casa. Su esposo se dedica al campo y él le va a ayudar con el negocio de la siembra del nopal. Ella dice: “es importante mi negocio porque al cosechar el nopal voy a tener para los gastos de la familia y ya trabajando uno su tierra le da más ganancias que podemos utilizar para seguir sembrando y para la comida”. Ella espera no falte lo necesario para la familia, la alimentación y la escuela. 
Tlalnepantla es un lugar muy bonito con clima templado están cerca el monte, los cerros se ven bonitos por que llueve y todo está verde.
Los integrantes del grupo son Cristina Colín R. con su préstamo va a comprar abono orgánico para fertilizar la siembra de nopal 
Mirella E. Ramírez va a comprar abono químico para fertilizar su siembra   de nopal.
Caritina R. F. va a compra ropa para dama, faldas, blusas, pantalón y ropa de bebe conjuntos de algodón.
Evertina Espíndola A. va a compra verdura por caja, jitomate, calabaza, chiles, tomates, cilantro. 
Demetria F. S. va a comprar mercancía, refrescos por caja, huevo, aceite por caja para surtir su tienda.
Ellas quieren decir a KIVA y a Fundación Realidad “gracias porque siempre necesitamos que nos presten ya que con su ayuda podemos realizar lo que tenemos planeado y les pedimos sigan ayudando a más personas con sus préstamos”
texts.en:
This group is called “Diamante verde” (Green diamond), and is located in Morelos State, México. The group has five members, all acquaintances, and this is their first loan with Kiva partner Fundación Realidad. The group's leader is Cristina Colín R.; she is 26 years old, has finished 6th grade, and has three kids: two boys, Gerardo (6) and Leonardo (1) and a girl, Jazmin (8). Cristina just inherited some land from her father. The place is very pretty, with temperate climate and close to the forest. There are hills close by, which the rain makes green. In this new land, Cristina just started a new business growing edible cactuses (nopales), which she sells at the wholesale market. Many buyers go from city to city with large trucks to transport the nopales. Cristina will use the loan to buy organic fertilizer for her nopales, to make them grow greener and prettier. Cristina's husband is a farmer, and will help Cristina with the nopal business. He says: “This business is important because once I harvest the nopales, I will have enough to support my family. When one works the land, one earns money to keep planting and harvesting, and to feed one's family." Cristina hopes to have enough for her family, for their food and education. The other members will use their loan for the following: Mirella E. Ramírez will buy chemical fertilizer for her nopales. Caritina R. F. will buy women's clothes - skirts, blouses, trousers - and baby clothes. Evertina Espíndola A. will buy wholesale vegetables: tomatoes, pumpkin, chilies, cilantro. Demetria F. S. will buy various goods: softdrinks, eggs, oil to stock her store. The women want to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad “thank you because we always need a hand and with your help, we can accomplish our plans. Please continue to help others with your loans"

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying organic fertilizer for her cactus plants

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice B. is a hairdresser in Abura. She has received senior high education. She is married to a farmer and has three children. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Beatrice has been a hairdresser for three years. Her loan will be used to buy more creams and hair products to sell. She wishes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy an additional hairdryer.

loans.use: To buy more creams and hair products to sell

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame P. sells soap, washing powder, toothpaste and other items at Abura by travelling from one house to another.

Maame has been through senior high education. She is married and has a child. Her husband is a plumber and she supports her husband in providing the basic needs of the family.

Maame has been in this trade for two years. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. She anticipates using the new profits from her business to save to buy a shop for her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buying goods, stock, and merchandise

loans.name: Celso Serapio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es la Sr. Serapio; él tiene 30 años de edad y El socio es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, de 9 y 8 años de edad; es natural de la provincia de Quispicanchis distrito de Ocongate,  El socio se dedica a la compra y venta de cosas de segunda mano, el lo llama compra y venta de chatarrería, en su stand se encuentra todo tipo de repuestos de todos los electrodomésticos desde tornillos, manijas, llaves, cobertores, y mucho mas, también tiene desde clavos pequeñitos hasta los más grandes, también monedas antiguas, él socio llega a vender en la ciudad de Lima algunas cosas como repuestos de maquinas que ya no se encuentran en el mercado y podría fácilmente servir para mejorar algún artefacto antiguo. El socio solicita el préstamo para capital de trabajo, él comprará chatarrería en Lima para traer a Cusco.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Las Palmeras Communal Bank. The member lives in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. Mr. Serapio is the member. He is 30 years old, and he is in a common-law marriage. They have two children, a nine year old and an eight year old. He is from the Quispicanchis province in the Ocongate district. The member buys and sells second hand things. He calls it buying and selling junk. In his stand you can find all types of replacement parts for home appliances. You can find things from screws, to handles, keys, covers, and much more. He also has a range of very small nails up to the biggest. He also has antique coins. The member goes to the city of Lima to sell some things like machine replacement parts. They are not found at the market, and they could easily work to improve an old appliance. The member is requesting a loan for working capital. He will buy junk in Lima to take to Cusco. The member values the loan and is infinitely grateful. It allows him to grow with his business and improve his quality of life. He pledges to make all of his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For working capital to buy junk in Lima to take to Cusco

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua A. sells vegetables, canned tomatoes, salted fish and groundnut (peanut) paste at Abura. She has received junior high education. She is married and has four children.

Efua has been selling vegetables and other food items for eight months. She supports her husband in taking care of her children. Her loan will be used to buy additional vegetables including other varieties of vegetables to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es la Sr. Juan; él socio  tiene 60 años de edad y El socio es casado, El es natural de la provincia de Puno del distrito de Juliaca, El socio vino a vivir a la ciudad del Cusco, desde hace más de 20 años el es comerciante y entre ir y traer mercadería de Juliaca  Cusco quedó enamoradísimo de esta bella ciudad y se quedó  a vivir en Cusco, ahora El socio se dedica al comercio en el rubro de especias, él vende  (aceitunas de diversos tipos, y otras especias). El socio tiene su stand en el mercado de Ttio, y cada mañana muy temprano lo limpia y abre su negocio, es muy conocido y muy amable. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y abastecer su negocio de venta de especias.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This is a member of the communal bank “LAS PALMERAS”; he lives in the Huanchac district in the Cusco province and Cusco department. Mr. Juan is 60 years old and married. He is from the Puno province and Juliaca district. He lives in the city of Cusco, and has been a trader for more than 20 years. Between going to bring merchandise to Juliaca Cusco, he fell in love with this beautiful city and went to live in Cusco. He is a merchant in the business of spices (selling olives of various types and other spices). He has a stand in the Ttio market, and very early every morning he cleans and opens his business. He is well known and very friendly. He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise and to stock his business selling spices. He is infinitely grateful as the granted loan will allow him to grow his business and improve his quality of life. At the same time he is committed to paying his dues on time.

Translated from Spanish by Dina Bach, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise and to stock his business selling spices

loans.name: Djiguisseme 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Djiguisseme 3 sont  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, 2 enfants et vivant dans des familles polygames à Tiendo, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide,   le petit mil, le haricot et le sésame. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et les précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SITAN MALIM B., la présidente du groupe, compte acheter les intrants, les petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare de sésame et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Fana après les récoltes à une clientèle composée de revendeurs. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40000FCFA en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djiguisseme group 3 are married women who on average are 37 years old and have two children. Most live in polygamous families in Tiendo, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region, the second administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better organize their businesses for the beginning of the rainy season. Among others, the crops cultivated are peanuts, pearl millet, beans and sesame. This is their fifth planting loan; the previous loans have been fully repaid. With this new loan, MINATA T. plans to pay for planting supplies, small agricultural tools and labor costs to maintain approximatley 1 hectare of sesame and peanuts. The crops are sold in the towns of Dioïla and Fana after the harvest to a clientele composed of retailers. They expect to earn an average profit of 40,000 CFA at the end of the crop year.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for planting supplies, small agricultural tools and labor costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise: undergarments for boys and girls

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi K. is a palm oil extractor in Abura. She has no educational background. She is a widow and has three children.

Esi has been a palm oil extractor for about twenty years. Her loan will be used to buy extra palm fruits to process into oil for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her palm oil production.

loans.use: To buy extra palm fruits to process into palm oil

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lucia de 41 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas en disolución), ella tiene una papelería-ferretería (local donde venden no solo papelería, sino herramientas, artículos, para la mejora de una casa). 

Para que Lucia pueda mantener su casa tuvo que comprar papelería para vender a sus conocidos y vecinos del sector, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo surtir su negocio con artículos de ferretería, vende papelería, chapas de puerta, goma, pinturas etc. 

Para incrementar mas los artículos de venta de su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos. En el futuro quiere ampliar el local para poder exhibir mejor sus artículos.
texts.en:
Lucia is 41 years old and lives in “Fortín de Guayaquil” a suburban area with dirt roads and eroding hills). She has a paper goods-hardware store (where she sells not only paper goods, but also hardware, and home improvement items). In order to maintain her home, Lucia had to buy the paper goods store so that she could sell to her neighbors and acquaintances in the sector. Little by little, and with some effort, she was able to diversify her business with hardware. She sells paper goods, door knobs, glue, paint, etc. She wants to buy notebooks with the money from this loan, in order to increase her inventory. In future she would like to expand her shop so that she can display more items.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Djiguisseme  4 Group

texts.fr:
Djiguisseme 4 est regroupement de six femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 3 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Tiendo, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide,   le petit mil, le haricot et le sésame. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et les précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, SITAN MADOU F. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare de petit mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla et Fana après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25000FCFA en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
Djiguisseme 4 is a group of six married women with an average age of 36 and an average of three children. Mostly, they live in polygamous families in Tiendo, a village in the prefecture of Dioila, Koulikoro region (Mali's Second Administrative District). They work with Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of better organizing their activities as the rainy season begins. They grow peanuts, millet, beans and sesame, among other crops. This will be their fifth seasonal loan. Their previous loans have been fully repaid. With this new loan, Sitan Madou F. will buy fertilizer before the price increases, and she will also buy small tools and pay for hired labor to work about one hectare of millet and peanuts. The harvest will be sold in Dioila and Fana. The customers are both men and women. The group members hope for an average profit of CFA 25,000 at the end of the season.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and tools and pay for hired help

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Puchase of merchandise such as toys and childrens clothing

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS PALMERAS”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Pascuala; ella tiene 37 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, ella es natural del distrito de Canas, La socia trabaja como empleada del hogar en una casa, ella brinda sus servicios de limpieza y cuidado de la casa de una familia, ella trabaja de lunes a sábados atendiendo y cocinando para los miembros de esta familia a cambio de una remuneración que a ella le permite pagar los estudios de sus pequeños hijos, la socia es una mujer muy trabajadora y desde pequeña realizó este trabajo por lo que le permite seguir manteniendo. La socia solicita este préstamo para pagar los estudios de sus menores hijos y ella pagara las cuotas mensualmente con el sueldo de su trabajo.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus tres hijos, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank 'Las Palmeras'. She lives in the Huanchac district in Cusco province, Cusco department. This member, Senora Pascuala, is 37 years old. She lives with her partner, has 3 children and is native to the Canas district. Senora Pascuala works as a housemaid in a home, providing cleaning services and taking care of a family's house. She works from Monday to Saturday attending to and cooking for the members of the family in return for remuneration which permits her to pay for her small childrens' studies. Senora Pascuala is a very hard-working woman and has been doing this work since she was little, as it allows her to keep maintaining her family. She is seeking a loan to pay for her childrens' studies and will make the monthly repayments with the income from her job. Senora Pascuala values and is thankful for this loan as it allows her to improve her quality of life and that of her 3 children, and she promises to make the required repayments within the agreed payment terms.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for school fees

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua K. is a palm oil extractor in Abura. She has not received any form of education. She is married and has seven dependents. Her husband is a palm wine tapper.

Efua has been extracting palm oil for five years now and supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruits to process into oil for sale. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more palm fruits to process into palm oil

loans.name: Djigui 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe Djigui 1 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles polygames à Gnabourouthila, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont l’arachide et  le petit mil. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne et les précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, NAGNOUMA D. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare  d’arachide.
La production  est vendue au niveau de la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 45.000FCFA en fin de campagne.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Djigui 1 Group are married women who are, on average, 34 years old with 4 children. They live in polygamous households in Gnabourouthila, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture in Koulikoro, the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) with the goal of better organizing their businesses at the beginning of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate are peanuts and pearl millet. They are on their third rural loan, and all their previous loans were repaid properly. With this new loan, Nagnouma D. (one of the women in the group) intends to buy farming inputs before prices go up, to purchase small equipment, and to pay labour costs to maintain about 1 hectare of peanut crops. The products will be sold in the city of Dioïla after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. They intend to realize an average profit of 45,000 FCFA at the end of the term.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, purchase small equipment, and pay for manual labour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase beer in bulk

loans.name: 16 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. 16 de Agosto se ha organizado para solicitar un crédito, este es su primer ciclo, tiene como presidenta a la señora Valentina P. Y., la mencionada asociación comunal pertenece al Centro Focal de Panamericana.  La señora Valentina tiene como negocio el tejido de gorros de lana para señoras de pollera, muy utilizados en ésta época de invierno, pues las temperaturas bajan entre 2 a 5 grados centígrados, en la mañana y al anochecer, inclusive esta temperatura se percibe en los lugares que no reciben sol durante el dia.
Doña Valentina vive con su pareja, tiene tres niños pequeños por los que se esfuerza en su negocio.
Las  integrantes de la asociación comunal tienen negocios de elaboración de chompas de lana, venta de mantas y calzados, venta de haba tostada, alfombras, venta de dulces, venta de comida y venta de condimentos.
texts.en:
This communal bank 16 de Agosto has been formed to seek a loan. This is the group's first loan cycle. Their president is Valentina P. Y.. The communal group belongs to the Centro Focal de Panamericana. Señora Valentina knits woollen hats for the women in the highlands (Andes), greatly used at the moment in wintertime as the temperatures drop to between 2 - 5 degrees centigrade in the morning and at sunset (including some areas that don't receive sun during the day). Doña Valentina lives with her partner and has 3 small children - for this reason she works hard in her business. The members of this communal bank have businesses such as making woollen jumpers, selling ponchos and footwear, selling toasted broadbeans, rugs, sweets, food and condiments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Alba Lely

texts.es:
Alba Lely tiene 45 años, reside en el municipio de Jucuapa, departamento de Usulután, está acompañada, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 22,18 y 15 años, depende económicamente de Alba, ella se dedica a vender  verduras y frutas.
La señora inicio el negocio hace 20 años y lo maneja sola, trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene un puesto en el mercado municipal de Jucuapa, ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos como son frutas y verduras, (tomates, zanahorias, brocoli, repollo, naranjas, manzanas, uvas, bananas) así mismo invertir en materia prima para hacer pupusas. Esto contribuirá en para mejorar el negocio, generar ingresos y nuevos productos para ofrecer a los clientes, apoyar a la continuidad del negocio de Alba.
Los objetivos son incrementar el negocio, apoyar a los hijos en la culminación de los estudios, ampliar y mejora la vivienda, contribuir para mejora la calidad de vida de la familia.
texts.en:
Alba is 45 years old and resides in the municipality of Jucuapa, Usulután Department. She lives with a partner and has 3 children aged 22, 18, and 15, who are economically dependent on her. Alba sells vegetables and fruit. She began the business 20 years ago and runs it by herself, working from Monday through Sunday. She has a post in the municipal market of Jucuapa. Alba is soliciting a loan to buy products such as fruits and vegetables (tomatoes, carrots, broccoli, onions, oranges, apples, grapes, and bananas). She also will invest in basic ingredients to make pupusas, a popular local dish. This will help to improve the business, generating income and new products to offer customers, and aid in sustaining Alba's business. Her goal is to expand the business, help her children complete their studies, and expand and improve their home, bettering the family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING FRUITS AND VEGETABLES TO SELL IN HER PUBLIC MARKET POST

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Elena M.  Q., tiene 42 años y vive en el Barrio Laureles Norte, acompañada por su pareja de vida el cual labora como albañil, tienen 3 hijos menores de edad que estudian la escuela secundaria, tienen un negocio de venta de comida típica del país, y fue con su esfuerzo propio, que logró  instalar este negocio que ha sido el sustento de vida para toda su familia estos últimos 8 años.

Inicialmente vendía enchiladas, pero gracias a la buena demanda su oferta ha crecido y ahora ofrece variedad de platillos que tienen buenas aceptación entre sus clientes, a futuro espera tener los recursos económicos para la compra de mesas y sillas, y remodelar la infraestructura de su comidería a un local más amplio, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de productos que permitan aumentar los índices en las ventas y que traigan mejores ingresos económicos, que favorezcan a la economía del hogar en la incursión de nuevas fuentes de ingresos o proyectos para el negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosa Elena M. Q. is 42 years and lives in the neighborhood of Laurles Norte, accompanied by her life partner who works as a mason. They have three dependent children who are high school students. Rosa has a business selling traditional Nicaraguan food and through her own efforts, she has been able to provide for her family for the past eight years.

At first she sold enchiladas, but thanks to high demand her menu has expanded and now she offers a variety of dishes that have been well-received by her customers. In the future she hopes to have the financial resources to buy tables and chairs and remodel the infrastructure of her eatery in order to make it larger. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy a large inventory of products that will allow her to increase her sales and generate better earnings. She is always in favor of improving her household finances through new sources of income and business projects.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for her business

loans.name: Djigui 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les six membres du groupe Djigui 2 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de34 ans, 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles polygames à Gnabourouthila, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide et  le petit mil. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne et les précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, NANA F. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,5 hectare  de céréales et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35 000FCFA en fin de  campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djigui 2 Group are married women who are, on average, 34 years old with 4 children. They live for the most part in polygamous households in Gnabourouthila, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture in Koulikoro, the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) with the goal of better organizing their businesses at the start of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate include, among others, peanuts and pearl millet. They are on their third rural loan, and the previous loans were repaid properly. With this new loan Nana F. (one of the women in the group) intends to buy farming inputs before the prices go up, to purchase small equipment, and to pay for labour costs to maintain about 1.5 hectares of cereal and peanut crops. The products are sold in the city of Dioïla after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. They intend to realize an average profit of 35,000 FCFA at the end of the term.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy faming inputs, purchase small equipment, and pay for manual labour

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa N. makes palm oil from palm fruits for sale in Abura. She has no educational background. She is married and has eight dependents. Her husband is a farmer.

Adwoa has been selling palm oil for six years and, with the help of her husband, she is able to maintain the home. Her loan will be used to buy more palm fruits to process into palm oil. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to complete a kitchen she has started.

loans.use: To buy more palm fruits to process into palm oil

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina pertenece al Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa Alégrate en quechua, es socia hace 15 años y durante este tiempo la ayuda D. Finca fue fundamental para su negocio, aprendió a ahorrar y con sus ahorros pudo educar a sus hijos.
Delfina tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, pollo, actividad que realiza todos los días, además junto a su esposo tienen una joyería, productos que venD. en las ferias D. la región. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar y aceite.
Delfina es casada y tiene 3 hijos D. los cuales solo 1 estudia y espera que sea un buen profesional.
Delfina sueña con tener una tienda mayorista.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Communal Bank “Kusikuy”, which means “Rejoice” in Quechua. She has been a member of FINCA for 15 years and the support she received has been crucial to her business. Delfina learned how to save so that her children could have an education.

She has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, fruits, and chicken. Her business is open every day. In addition, she and her husband have a jewelry shop and sell their products at the regional fairs. Her loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, and oil. Delfina is married and has three children, one of whom is a student with hopes of becoming a successful professional.

Delfina dreams of having a wholesale store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, además brinda el servicio de venta de comida a algunos pensionistas que tiene en el mismo local, actividades que realiza todos los días ella sola. Además Elsa alquila habitaciones en su casa. En el ultimo mes le realizaron una intervención quirúrgica lo cual impide un normal trabajo en sus negocios.
Elsa es casada y tiene 3 hijos que estudian, Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa Alégrate en quechua y lo mas le agrada son las capacitaciones acerca del valor de la mujer que son iguales a los varones y también el incentivo al ahorro.
Elsa solicita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Alicia son tener una ferretería y educar a sus hijos porque ocupan los primeros lugares en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Elsa has a store in her house where she sells groceries. In addition, she offers a service selling prepared foods to a few pensioners for whom she has provided lodging in her home. She manages both businesses every day by herself. Elsa also rents out rooms in her house. Last month she had to undergo surgery which kept her from the normal duties related to running her businesses.

Elsa is married and has three children who are in school. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Kusikuy”, which means “Rejoice” in Quechua. What she enjoys most are the training classes that value women on the same level as men as well as having the incentive to save.

Elsa is requesting a loan of 900 PEN to be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. She dreams of opening a hardware store and providing an education for her children because their studies are her main concern.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice and sugar

loans.name: Nueva Organizacion Group

texts.es:
Don Corazón de Jesús Sánchez García, vive en la ribera san Vicente, municipio de Copainalá estado de Chiapas, México. Tiene 42 años es soltero, se dedica al campo y a la tienda de abarrotes ya que con eso se sostiene en sus ingresos. Realiza esta actividad hace dos años desde que inicio con el préstamo y comenta que le ha ido muy bien desde entonces.
La razón que lo motivo a realizar esta actividad, es que el siempre había deseado tener un negocio y cuando solicito este préstamo en Fundación Realidad A. C. El cual lo dispuso para eso y hoy está muy contento y satisfecho con el programa.
A él le gustaría invertir sus ganancias comprando mas producto y construir un local donde vender sus verduras, y llegar a su menta hasta que dios lo permita.
Corazón de Jesús paso a formar parte del grupo por sus vecinas la cual lo invitaron a que se integrara con ellas y le dieron por nombre: “Nueva Organización” porque son de nuevo ingreso.
Los integrantes que conforman el grupo son:
  *Vivian Ibis S. G., representante del grupo se dedica a la venta de ropas.
  *Cirila Sánchez Muriaz: comercio de productos agrícolas.
  *María del Carmen R. López: en el negocio de panadería.
  *Zarita Muriaz López: vende productos agrícolas.
  *Carmelinda Gómez Hernández: también en la panadería
  *Corazón de Jesús Sánchez García el cual se le tomo la entrevista.
texts.en:
Don Corazón de Jesús Sánchez García lives in the riverside community of San Vicente in the town of Copainalá, State of Chiapas, México. He is 42 years old, single, and dedicates himself to farming and managing a grocery store in order to earn money to support himself. Corazón de Jesús started his business two years ago with the help of a loan and says that he has done well since then.

The reason why he started working is because he always wanted to have his own business, so he requested a loan from Fundación Realidad, A.C. The loan was disbursed and today he is happy and satisfied with the program.

He would like to invest his earnings into buying more products and building a shop where he can sell vegetables and continue working as long as God permits. Corazón de Jesús joined a group of neighbors who invited him to participate. They were given the name “Nueva Organización” (New Organization) because they are a new group.

The members of the group are as follows: • Vivian Ibis S. G. is the group representative and sells clothing. • Cirila Sánchez Muriaz sells farm products. • María del Carmen R. López manages a bakery. • Zarita Muriaz López sells farm products. • Carmelinda Gómez Hernández also manages a bakery. • Corazón de Jesús Sánchez García was the member who was interviewed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, beans, soap, sardines, tuna, and other products

loans.name: Djekabaara 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe Djekabaara 1 sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 53 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Sontiguila, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres l’arachide, le petit mil et le haricot. Elles sont à leur premier prêt de campagne.
Avec ce prêt, ADAMA F. compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1 hectare  de petit mil et du haricot.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village de Nangola et environnants et dans la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30.000F CFA par campagne.
Les femmes de l’association Djekabaara I se disent satisfaites de la collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso et portent toute leur confiance pour le bon déroulement de la campagne hivernale.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djekabaara 1 Group are married women who are, on average, 53 years old with 5 children. They live for the most part in polygamous households in Sontiguila, one of the villages in the Dioïla prefecture in Koulikoro, the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners) with the goal of better organizing their businesses at the start of the rainy season. The crops they cultivate include, among others, peanuts, pearl millet, and beans. They are on their first farming loan. With this new loan, Adama F. (one of the women in the group) intends to buy farming inputs before prices go up, to purchase small equipment, and to pay for labour costs to maintain about 1 hectare of pearl millet and beans. The products are sold in the town of Nangola, its surrounding areas, and in the city of Dioïla after the harvest to a clientele composed of men and women. They intend to realize an average profit of 30,000 FCFA per campaign. The women of the Djekabaara 1 Group are satisfied with their collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso and are fully confident that their farming during the rainy season will progress well.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, purchase small equipment, and pay for manual labour costs

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila pertenece al  Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa Alégrate en quechua hace 13 años y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones y aprendió a valorarse como persona.
Luzmila es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Luzmila compra cereales de los proveedores que le traen al molino de su hermano, Luzmila procesa los cereales en molino alquilado, sus productos los vende en los mercados, en oportunidades bajo pedido. Además Luzmila tiene un carro que alquila para realizar taxi en la ciudad, unidad que adquirió con ahorros y préstamo.
Luzmila necesita un préstamo de 1350 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo, cebada.
Sus sueños son que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luzmila is part of the Communal Bank “Kusikuy”, which means “Rejoice” in Quechua. She has been a member for 13 years and what she enjoys most are the training classes in which she has learned how to value herself as a person.

Luzmila is in a common law marriage and has two children in school. She buys grain from the suppliers and brings it to her brother’s mill for processing. Luzmila rents the mill from her brother and then sells her products at the markets where, on occasion, she will accept orders. She also has a car that she acquired using her savings and the help of a loan. The vehicle is rented out as a city taxi.

Luzmila needs a loan of 1350 PEN to be invested in the purchase of wheat and barley. Her dreams include seeing her children become professionals and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat & barley

loans.name: Leocrecia

texts.es:
Leocrecia es casada y tiene 9 hijos, pero ahora vive solo con su esposo, Leocrecia tiene una Bodega en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, bebidas, helados, gas, leña, actividad que realiza todos los días desD. las 5 D. la mañana hasta las 9 D. la noche, y los días domingos hace comida típica en su casa actividades que realiza sola. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. gas y leña.
Los sueños D. Leocrecia son comprar un carro para pasear e implementar un restaurante.
texts.en:
Leocrecia is married and has nine children, but now she and her husband live alone. She has a store in her home where she sells groceries, beverages, ice cream, gas, and firewood. Her business is open every day from 5am until 9pm. On Sundays, she prepares traditional food at home and performs other activities by herself. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of gas and firewood.

She dreams of buying a car for travel and opening a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gas & firewood

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia tiene 42 años, es viuda y vive con sus 2 hijos en casa de sus padres. Hace más de 10 años se dedica en la venta de comida, en donde lo realiza desde su domicilio, o también de manera ambulante, pero cuando hay festividades se establece con una pequeña carpa para disponerse a vender. En ocasiones la ayudan sus hijos en la preparación, pero generalmente realiza sola este negocio. Durante este tiempo ha demostrado tener buenas ganancias que la satisfacen y la motivan a continuar con esta actividad. Una de sus metas es tener un restaurante campestre para tener mayor margen de ganancia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de ingredientes no perecibles así como condimentos, arroz  entre otros, de esa manera pueda abastecer de ingredientes y preparar sin dificultad su comida.
texts.en:
Sonia is a 42 year old widow and lives in the house of her parents with her two children. For more than ten years, she has sold food from home and also as a street merchant. Whenever there are festivals, she sets up a small tent so that she can prepare to sell food. Sometimes her children help with the preparation, but she generally works in her business alone. Throughout this time she has demonstrated that she can generate good earnings to satisfy her needs, which has motivated her to continue her business. One of her goals is to open a country restaurant so that she can earn more income.

This is her first loan with MFP. Sonia is happy to know that she has financial backing and is glad to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. She thanks those individuals who will approve her loan request since the funds will be very useful in advancing her business. The loan she requested will be invested in the purchase of non-perishable ingredients such as condiments, rice, and other products so that she can be well-stocked and prepare her food easily.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase non-perishable ingredients

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina es soltera y tiene 3 hijos que estudian, Martina viaja a las ferias de la región en donde compra cereales que luego transporta a la ciudad de Ayacucho para comercializarlos en los mercados y una empresa de lácteos, en algunas oportunidades procesa los cereales. Martina tiene un carro en la ruta 13 que realiza transporte urbano en la ciudad. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de quinua.
Martina es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa Alégrate en quechua.
Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una empresa.
texts.en:
Martina is single and has three children in school. She travels to the fairs in the region where she buys grain and then transports it to the city of Ayacucho to sell at the markets and to a dairy company. On a few occasions, she will process the grain herself. Martina also has a car that is used for providing transportation along Route 13 of the city. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of quinoa.

Martina is a member of the Communal Bank “Kusikuy”, which means “Rejoice” in Quechua. Her dream is to see her children become professionals and to open a business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase quinoa

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Zenobia pertenece al Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa Alégrate en quechua y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro.
Zenobia es casada tiene 7 hijos el mayor es de 25 años y el menor de 7 meses, de los cuales 5 estudian. Zenobia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales que luego comercializa en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Zenobia se dedica a la crianza de cerdos en su casa actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hijo y lo vende a clientes establecidos. Solicita un crédito de 1800 soles dinero que sera invertido en la compra de cerdos pequeños.
Zenobia sueña con construir su casa con material noble pues la que tiene es de material rustico y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Zenobia is a member of the Communal Bank “Kusikuy”, which means “Rejoice” in Quechua. What she enjoys most is having the incentive to save.

Zenobia is married and has seven children, five of whom are in school. The oldest child is 25 years old while the youngest is 7 months. Zenobia travels to different fairs in the region where she buys grain to later sell at the markets in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Zenobia raises pigs at home with the help of her son and then sells them to her established customers. She is requesting a loan of 1800 PEN to invest in the purchase of piglets.

Zenobia dreams of building a house out of solid materials since her current home is made of basic materials. She also wants to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire piglets

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es: La señora Ángela V., tiene la edad de 51 años es casada y su esposo labora como supervisor en un fabrica de sacos, apoyándole en los gastos que se incurren en el hogar, ellos tienen 2 hijos, tienen una pulpería que les ha brindado una fuente de ingresos importante para la familia desde hace 4 años, fue gracias a su esposo que con su esfuerzo y préstamos a microfinanacieras que logro la inauguración de su negocio, es para su abarrotería que solicita un préstamo para la compra de un freezer  y de esta manera incursionar en la venta de congelados tales como carnes, pollos y lácteos, productos que se consumen en masa, y traerán mejores ventas y por lo tanto ingresos que favorezcan a proyectos familiares para su propio progreso.
texts.en:
Sra. Ángela V. is 51 years old and married. Her husband works as a supervisor at a bag factory and helps with the expenses incurred in the home. They have two children. Ángela has a store that she has managed for four years and provides an important source of income for her family. Thanks to her husband’s efforts and the help of microfinance loans, she was able to open her business. She is requesting a loan to buy a freezer for her grocery store so that she can sells frozen foods such as meats, chicken, and dairy products that are consumed in large quantities. This will help her generate more sales and earn more income for her family to make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a freezer

loans.name: Virgen De Juquila Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama “Virgen de Juquila”, está ubicado en la comunidad barrio San Miguel, Cohuecan, estado de Puebla, México. El grupo está conformado por 5 integrantes que se conocen. Este es el préstamo no. 12 con Fundación Realidad.
La integrante del grupo Manuela S. S. tiene 40 años, estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria, tiene 3 hijos, 2 hombres y 1 mujer, José David de 11 años, Juan Diego de 9 años y María Esther de 7 años, ella se dedica a la alfarería,  su préstamo lo va a utilizar para comprar barro y leña para tener almacenado ya que en temporada de lluvia se escasea la mercancía. Ella trabaja sobre pedido, sus cliente son de Tlayacapan, las piezas que realiza en barro son pedestales para poner las flores, jarrones para lámparas, juego de botellones grandes, inicio su negocio hace 14 años, comentando que ya viene de familia su papa le enseño a trabajar el barro, es motivo de orgullo la alfarería ya que hay ocasiones que se hace una promesa religiosa de decorar la iglesia con pedestales para las flores o candeleros para las ceras el día 24 de agosto que se celebra a san Bartolo. A tenido desafíos como cuando el barro llega a fallar no resiste el fuego y se rompen las piezas, Manuela nos dice: “es importante para mí el negocio porque con las ganancia voy sacando para los gastos de la casa, la educación de los niños y seguir comprando mercancía para seguir trabajando”.
Los integrantes de grupo son la señora Petra Constantina V. M., Luisa S. González, Maura A. V. y Manuela S. van a comprar barro para la alfarería. Diana Martínez López va a comprar llantas para su taxi.
texts.en:
The communal bank called “Virgen de Juquila” is located in the San Miguel neighborhood of Cohuecan, in the state of Puebla, Mexico. This group is made up of 5 members who know each other. This is their 12th loan with the Fundación Realidad. Manuela S. S. is a member of the group. She is 40 years old and completed her education through the 3rd year of secondary school. She has 3 children: 2 boys and a girl. Jose David is 11, Juan Diego is 9, and Maria Esther is 7 years old. She sells pottery. She will use this loan to stock up on clay and firewood, since these items become scarce during the rainy season. She works by advance orders, and her customers are from Tlayacapan. The pieces she makes from clay are pedestals to put flowers on, lamp bases, and large sets of bottles. She started her business 14 years ago. She comments that it runs in her family; her father taught her to work with clay. She is proud of her pottery business, since at times she makes a religious commitment to decorate the church with pedestals for flowers or candelabras for the wax candles on August 24th, when they celebrate Saint Bartolo. She has had setbacks, such as when the clay fails to resist the fire and the pieces break. Manuela tells us "my business is important for me, because with the earnings I am able to cover the household expenses, the educational expenses for my children, and I can continue to buy merchandise in order to keep working." The members of the group are: Petra Constantina V. M., Luisa S. González, Maura A. V. and Manuela S.. They will buy clay for the pottery business, and Diana Martínez López will buy tires for her taxi.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy clay and firewood to make pedestals, lamp bases, and sets of large bottles

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate Y. prepares kenkey for sale in Abura (kenkey is fermented corn and cassava dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves and often accompanied by fried fish). Kate has received junior high education. She is married and lives together with her seven dependents. Her husband is a farmer.

Kate has been preparing kenkey for sale for thirty-eight years. The loan she hopes to receive will be used to buy extra maize to cook the kenkey she sells. She hopes to use the new revenues from her business to save to build a place where she can store bags of maize to keep to sell in smaller quantities.

loans.use: To buy extra maize to cook more kenkey to sell

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: cette jeune femme est une célibataire avec 2 enfants, elle vit avec ses enfants dans le quartier de Zorrobar à lomé. pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants elle s'est lancée dans le commerce de pagnes,elle fait ce commerce depuis 2006. plus tard elle a associé à son commerce le commerce de produits cosmétiques. pour toucher une plus grande clientèle elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante. le crédit qu'elle demande lui servira à gonfler son stock avec une douzaine de pagnes de différentes qualités.
texts.en:
This young lady is single and lives with her two children in the Zorrobar quarter of Lomé. Since 2006 she has sold pagnes (wax cloths) for a living in order to meet her family's needs. She recently added cosmetics to her product offer. In order to reach a large customer base she walks from village to village to sell her wares. She is seeking a loan in order to increase her stock levels by purchasing a dozen wax cloths of varying quality.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing 'pagnes' (wax cloths)

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es: Augusto, de 65 años, vive en su casa que es propia, junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos.Durante  todos los días, brinda el servicio de taxi, y trabaja 12 horas diarias. Ya lleva 15 años, en el volante; y en todo este tiempo ha logrado adquirir  experiencias que comparte con sus amigos. Luego de un tiempo de trabajar por su cuenta decidió integrarse a una flota de taxis de la ciudad; ya que es de uso más frecuente;  por la seguridad que brindan. Conoce todas las rutas del  sur y norte de  la ciudad, y utiliza las mejores rutas  en horas de tráfico, para brindar  un servicio oportuno a sus pasajeros. Le gusta su trabajo porque es tranquilo, y  dispone de sus horarios, solo que a veces corre el riesgo de asaltos y robos, pero la experiencia le ha permitido conocer a los ocasionales pasajeros que moviliza.
