Para mas adelante tiene planeado seguir trabajando como hasta hoy y así espera terminar de pagar  las letras de su auto.Es el  doceavo préstamo que tiene con MFP,  y será responsable como en las anteriores ocasiones, también esta muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible  el dinero solicitado que le permitirá continuar progresando.Augusto tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de 4  llantas para su movilidad, para mejorar el servicio, y continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Augusto, age 65, lives in his own house with his wife and their two children. He provides taxi service everyday, and he works 12 hours a day. He has spent 15 years being at the wheel. In all of that time he has gotten experiences that he shares with his friends. After a time of working for himself he decided to join a fleet of taxis in the city. He did this because they are used more frequently and because they offer better security. He knows all of the routes to the south and north of the city. He uses the best routes during traffic hours so that he can provide his passengers with appropriate service. He likes his work because it is peaceful and he arranges his schedules. Sometimes he runs the risk of assaults or robbery, but the experience has allowed him to meet the random passengers that he transports. In the future he plans to keep working as he has done. This way he expects to be able to finish the payments on his car. This is his twelfth loan with MFP. He will be responsible like he was on the previous occasions. Also, he is very grateful for all of the people who made the requested money possible. It will allow him to continue progressing. Augusto plans to use the requested money to buy four tires for his vehicle in order to improve service and continue progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new tires for his automobile

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase items such as clams and fish

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama M. prepares banku (a local dish made from corn dough) and serves it with okro (okra) and groundnut (peanut) soup for sale in Abura.

Ama has been through junior high school and is married with four children. Her husband is a driver. She supports her husband in providing the needs of the family.

Ama’s loan will be used to buy extra maize to cook more banku to sell. She hopes to reinvest in her business with the new profits she will be making.

loans.use: To buy extra maize to cook more banku to sell

loans.name: Maame Yaa

texts.en:
Maame Yaa A. is single and has received senior high education. She bakes meat pies and rock cakes to sell in Abura.

Maame Yaa has been in this business for four years and takes care of herself with the little profits she makes from her business. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients to bake goods to distribute to her customers and to new ones who want to order from her.

Maame Yaa hopes to reinvest into her business should there be any increase in profit.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to bake

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María tiene 60 años de edad, está acompañada, tiene cuatro hijos, se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales.
La señora trabaja en la agricultura y contrata personas para que le ayude a sembrar, los horarios son indefinido, de acuerdo a la necesidad de trabajo, ella cultiva maíz y frijoles, actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de insumos: abono y fertilizante para el cultivo de maíz y frijoles, este dinero contribuirá de mucha ayuda para producir una cosecha que se pueda vender, obtener ingresos, para cubrir gastos económicos.
Ana  tiene como objetivo que lo ingresos obtenidos por la venta de la cosecha, solventar los compromisos económicos, apoyar a los hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Ana María is 60 years old. She has a partner and 4 children. Ana María works in agriculture and breeds animals. She contracts people to help her to sow the crops. The work hours are not defined, and are agreed according to the work that is required. She cultivates maize and beans and is seeking a loan to purchase items such as fertiliser to cultivate the maize and beans. This money will contribute greatly to produce a crop that she can sell and obtain earnings to cover her economic costs. Ana María has the objective of using the earnings from the harvest to cover her economic obligations and help her children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertiliser

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase plantains to make fried plantains

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: cette femme est une femme célibataire, elle est mère de deux enfants. le commerce qu'elle exerce pour subvenir aux charges de sa famille est le commerce de boissons alcoolisées appelées "sodabi". elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de charbons de bois. elle  fait face à une rupture de stock et voudrait s'approvisionner. elle sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de boissons locales appelées "sodabi" et de quelques sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
Massan A. is an unmarried woman and the mother of two children. She runs a business selling an alcoholic beverage called “sodabi" to provide for the needs of her family. She also has a business selling charcoal. Her supplies are about to run out and she would like to stock up. Consequently, she is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase the beverage known locally as “sodabi” and several bags of charcoal.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa N. is married and has four children. Her husband is a palm wine tapper. She has received no formal education.

Adwoa sells smoked fish in Abura and has been smoking fish for sale for five years now. She uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Adwoa will use the loan to purchase additional fish to smoke for resale. With the new profits she hopes to get, she plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to smoke and sell

loans.name: Arcoiris Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SOLIDARIO SE LLAMA ARCOIRIS, ESTA UBICADO EN JANTETELCO, EN EL ESTADO DE MORELOS, MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 5 INTEGRANTES QUE SE CONOCEN. ESTE ES SU 2º. PRESTAMO CON FUNDACION REALIDAD.
LA INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO LA SEÑORA NORALIT M. H. TIENE 29 AÑOS, ESTUDIO HASTA EL 6º. GRADO DE PRIMARIA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS,  ODALYS TIENE 2 AÑOS, MERARI TIENE 4 AÑOS Y LUIS GADIEL TIENE 7 AÑOS, EL MAS GRANDE ESTUDIA LA PRIMARIA EL OTRO NIÑO APENAS VA A INGRESAR AL KINDER. ELLA SE DEDICA A VENDER TOPERWARE Y JAFRA POR CATALOGO Y VA A UTILIZAR SU PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIRLO EN EL PEDIDO DE TOPERWARE, PERFUMES Y COSMETICOS DE JAFRA PARA TENER MERCANCIA PARA IR A VENDER A LAS COMUNIDADES DE AMAYUCA, JANTETELCO, SAN JUAN AMECAC, SU ESPOSO LE AYUDA EN EL NEGOCIO EN LA TARDE CUANDO SALE A VENDER EL CUIDA A LOS NIÑOS, TAMBIEN  HAY VECES QUE EL LA ACOMPAÑA CON LA CAMIONETA A LAS DIFERENTES COMUNIDADES, LE GUSTA ESTE NEGOCIO POR QUE PUEDE ATENDER A SU HIJOS Y TRABAJAR EN LAS VENTAS DE TOPPERWARE Y JAFRA. GRACIAS A ESTE NEGOCIO HA LOGRADO TENER DINERO EXTRA PARA ALGUN IMPREVISTO, HAY VECES QUE NO TRABAJA SU ESPOSO Y TIENE DINERO AHORRADO DEL NEGOCIO PARA LOS GASTOS DE SU CASA. HAY MESES QUE BAJA LA VENTA Y SE TIENE QUE ESFORZAR MAS PARA LOGRAR LA META QUE SE HA PROPUESTO POR EJEMPLO CUANDO EMPIEZAN LAS CLASES BAJA LAS VENTAS. LAS GANANCIAS QUE OBTINE LAS VA AHORRANDO  EN CASO DE ALGUN IMPREVISTO POR EJEMPLO SI SE ENFERMA SU HIJO TIENE PARA EL DOCTOR Y LA MEDICINA. ELLA TIENE PLANEADO CRECER ABARCAR MAS LUGARES DE VENTA TENER UNA UNIDAD SER PATROCINADORA Y FORMAR VARIOS GRUPOS DE PERSONAS PARA ENSEÑARLES COMO SE TRABAJA.
LA REPRESENTANTE DE GRUPO LA SEÑORA GREGORIA A. C. VA A COMPRAR CON SU PRESTAMO JABON, HUEVO, LECHE, AZUCAR, ETC. PARA SURTIR SU TIENDA DE ABARROTES, LAS INTEGRANTES NORALIT M. H. VA A COMPRA TOPPERWARE Y COSMETICOS DE JAFRA PARA VENDER, LA SEÑORA JANET V. A. VA A COMPRAR PATAS DE POLLO PARA VENDER HERVIDAS, TAMBIEN VA A COMPRAR ELOTES, LA SEÑORA BARBAR D. TENORIA VA A COMPRAR JABON, FABULOSA, CARCHER PARA LAVAR LOS CARROS ETC., LA SEÑORA MARTHA B. G. VA A COMPRAR ROPA INTERIOR POR MAYOREO PARA VENDER .  
LA SEÑORA NORALIT QUIERE DECIRLE A KIVA Y A FUNDACION REALIDAD “GRACIAS Y OJALA NOS SIGAN APOYANDO CON LOS PRESTAMOS POR QUE HAY VECES QUE NO HAY Y SE NECISITA DEL APOYO, POR QUE HAY VECES QUE LA FAMILIA TAMPOCO TIENEN PARA AYUDARNOS”
texts.en:
The Arcoiris ("Rainbow") Solidarity Group is located in Jantetelco in the state of Morelos, Mexico. The group is made up of five women who know each other. This is their second loan with Fundacion Realidad ("Reality Foundation"). One member of the group is Noralit M. H.. She is 29 years old. She went to school through the sixth grade. She has three children; Odalys is two years old, Meraris is 4, and Luis Gadiel is 7. The oldest, Luis, is in school. The second son is about to begin kindergarten. Noralit sells Tupperware and Jafra brand beauty products by mail order. She is going to use the loan to order Tupperware, perfume, and cosmetics so she can have merchandise to sell in the communities of Amayuca, Jantetelco, and San Juan Amecac. Her husband helps her with the business by watching their children in the afternoon when she goes out to sell her merchandise. Sometimes her husband joins her on the bus when she travels to different communities. Noralit likes her job because she can work and take care of her children. Thanks to her business, Noralit has extra money to cover unexpected costs. There are times when her husband is out of work, and the money saved from her business can cover household costs. There are months when business is slow and sales are low and Noralit has to work harder to reach the sales goal she set. An example of this is at the beginning of the school year when sales are low. Noralit saves her money as she makes it so she has enough to cover unforeseen costs like when a child gets sick and needs to see the doctor and get medicine. Noralit will use the loan to buy Tupperware and Jafra cosmetics to sell. Noralit is planning to grow her business, cover a larger sales area, be a sponsor, and form various groups of people and teach them how to work. Another member of the group, Gregoria A. C., will use the loan to buy soap, eggs, milk, and sugar to stock her grocery store. Janet V. A. will buy chicken legs, which she will boil and sell, and corncobs. Barbara D. Tenoria will buy soap, cleaners, and pressure washers to wash cars and the like. Martha B. G. will buy underwear wholesale to sell. Noralit wants to tell Kiva and the Reality Foundation the following: "Thank you, and we hope you will continue supporting us with loans. Sometimes there are no loans available and we need the help, because there are times our families cannot help us either."

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying Tupperware, perfume, and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a variety of clothing and underwear

loans.name: Luz Del Sol Group

texts.es:
El grupo Luz del Sol está conformado por cuatro personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras provenientes de Managua. La coordinadora del grupo es la joven Heylin Elieth E. C. estudiante de derecho quien para continuar sus estudios inicio en 2008 con unos pequeños ahorros a comercializar prendas de oro y plata, negocio que  poco a poco ha desarrollado. Ella en la actualidad invertirá en ropa, ya que tiene muchos encargos. 

Las integrantes del grupo son Meyling Auxiliadora Solís F. comerciante de ropa usada y nueva desde hace tres años, Melania O. se dedica al comercio de calzado y cosméticos, y Brenda Tobal vende desde ropa, cosméticos y calzado.
texts.en:
The group Luz del Sol ("Sun's Light") is made up of four industrious, hard-working, entrepreneurial women from Managua. The group's coordinator is Heylin Elieth E. C., a law student who began financing her studies in 2008 selling gold and silver jewelry. Bit by bit, she has developed her business to include clothing. With this loan she will invest in merchandise, as she already has multiple orders for clothes. The members of this group are Meyling Auxiliadora S. F., who has been selling new and used clothes for three years; Melania O., who sells footwear and cosmetics; and Brenda Tobal, who sells clothes, cosmetics, and footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing merchandise

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 62 años, vive con su esposo y un hijo en su casa propia. Hace más D. 14 años se dedica en la  fabricación D. galletas, cuya experiencia su esposo lo acogió cuando trabajaba en una panadería. Ahora este negocio familiar, donD. ella y su esposo trabajan activamente en la preparación y venta D. galletas a sus más exigentes clientes que son comerciantes. Generalmente cuenta con la ayuda D. 2 personas que ha contratado, quienes se encargan D. preparar la masa. Lo que mas le agrada D. su trabajo es que  las ganancias son rentables a pesar  D. que el trabajo suele ser D. mucho esfuerzo y esta es la razón por la que se proyecta hacia el futuro tener maquinas mas sofisticadas para ser más eficiente y rápido la preparación. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero y  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. una maquina amasadora D. segunda mano.
texts.en:
Luz is 62 years old. She lives with her husband and her son in their own home. For over fourteen years, she has worked making cookies with her husband, who gained experience when he worked in a bakery. Now both husband and wife work actively in the family business, preparing and selling cookies for their most demanding clients--merchants and shopkeepers. Normally the couple employs two workers who are responsible for preparing the dough. What they enjoy most about their business is that it is profitable in spite of the hard work involved. Because the baking requires a lot of effort, they are planning to buy sophisticated machines in the future, which will make the preparation faster and more efficient. This is the Luz's first loan with MFP. Luz is very happy knowing that she has financial support for her business. She enjoys being part of a community microfinance group, because all its members are very responsible and supportive. She appreciates her group members supporting her with the loan, as the money will be very useful in the development of her business. With the loan she is requesting, Luz will invest in the purchase of a second-hand kneading machine.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of kneading machine

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa B. prepares kenkey in Abura and has been selling kenkey for two years.

To prepare her kenkey, Yaa buys maize from the market and soaks it in enough water to soften the maize. She washes it on the third day and sends it to the mill to be milled. She then makes a mixture of dough from the milled wet corn and leaves it to prove (ferment and rise).

On the next day she divides the proved dough into two, uses one part for her firm half-cooked dough (she mixes it with water to get it in a porridge form and cooks it for some time to get a firm mixture or texture) and mixes the rest of the uncooked dough with the half-cooked dough. She moulds it into balls and wraps the balls in corn husk. She then cooks them again until they become soft enough to eat.

Kenkey can be eaten with various kinds of sauces such as pepper sauce with fried or roasted fish, roasted chicken, roasted turkey and any other kind of meat or fish.
 
Yaa has been through junior high school and is divorced with three children. She is responsible for the wellbeing of her family. Her loan will enable her buy bags of maize to prepare more kenkey to sell. She anticipates using the new profits from her business to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize to prepare more kenkey to sell

loans.name: Damba

texts.fr: T. damba est une femme très dynamique qui exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes et de bazins, elle  a 3 ans d'expérience dans ce commerce, sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. voulant gonfler son stock pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire elle sollicite son premier crédit pour l'achat de d'une vingtaine de pagnes et d'une dizaine de bazins. elle fait son commerce de façon ambulante. elle est célibataire avec une personne à sa charge.
texts.en:
T. Damba is a very energetic woman whose line of business is selling “pagnes” [traditional colorful fabric] and “basins” [damask-type fabric]. She has three years of experience and her customer base is diverse. Wishing to expand her stock and increase her income, she is seeking her first loan in order to purchase about twenty sets of “pagnes” and a dozen sets of “basins.” She sells her goods as a street vendor. She is single and has one dependent.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing traditional fabrics for resale

loans.name: El Calvario Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Calvario lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora es la señora María Magdalena C. C. quien hace seis años inicio vendiendo gaseosas y chiverías negocio que con el tiempo y gracias a los préstamos mejoro hasta convertirla en una pequeña pulpería. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Vicenta Bertha P. Téllez desde hace 8 años se dedica a la realización y comercio de tortilla bastimento por excelencia de los  nicaragüenses y Ángela del Carmen Martínez tiene una pulpería desde hace seis años.
texts.en:
The group El Calvario is made up of three hard working women, brave and enterprising. The coordinator is Mrs. María Magdalena C. C., who started selling sodas and other products six years ago. With time and the help of the loans, she has improved her business and has converted it into a small general store. The other members of the group are Vicenta Bertha P. Téllez, who for the last 8 years has been making and selling tortillas, a Nicaraguan staple, and Ángela del Carmen Martínez, who for the last six years has had a general store.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in basic grains, chiverias, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita M. fries eggs and serves them with bread and tea in Abura in the evenings. She is divorced with two children and has received junior high education. She uses her income to take care of her two children.

Anita will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to by a shop by the roadside so she can make more sales.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to expand her business

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 64 años, vive en su casa que es propia, junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos.Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, durante algunas horas del día.  En una pequeña maleta lleva  variedad de productos, y cuando tiene mas pedidos cita a sus clientes a su casa o de lo contrario les lleva los productos a sus casas. Generalmente sus compradoras son las hijas de sus vecinas, quienes semanalmente le pagan, por lo que trabaja muy confiada, y con su mercadería colocada. Esta muy satisfecha por la labor que desempeña; porque es tranquila y además porque hace muchos años atrás, solo tejía y bordaba en su casa, ahora con este negocio tiene muchas  amistades con las que se distrae y a la vez comercializa. Para mas adelante tiene planeado comprarse una vitrina, donde exhibirá sus productos para que sean  más visibles para  sus clientes.Es el  décimo préstamo que tiene con MFP, y sabe que le es de mucha utilidad para aumentar el capital de su negocio, por ello se compromete en pagar  todas sus cuotas a tiempo, además esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar laborando.Ana tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de diferentes productos de belleza (perfumes, talcos, cremas humectantes), de esta manera piensa abastecerse, para ofrecer la mejor variedad de mercadería a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana, 64, lives in her own house together with her husband and 4 children. For 3 years she has sold cosmetics for several hours a day. She transports a various of products in a small suitcase. When she has more orders her clients make an appointment at her home, or alternatively she takes the products to their homes. Generally her purchasers are her neighbours' daughters, who pay her weekly - and because of this she works very confidently, and with very good merchandise. Ana is very satisfied with the work she performs, because it is relaxed, and because for many years before she used to only weave and embroider in her home. Now with this business Ana has many friendships which entertain her and at the same time provide her with business. In the future she wants to purchase a glass display case to display her cosmetics so they are more visible to her customers. This is the tenth loan she has had with MFP and she knows that they are very useful in augmenting her working capital. She promises to make her repayments in time, and additionally is very thankful to all the people that made the loan possible that will allow her to continue working. Ana plans to invest the money in the purchase of different beauty products (perfumes, talcs, moisturising creams) and in this way wants to stock up her shop to offer a better variety of merchandise to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to stock shop

loans.name: Rio Blanco Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rio Blanco lo integran Yesica R., María de los Ángeles A. y María de la Concepción provenientes de Managua. La coordinadora es la señora R. quien vende productos Avon, ropa y zapatos desde hace tres años con la ayuda de su esposo.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son María de los Ángeles A. tiene una pequeña pulpería desde hace tres años y medio, y María de la Concepción P. vende tortillas y productos Avon.
texts.en:
The Rio Blanco group is made up of Yesica R., María de los Ángeles A. and María de la Concepción from Managua. The coordinator is Mrs. R., who has sold Avon products and shoes for three years with the help of her husband. The other members of the group are María de los Ángeles A., who has had a small grocery store for three years, and María de la Concepción P., who sells tortillas and Avon products.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cosmetics, clothing and shoes merchandise.
